description.text:
HAVE FUN! GET CRAZY! SCORE BIG! 
You’re in for one mind-blowing evening of FREE, prize-tastic fitness FUN when you join runners LIKE YOU for the nation’s BIGGEST group fun run at your Tempe Road Runner Sports retail store! Enjoy 60 minutes of FUN as you run (or walk) at your own pace & collect FREE raffle tickets along the way. Then, toast to your adventure in your Lagunitas beer garden while scoring up to $3,000 in FREE raffle prizes! 
So, grab your friends, family & coworkers & join the ADVENTURE... RSVP TODAY! 
 HERE'S THE LOW-DOWN! 

5:30-6:30PM  ARRIVE EARLY TO SIGN-IN & SHOP
6:30-7:30PM  Run or Walk to Fun Checkpoints at Your Own Pace
7:30-8:00PM  Win FREE Raffle Prizes & Enjoy Sleep Dog Beer 
8:30PM-?  Keep the Fun Going at Your After Party + Bonus Raffle

  
*Remember, you’re very important to us, so a light is required for the February, March, April + October Adventure Run events to keep you safe.  
* Register by noon on event day to receive a GPS-guided map emailed to you on event night! 
* Pre-Register & wear your 2015 Adventure Run shirt to get double raffle tickets at all checkpoints & enjoy ice cold Sleepy Dog beer for $1 ($3 otherwise)... 100% of proceeds benefit The Ethiopia Project 
* Score EXTRA raffle tickets when you Like us on Facebook & check out the secret checkpoint on event night! 
  
Your 2015 event schedule: 
  

- February 26th
- March 19th
- April 16th 
- May 21st 
- June 18th 
- July 16th 
- August 20th 
- September 17th 
- October 15th
- November 19th

  
  
AdventureRun.com

description.text:
The World's One and Only 5K Stunt Run 
Interested in another city?  Check the bottom of the page to see where Registration is Open!  
Ever watch an obstacle race TV show or an outrageous clip on YouTube and think, "I’d like to try that!"? Tired of all those “DO NOT ATTEMPT” warnings? Here's your chance to do something about it! The 5K ThrillSeeker Experience is a one-of-a-kind course designed by actual Hollywood stunt producers. It’s more than an obstacle  course race or “fun run”; we are the one and only stunt run! We take an obstacle run and spin it around, give it a shot of espresso, and throw it on a stunt pad! From a creator of Nitro Circus and Thrillbillies comes the run with over a dozen exciting “as seen on TV” stunts that give everyone the opportunity to experience heart-pounding challenges, with their friends, while in a safe environment. Talk about photo ops!  
Participants have the unique opportunity to enjoy thrilling stunts featuring the world’s largest inflatable water slide, the famous Zip N Slide, giant-trike rally, pole vault and 8 more exhilarating stunts. Throw in local food trucks, performers and a family-friendly kid’s 1K event and there’s something for everyone! 
Your 5K ThrillSeeker Packet includes:  
1 Race Bib and Safety Pins 
1 Modern High Quality ThrillSeeker T-Shirt (you'll love how it fits!) 
1 ThrillSeeker Tattoo 
Event Schedule: 
March 28, 2015  
8am-2:30pm  
Kids Run: 3:00pm 
Packet Pickup: Pre-race day packet pick up will be announced shortly. Race day packet pick up will be available for a fee of $5.00.  Be sure to bring your ID. 
Parking: Parking is $10 per vehicle - bring some cash and carpool where available!  
Attire: All attire is acceptable except for the following: shoes with cleats, work boots, spiked or studded costumes or toy weapons.  Costumes are encouraged but not required.  We recommend you wear comfortable shoes, you'll be running/walking/skipping/dancing about 3 miles!  
Bag Check: Bag check is free!  A bag check tag is attached to your bib.  Be sure to keep your bib after the race so you can claim your bags! 
What to bring:  All of your friends, a great attitude, your ID, a towel, spare clothes and extra cash for parking, food and merchandise.

description.text:
FREE EXTREME COUPONING WORKSHOP!  
LIMITED SEATING  
Tuesday, March 31st 
  
 Slash your grocery bill by $100s each month! 
  
Meet Veronica Hall, Master Couponer! Veronica has taught thousands of aspiring and experienced coupon enthusiasts REAL secrets of saving big at the cash register! Join us to learn the tips, tricks and strategy used by the pros. 
Veronica uses a simple method to organize her newspaper coupons in just a few minutes a week. She purchases her favorite name brand groceries and household items for her family of 4 for less than $250 a month! That includes healthy and fresh food! 
Don't miss this FREE opportunity to discover how easy it is to save your hard earned money! 
                                           
Share the savings! 
Invite your friends now. 
Make sure they get a seat before we fill up. 
   
    Can't make it? Attend another session:  
March 30 - Starfire Golf Club in Scottsdale:   RSVP here 
April 1 - Radisson Hotel in Chandler:   RSVP here

And also our morning speaker will be none other than the amazing Tom "Big Al" Schreiter!!  http://www.fortunenow.com 
 Earlybird tickets available only until February 25, 2015! Costs will go up to $40 and then $50 at the door.  RSVP today! :)

description.text: Neotribal the Gathering was founded by a collective partnership with esteemed organizations such as Drumming Sounds, I-solutions LLC, Grovism (501c3), Wellness Sourcing LLC,   Activate The Sacred Family, Raise the Vibration, Vibe Tribe and Festy Vibes    “This vision has been growing for years and many of us have felt a calling to create a vehicle for community transformation and healing and thankfully we have come to this point. The Neotribal Gathering will be another catalyst in the global transformation and healing of our planet and it starts with you… We are opening up this vision to the public after prayer fasting and sharing within our sacred circle.

description.text:
NEOTRIBAL THE GATHERING 
SPRING EQUINOX MARCH 20-22 
2015 
  
ACKNOWEDGE, HONOR, HEAL, 
3 CEREMONIES DESIGNED TO BUILD COMMUNITY AND TRANSFORM OUR WORLD  
  
PRODUCTION FOR THE MEANS OF RESTORATION  
LOVE AND HEALING THROUGH MUSIC, DANCE,ART AND COMMUNITY 
  
5 AREAS OF TRANSFORMATION  
  
NEOTRIBAL STAGE 
  
LIVE MUSIC DJ'S AND DANCE PERFORMANCES FROM  
RANDY BOOGIE, CLAN-DESTINE, CASPER, KINDREAD,KEN KOSHIO, INDIGENOUS SOUL MOVEMENT ,SACRED G'S JERE FRIEDMAN, DANIEL HIRTZS 
MORE TBA  
  
VIBE STAGE  
  
EDM, LOCAL ARTIST COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS AND DISCUSSION  
  
  
  
  
RAINBOW FAMILY VILLLAGE  
  
The Rainbow Family Village, hosted by The Riley Rainbow Family Circus, is an area designed to activate the sacred family to reach a higher level of communication, intimacy, and love through the arts. As a community inspired to heal the family dynamic, we have planned a daily schedule which includes drumming circles, yoga, music, education and playshops. The Family Village programs are designed to bring families to a deep space of engagement and connectivity. If you are a family that has looked for a place to create community, we are HERE!  
  
HEART BEAT CENTER  
  
It is said that the drum is the heartbeat of mother earth  and those that have lost their rhythm have lost their connection to the planet... For some there is a need to find that rhythm again for others there is a hunger to deepen that relationship to the earth  but for all there is a connection to each other and the planet through the Drum. Join us in the HEARTBEAT of Neotribal a space to create learn and experience healing through music dance and sharing. Instruments Drums and percussion will be provided by Neotribal free of charge for all that attend our workshops... 
  
HEALING VILLAGE  
The “Neotribal” Healing Village offers Holistic Health & Healing for all participants of the gathering! Experience natural healing in many different forms. Our healing energy is a vehicle that will bring positive transformation to our families and our planet at large. Join us for hands on healing, bodywork, energy balancing, yoga, meditation, prayer and wisdom talks. Experience positive self care through spiritual & holistic education and cultural development. 
  
  
 
  
Neotribal is a family based gathering that will take place during the spring equinox 2015 March 20 -22. Over three days of camping participants will have an opportunity to take part ceremony, music, art and healing and your participation is a vital part of integral process of the gathering so thank you for your valuable heart space. 
 Neotribal the Gathering was founded by a collective partnership with esteemed organizations such as Drumming Sounds, I-solutions LLC, Groovism (501c3), Wellness Sourcing LLC,   Activate The Sacred Family, Raise the Vibration, Vibe Tribe and Festy Vibes    “This vision has been growing for years and many of us have felt a calling to create a vehicle for community transformation and healing and thankfully we have come to this point. The Neotribal Gathering will be another catalyst in the global transformation and healing of our planet and it starts with you… We are opening up this vision to the public after prayer fasting and sharing within our sacred circle.

description.text: Daring Adventures is a nonprofit organization committed to improving the lives of individuals with disabilities and significant life challenges through the power of outdoor recreation.
description.html: Daring Adventures is a nonprofit organization committed to improving the lives of individuals with disabilities and significant life challenges through the power of outdoor recreation.

description.text:
Last May, a group of 30+ volunteers carried Anthony Castle to the bottom of the Grand Canyon. A 14-year-old with an infectious smile and Duchenne muscular dystrophy, Anthony warmed hearts around the world with his story of courage and determination. While many people thought Anthony’s bucket list item to put his feet in the Colorado River was too ambitious, the nonprofit Daring Adventures, friends and family gathered support to make his dream come true. Anthony and his family demonstrate incredible strength and determination—focusing on what CAN be done instead of what can't. 
  
From practice hikes to the final steps of the journey, the producers, Equator Creative Media documented this inspiring journey that was featured in USA Today’s Inspiration Nation. The documentary will premiere at Daring Adventures’ fundraiser, Tuesday, March 31 at Tempe Center for the Arts. Doors open at 6 pm,  when Anthony will be offering autographs, film begins at 7:00 pm.  
  
The world premiere of “Anthony’s Adventure,” is an uplifting story with an empowering message of the importance of living in the present and appreciating life. Tickets are $15 each or six-pack for $80 before March 1; $20 each or six-pack for $100 after March 1 , encouraging everyone to bring their friends and family for a night of inspiration.

Last May, a group of 30+ volunteers carried Anthony Castle to the bottom of the Grand Canyon. A 14-year-old with an infectious smile and Duchenne muscular dystrophy, Anthony warmed hearts around the world with his story of courage and determination. While many people thought Anthony’s bucket list item to put his feet in the Colorado River was too ambitious, the nonprofit Daring Adventures, friends and family gathered support to make his dream come true. Anthony and his family demonstrate incredible strength and determination—focusing on what CAN be done instead of what can't.

 

From practice hikes to the final steps of the journey, the producers, Equator Creative Media documented this inspiring journey that was featured in USA Today’s Inspiration Nation. The documentary will premiere at Daring Adventures’ fundraiser, Tuesday, March 31 at Tempe Center for the Arts. Doors open at 6 pm,  when Anthony will be offering autographs, film begins at 7:00 pm. 

 

The world premiere of “Anthony’s Adventure,” is an uplifting story with an empowering message of the importance of living in the present and appreciating life. Tickets are $15 each or six-pack for $80 before March 1; $20 each or six-pack for $100 after March 1 , encouraging everyone to bring their friends and family for a night of inspiration.

description.text: Adam Jones has been a life long resident of Louisville, Kentucky. Today this internationally recognized photographer specializing in travel, nature, and wildlife. He travels extensively throughout the U.S. and around the world creating his distinctive images. Jones's award-winning photography has been widely published in magazines, posters, calendars, books, and in national advertising campaigns for clients such as Ford, Eddie Bauer, Miller Beer, and Coldwater Creek.    Adam Jones is recognized worldwide as a prolific stock photographer with his photographs represented by Getty Images, Tony Stone, Visuals Unlimited, Photo Researchers, Orion Press, Oxford Scientific, and Danita Delimont Stock Photography. His work has sold for editorial and commercial uses in over 30 countries. Adam is in great demand for his beautiful graphic nature images and his clean distinctive travel imagery. He is equally at home in remote wilderness area as he is hanging out of a helicopter capturing aerials of major urban areas.    Adam's publication credits also include: National Geographic Books, Life Magazine, National Wildlife Federation, Audubon, Sierra Club, Disney, People Magazine, Hallmark Cards, and hundreds of textbooks. In 1995 the BBC Wildlife Photographer of the Year contest honored Adam by selecting one of his images from over 19, 000 entries, as the winner in the "In Praise of Plants" category.    Adam's images have been featured in seven coffee-table books, with three released in 2004. These include his popular instructional book: The Step-by-Step Photography Workshop, which he authored, The Great Smoky Mountains Natural Wonder National Park, and Great Smoky Mountains Simply Beautiful. Due for release in fall 2006, Farcountry Press is releasing Adam's latest book entitled Kentucky Simply Beautiful.    Adam is a very popular and respected workshop instructor and lecturer. Adam teaches photography workshops around the world helping students reach their full potential in the exciting world of photography. He has taught for Canon, Popular Photography & Imaging, Maine Photographic Workshops, Rocky Mountain School of Photography, and Great American Photography Workshops. Adam is noted for his enthusiastic down to earth approach and his ability to communicate effectively with all skill levels. In 2003, Adam sold all his medium format and 35mm film equipment in favor of capturing images exclusively with Canon's 35mm digital cameras.

FREE EXTREME COUPONING WORKSHOP! 
LIMITED SEATING 
Monday, March 30th 
  
 Slash your grocery bill by $100s each month! 
  
Meet Veronica Hall, Master Couponer! Veronica has taught thousands of aspiring and experienced coupon enthusiasts REAL secrets of saving big at the cash register! Join us to learn the tips, tricks and strategy used by the pros.

description.text:
Beautillion is a celebration of the achievements of young African American men, ages 16 to 19, who are high school juniors and seniors in Metropolitan Phoenix. These young men represent a select few of the many candidates nominated to be honored at Beautillion 2015. Each Beau is chosen in recognition of his demonstrated achievements in academics, sports, the arts, community and church involvement, and his overall commitment to the advancement of African Americans. In addition, all Beaus must be college bound. 
Come and enjoy an evening at the 2015 Beautillion to honor our Beaus. 
Dinner will be served. 
Formal attire required. 
For more information about the 2015 Beautillion go to: http://www.jackandjillphoenix.org/#!beautillion-2015/c1s5j

description.text:
The Kyrene Parent Summit is a night of parent education and is open to anyone who would like to attend.  Our goal is to provide parents and caregivers with important information that positively impacts the education, health and safety of children.    
The evening will consist of 8-10  presentations for parents to select from, childcare, a vendor fair, and dinner for the family.   Parents and community members can attend Kyrene Parent summit for the nominal cost of $5.00 per adult, children attend for FREE! 
  

  
Kyrene Parent Summit 
Thursday, March 26, 2015 
Centennial Middle School 

4:45 pm Dinner and Vendor Fair 
6:00 pm Welcome by Superintendent 
6:10 pm first class session
7:15 pm second class session
8:10 pm end of event

 When you purchase your ticket you will choose ONE class for EACH session (session 1 and session 2) per adult and just ONE class for children for childcare (children will not switch classes). 
Classes will fill  up, please make just ONE selection per session for adults and just one selection for children.  Please make sure your child is the appropriate age for the class selection. 

  
 Session 1 Adult Classes: 

5 Love Languages: Are your gifts not being received well? Does your child put more value in to what you do and get for them as opposed to what you say to them?  Join us and discover your child’s love language and how it can help you teach and discipline more effectively.  -elementary ages

Understanding the New State Assessments (AZMERIT and NSCS) For Students with Disabilities This session will provide parents of children that have an Individual Education Program (IEP) information about the new state assessments. -all ages 


Ready, Set, Talk!  As parents, we want our kids to be able to talk to us about anything, right?  This workshop will address how we can set the tone in our conversations to make it more likely our children will talk to us about the good things, the bad things, and the in-between things that are going on in their lives. And how we can get the conversation started on sensitive issues, including safety issues, physical changes, healthy and unhealthy relationships, and how to set personal boundaries. -all ages 


Supporting Your Student with the "New Math" Come find out about what math looks like in the classroom today. Parents will walk away with strategies to support math at home and resources. Following the book Old Dogs, New Math this class helps parents of K-5 students with addition, subtraction, multiplication and division strategies for the “new math”.  - best for grades K-4 


Developing Great Readers What is Literacy Development?  What are the standards for reading?  How can parents support literacy development in the home?  Parents of elementary to early middle school students come and learn about the Big 5 of Reading and walk away with strategies to support literacy development at home.  -elementary through middle school  


Navigating the 5th to 6th Transition A panel of our own Kyrene middle school teachers and administrators will provide a brief overview of how to prepare for the middle school transition.  Come with your questions!  Half this session will be dedicated for Q and A.  - entering 6th grade 2015-2016 
  

SESSION 2 Adult Classes 


5 Essential Tools To Build a Great Relationship With Your Daughter In this session you'll learn a key parenting tools to better navigate the relationship with your daughter. The tween years will be here fast so come prepared to take notes - You'll leave inspired! -all ages 


Building Supports for Your Child with Anxiety  This session will provide parents information about the signs of anxiety and strategies to utilize that will support their child.  -all ages 


"The Colors Activity” -Know Your Personality Style.  This presentation is fun and open for both students and their parents. True Colors is a fun interactive tool used to identify our various Personality styles. You and your child can learn your “Color” and how that impacts learning, communication and goal setting.Parents can choose to pickup their child from childcare to attend this class together.  -5th grade and up 


Helping Kids Make Good Choices We teach our kids to make good choices every day, as our kids get older the risks increase. We can’t control everything our child will be exposed to in this world, how do we protect them when we are not with them. This class address the opportunities that our children have, sometimes at a very young age, to participate in activities that could risk their health and well-being. We’ll talk about the external and internal pressures that influence the decisions our kids make about risk behaviors, and what we can do as parents to help them make good choices even when we aren’t around.  - all ages 


Teen Drug Trends Tempe Narcotics officer and Kyrene parent will present teen drug trends in our area.  This eye-opening presentation includes information on synthetic drugs and electronic drugs like e-cigarettes and hookah pens.  - 5th grade and up 
  

Children's Childcare and Class Options (choose one 2 hour class) 


Early Learning Center     Ages 3-5 years old    Must be potty trained. 


Movie and Popcorn     1st -5th grade   Kyrene Kids Club will be showing a kid friendly movie while kids enjoy popcorn, coloring and board games. 


Girl Power!  Grades 3-6th   Join us for a fun evening where girls will participate in group activities that explore self-esteem, learn about creating a positive self-image and becoming a positive role model! There will be lots of fun activites and art projects. This class is lead by our Kyrene Prevention Specialists. 


Getting the “Angries” out!    Grades K-2    Everyone gets the “angries”-it’s a  normal part of life! This class is interactive and fun where your child will learn how to express their anger and frustration in a positive and productive way! Students will participate in group activities and crafts that will equip them with proven coping strategies to help calm their “grumpies” and to process their feelings in a healthier way! 


Sylvan Robotics     Grades 2-6   This fun class features the LEGO™ Education products and curriculum to teach STEM concepts in a fun, interactive, and engaging way.  Students work in pairs using LEGO ™ Education’s WeDo ™ products to build different robots and learn simple computer programming concepts to animate their “bot”.

We can’t control everything our child will be exposed to in this world, how do we protect them when we are not with them. This class address the opportunities that our children have, sometimes at a very young age, to participate in activities that could risk their health and well-being. We’ll talk about the external and internal pressures that influence the decisions our kids make about risk behaviors, and what we can do as parents to help them make good choices even when we aren’t around.  - all ages

  • Teen Drug Trends Tempe Narcotics officer and Kyrene parent will present teen drug trends in our area.  This eye-opening presentation includes information on synthetic drugs and electronic drugs like e-cigarettes and hookah pens.  - 5th grade and up

     

    Children's Childcare and Class Options (choose one 2 hour class)

  • Early Learning Center     Ages 3-5 years old    Must be potty trained.

  • Movie and Popcorn     1st -5th grade   Kyrene Kids Club will be showing a kid friendly movie while kids enjoy popcorn, coloring and board games.

  • Girl Power!  Grades 3-6th   Join us for a fun evening where girls will participate in group activities that explore self-esteem, learn about creating a positive self-image and becoming a positive role model! There will be lots of fun activites and art projects. This class is lead by our Kyrene Prevention Specialists.

  • Getting the “Angries” out!    Grades K-2    Everyone gets the “angries”-it’s a  normal part of life! This class is interactive and fun where your child will learn how to express their anger and frustration in a positive and productive way! Students will participate in group activities and crafts that will equip them with proven coping strategies to help calm their “grumpies” and to process their feelings in a healthier way!

  • Sylvan Robotics     Grades 2-6   This fun class features the LEGO™ Education products and curriculum to teach STEM concepts in a fun, interactive, and engaging way.  Students work in pairs using LEGO ™ Education’s WeDo ™ products to build different robots and learn simple computer programming concepts to animate their “bot”.

description.text:
Title: 
Keep Calm & Carry On: Understanding the Difficult Emotions of Caregiving 
  
Overview: 
Coming soon...  
  
Presented by: 
Lori Milus, RN, BSN, BC  
Lori Milus joined Aurora West in 2013 as the Director of Nursing bringing over 25 years of experience to our team. Prior to joining Aurora, Lori served as the Director of Behavioral Health Services at Carondelet Health Network in Tucson for nearly a decade. She has also worked as Program Director for St. Luke’s Generations program and has worked for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) and for the Arizona Department of Health (ADHS) as a public and federal surveyor. 
Lori began her career in the behavioral health field as she felt it was her calling. Lori’s two primary professional focuses are patient dignity and patient safety. She has provided presentations nationally and has been published in Nursing Diagnosis-Psychiatric in Nursing Diagnosis, Application to Clinical Practice, Lynda Juall Carpenito-Moyet (Psychiatric Chapters). Lori graduated from Scottsdale Community College with an Associate Degree in Nursing and received her Bachelors of Science in Nursing and a Master of Science in Nursing from Grand Canyon University. She is certified by the American Nurse Credentialing Center – Mental Health and Chemical Dependency Nursing. Lori is also a Legal Nursing Consultant having testified in a number of cases related to patient safety and nursing care.

description.text:
Join us as we explore what it means to create a Beloved Community in which we value all women, men, girls and boys to the very last girl. Participants will include primary purpose sexual and domestic violence programs as well representatives from a diverse group of culturally specific and underrepresented programs and groups.  Lunch and snacks will be provided throughout the day.  
Scholarships are available. Please contact info@acesdv.org to inquire.  
Program Members: If you need information on hotels, please contact Zenaida Medina at zenaida@acesdv.org.  
  
Thank you to our sponsors: 
 
  
 
 Registration, Cancellation and Payment: Registration is required for the training. 
  • Register early! Training fills quickly and registration is handled on a first come, first serve basis. Space is limited.  
 • Cancellations must be made at least one week prior. 
 • No refunds and registration fees are non-transferable to another training if participants do not cancel at least one week prior, per cancellation notice NO SHOWS will be charged a $50.00 fee.  
 For more information and/or to become a member please contact our Admin Department at 602-279-2900 or email info@acesdv.org

description.text: Join bestselling author and mental health expert, Rebecca Hintze, M.Sc. for an evening of happiness as she discusses the contents of her new book, "Essentially Happy!"  The book is based on research regarding the connection between mental health and nutrition (particularly doTERRA's LLV supplement program), life-style choices, and healthy relationships.  With over 350 million people suffering from depression world-wide, Rebecca Hintze offers powerful solutions available through mother nature.  Join Rebecca for an event you will cherish and one that will change the way you look at recovering from mental illness.

All proceeds from the 2015 AllStar Agent Auction will contribute to the Agents Benefiting Children fundraising effort. The year-long endeavor will culminate with an Olympiad style event on April 24, 2015 at Scottsdale Stadium.
The Agents Benefiting Children Olympiad is a fun and competitive day for the residential real estate market. Our team will join other residential brokerage teams and duel it out against other in Boccee Ball, Baggo, Football Toss and a Free Throw Competition.
This one-day event will be held on the field at the Scottsdale Stadium, home of the San Francisco Giants.
The Olympiad is a ‘Thank You’ as well as a great team building and networking event for the residential real estate market.

description.text:
The 2015 AllStar Agent Auction promises to be the premier event of the year. We are fortunate to have the cream of the crop of most productive agents in the Phoenix Metro Area. 
 If you ever wanted to get one-on-one, face-to-face personal time with the best Realtors in Arizona to ask them exactly what they've done to be so successful, then this event is for you! 
On Thursday March 26th from 6-8p the All-Star Agent Auction is where you can get personal time with agents like Walt Danley, Russell Shaw, Bobby Lieb, Robert Joffe, Lisa Wadey, Joshua Smith, Kenny Klaus, Andrew Bloom & more!! 
Bidding is not required but Attendees will have a chance to win a two-hour one-on-one session with any one of our top performing individuals. Their specialties range from luxury properties, to farm area dominance, to building and running an efficient team, to effective farming/marketing and the gamut in between. 
Also get an opportunity to get personal time with Michael Maher – New York Times best-selling author of 7 Levels of communication! 
All proceeds benefit children's charities - it's an opportunity for you to grow your business and help Arizona children at the same time! 
No matter what your passion or burning desire is to get yourself to the next level, a winning bid for one of these upper echelon agents can set you on a path for greater success. 

Come for your chance to win!
Come for the networking!
Come to support The Care Fund!

description.text: Benefits 2 Work is a statewide program of Arizona Bridge to Independent Living (ABIL) that educates and supports individuals receiving Social Society benefits in understanding how employment and benefits work together. Assistance can be provided through Work Incentive Consultants and/or through the Disability Benefits 101 (DB101). DB101 is a user-friendly online tool that helps work through the myths and confusion of Social Security benefits, healthcare, and employment. DB101 can also be used in effective transition planning with or without being on benefits. DB101 can ease fears and empower people with disabilities in making informed decisions that will lead to a more financially productive life. DB101is available at www.az.db101.org.

description.text:
DISABILITY BENEFITS 101 TRAIN-THE-TRAINER 
March 25th -  
Two Different Trainings for Your Needs  
Who is this training for? 
Tier 2 - 8:30AM - 12:30PM 
Service professionals who provide direct or coordinate employment based services. 
Tier 1 - 1:30PM - 5PM 
Everyone else - specialist assisting with getting people on benefits, teachers, organization and support groups that support people with disabilities. 
*Note training is tier specific. Pick the training that you think best fits your needs. 
What will you get from this training? 
This training will provide materials, technical assistance, and support to providers, community organizations, and educators to incorporate DB101 into their everyday business practices and training regimens… without having to learn a whole new skill-set. 
The training will also demonstrate: 

How to motive consumers (on Social security benefits or not) towards productive and the most independent lives utilizing DB101
How to use the DB101 to support members to makes plans to work, and plan a transition to self-sufficiency (employment)
When and how paid work affects access to health care and benefits for students and working-age adults
How and when to use these tools for targeted audiences;
Role modeling of promising best practices
Talking points and training tools participants will find intuitive, contextual, and easy to use after the training
How to increase measurable, program- and consumer-desired outcomes through DB101 tools and information
The benefits of joining the Work Incentive Information Network (WIIN) as coherent partners to meet real-time information needs

Each participate will need to complete a tier-specific competency related to the training and will receive documentation of DB101 competency. 
What do we want from this training? 
This training is to assist with the sustainability of the support and education providers, organizations, and people with disabilities and their family get from Arizona Disability Benefits 101 and the Work Incentive Information Network. 
Trainers with documentation of DB101 competency will be asked to: 

Serve as the DB101 point of contact for their organization
Solicit and train peers and colleagues in their tier group
Petition organizational support and buy-in to become a member of WIIN
Serve as an ambassador for DB101 and WIIN

description.text:
The Be Your BEST Foundation had its first class in January of 2013 and has continued to grow since then! We have a 5-class series and repeat this 3 times throughout the year--every round of classes has a great review of past material and fresh information to always give a reason to keep coming! You can join the classes at any point, though we will recommend you "catch up" by watching previous class recordings on our website All classes and events are 100% FREE of charge.
The mission of the Be Your BEST Foundation is to empower the individual and the community in achieving transformation. Our mission statement is as follows:
The Be Your BEST Foundation creates a culture of hope, passion and dignity through our connected community and BEST Achievement Program.
We seek to create true happiness and lasting transformation.

description.text:
The Be Your BEST Foundation (www.beyourbestfoundation.org) and City of Mesa are teaming up to provide informational and inspirational guidance to all City of Mesa Employees. We invite you to join our classes that focus on each letter of the BEST acronym on the following dates: 

Intro Class - March 23rd
Body Class - March 30th
Emotional State Class - April 6th
Support / Transformation Class - April 13th

You could say these classes are for anyone looking for Transformation--looking to become their BEST. There is a unique community created by people uniting with this common purpose. We want the best of each other and strive to provide the support and tools to help individuals, communities, and cities truly become their BEST. 
We hope you'll join us and let us know of anything we can help answer. Keep being your BEST. 
Be Your BEST Team - beyourbestaz@gmail.com 
For Common FAQs, please click to head to our  
"FAQs for Attending Classes" page

description.text:
Glendale, Arizona – March 28th, 2015 – The public is invited to join Compel Church as they host their 2nd Annual Helicopter Egg Drop on the practice field of Mountain Ridge High School, located at 22800 N 67th Ave, Glendale, AZ 85310 on March 28th at 9am. The event will feature a helicopter egg drop, 30,000 eggs, inflatables, food trucks, tour of the helicopter and giveaways for the kids. 
Children from birth to 12 years old will be given an opportunity to participate in separate hunts according to their age groups. Inflatables, face painting and free cotton candy will be open during registration. All activities are free. Food is available for purchase from food trucks, Luncha Libre, Waffle Love & Little Jimmy’s Italian Ice. 
Lead pastor, Jacob Jester, hopes that this will be a time that the church can connect with the community, saying, “Our goal is to provide a fun and safe environment for children and their families to come and enjoy the day with us.” 
Compel Church is a new church in the N. Glendale area. They meet at Mountain Ridge High School every Sunday morning at 10am for weekly services. Their mission is to be a “church that anyone can call home.”

description.text: Join bestselling author and mental health expert, Rebecca Hintze, M.Sc. for a morning of happiness as she discusses the contents of her new book, "Essentially Happy!"  The book is based on research regarding the connection between mental health and nutrition (particularly doTERRA's LLV supplement program), life-style choices, and healthy relationships.  With over 350 million people suffering from depression world-wide, Rebecca Hintze offers powerful solutions available through mother nature.  Join Rebecca for an event you will cherish and one that will change the way you look at recovering from mental illness.

description.text: TeamWork Online is the #1 place to find a job in sports and live events. Our clients include over 770 of the best organizations in the industry, including; NBA, NFL, MLB, NHL, MLS and many more… Over 80,000 people have been hired through TeamWorkOnline.  We host networking events across the country at our client's games with the goal of giving people a unique experience to meet and build relationships with senior level executives within sports and live events.  For more information visit: TeamWorkOnline.com

description.text:
WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW -  
TeamWork Online's Teammate Networking Events give you a chance to expand and grow your network with key senior level executives within the sports industry. Following the event every attendee will watch the Phoenix Suns vs Sacramento Kings - your ticket is included with your registration.  Bring plenty of business cards to pass out to all the people that you will meet! After the networking event, join us for the Team Night Out event, where you can watch the pre-game warm ups from the premium seats. 
THE WHO - Executives scheduled to attend: 
 Maria Baier 
Sr. VP of Communications and Public Affairs Phoenix Suns  Dan Siekmann VP of Broadcast Productions Phoenix Suns  Travis Apple VP of Ticket Sales and Service Phoenix Suns  Karen Rausch VP of Human Resources Phoenix Suns  Doug Chisholm Sr. Director of Marketing Partnership Activation  Phoenix Suns   Matt Fish Owner Rebound Magazine - Official Magazine of the NBRPA Chapter President - NBRPA   Gary Gelinas President CSH International  Jeff Morander  Executive Vice President, Ticket Sales and Strategy  Arizona Coyotes   Jacob Widerschein Manager of Ticket Sales and Service Sun Devil Athletics and the Aspire Group  Damon Olstead Team Leader - Ticket Sales Sun Devil Athletics and the Aspire Group 
  
***Executive attendee list to be updated regularly 
  
TICKETS - How do I get them?  Where are the seats? 
All attendees are provided a ticket to the Phoenix Suns vs Sacramento Kings game following the event. Tickets will be given to each attendee at registration, prior to the beginning of the event. Seats are located in sections 106 and section 214.   
  
 Refunds, Exchanges and Cancelations:   TeamWork Online will provide a refund if, and only if, a refund request has been made in writing to TeamWork Online no later than 72 hours prior to the event. Otherwise, all sales are final. All written requests for refunds must be made through a user’s personal Eventbrite account.  Exchanges will not be provided of any kind.  Should an event be canceled or postponed TeamWork Online will notify attendees in writing and do everything within its power to provide a refund.

description.text:
About this event: 
  
Damage Prevention & Safety Seminars are free. All contractor and utility excavation personnel, safety managers, trainers, foremen and supervisors working in the private or public sector in Arizona are welcome and encouraged to attend. These seminars provide important information to prevent serious injuries and protect the utilities we all rely on every day. Speakers include representatives from Arizona 811 (formerly Arizona Blue Stake), utility owners/operators including natural gas transmission and distribution, electricity and communications; the Arizona Corporation Commission; and the Arizona Utility Contractors Association (AZUCA). 


Check-in for this seminar will begin at 6:30 a.m. and the program will begin promptly at 7 a.m. 


Complimentary breakfast is included. 


Program duration is 2.5-3 hours. 


Seating is first-come, first-served. Parties who want to sit together should arrive early. 


  
  
Please adhere to the following: 


Because of space limitations, and so we can plan for meals, pre-registration is required. 


Attendees must register at least one week prior to the seminar date. If registration is full, a waiting list will be created and individuals will be contacted in the order they were placed on the waiting list. Unfortunately we cannot accommodate walk-in attendees!  


Companies and local governments are welcome to send multiple attendees. However, a registration form must be completed for each individual who is attending. 


Attendees are expected to honor their RSVP. Substitutions can be made at any time. NOTE:This is a free event; however individuals who RSVP and fail to show up without canceling at least 72 hours in advance will be billed $30 to cover the costs of pre-paid meals and training expenses. If you RSVP but cannot attend, please cancel your reservation at least 72 hours in advance or designate a substitute attendee from the excavation industry! 


For the benefit of all seminar participants, professional and courteous behavior is expected at all times. Alcohol is not served or permitted at Damage Prevention & Safety Seminars. At their discretion, organizers reserve the right to refuse entry and/or continued participation to any individual who is disruptive.  


As a courtesy to other attendees, please put mobile devices on vibrate or silent mode when the program begins. If you must take or make a call, kindly do so outside of the training room. 


  
If you have questions, please contact: 
  
Sunita Rowe, Public Services Liaison 
Arizona 811 (formerly Arizona Blue Stake) 
sunita.rowe@Arizona811.com or (602) 659-7508

description.text: Topgolf is the emerging global leader in golf entertainment. Players hit golf balls containing computer microchips that track each shot’s accuracy and distance while also awarding points for hitting targets on the outfield. Topgolf offers an upscale, laid-back experience that features climate-controlled hitting bays and an impressive food and beverage menu crafted by our executive chef. Mix in dynamic event spaces for groups of all sizes, and Topgolf stands as the premier entertainment complex where the competition of sport meets the neighborhood’s favorite hangout.

description.text:
Tee up for Topgolf's 3rd Annual Championship Series! 
Each tournament features a different format, so register for one or all remaining. Show off your skills and claim the glory – or, in this case, a Champion’s title, thousands in prizes, participant swag and, of course, the envy of your crew. 
  
Registration for each tournament includes: 

2 hours of Topgolf play per tournament
FREE t-shirt specific to each tournament
FREE Topgolf Swag
FREE continental breakfast
FREE 20-minute golf lesson (TG20) with Topgolf instructor 

 Participants should arrive on-site at 9:30 a.m. with game play beginning at 10 a.m. 
 For complete rules on each tournament, please visit topgolf.com/tgc. 
 *Prize structure is based on a full field, so prizes may vary, by tournament, based on the number of registered players. The chance to win is free for all tournament participants, and no consideration is required. Winning prizes of value in a golf-based competition may effect a golfer’s status as an amateur under the Rules of Golf as published by the USGA and R&A. If you have questions, please consult the rules and/or the governing bodies. http://www.usga.org/rules/

description.text:
WORKSHOP: MY CASE PLAN, MY VOICE 
Presented by: Marjory Curry, MPA 
Executive Director, Marjory Curry & Associates LLC 
  
Purpose: This workshop is beneficial for foster parents, social workers, juvenile probation officers, mental health service providers and other community professionals who work directly with trauma-exposed youth. This workshop will help service providers to identify ways to include trauma-exposed youth in the decision-making process for developing interventions and identifying appropriate services. Including youth the decision-making process pertaining to their individual case plan will increase compliance rates, increase protective factors, and improve outcomes for trauma-exposed youth. The workshop will address four areas: Trauma and delinquency; Trauma and case planning; Client Voice; and “System-induced” Trauma. 
  
Competency Objectives: 

Participants will understand trauma’s impact on development.
Participants will understand the relationship between trauma and delinquency.
Participants will view non-compliance issues through a trauma lens.
Participants will identify ways to remove barriers to case plan compliance.
Participants will understand the role of client voice in the decision-making process.
Participants will be able to identify and reduce system-induced traumatic experiences by clients.
Participants will be able to draft trauma-informed case plans.

  
TEACHING METHODS:  
This workshop will consist of a mixed teaching method to support various learning styles. The workshop will be presented in a lecture format using a PowerPoint Presentation; but also including discussions and activities.

Purpose: This workshop is beneficial for foster parents, social workers, juvenile probation officers, mental health service providers and other community professionals who work directly with trauma-exposed youth. Including youth the decision-making process pertaining to their individual case plan will increase compliance rates, increase protective factors, and improve outcomes for trauma-exposed youth. The workshop will address four areas: Trauma and delinquency; Trauma and case planning; Client Voice; and “System-induced” Trauma.

 

Competency Objectives:

  • Participants will understand trauma’s impact on development.
  • Participants will understand the relationship between trauma and delinquency.
  • Participants will view non-compliance issues through a trauma lens.
  • Participants will identify ways to remove barriers to case plan compliance.
  • Participants will understand the role of client voice in the decision-making process.
  • Participants will be able to identify and reduce system-induced traumatic experiences by clients.
  • Participants will be able to draft trauma-informed case plans.

 

TEACHING METHODS:

This workshop will consist of a mixed teaching method to support various learning styles. The workshop will be presented in a lecture format using a PowerPoint Presentation; but also including discussions and activities.

description.text:
This special 2-hour seminar will be presented by Melissa Hartwig, co-creator of the Whole30 program and New York Times bestselling author of It Starts With Food and The Whole30: The 30-Day Guide to Total Health and Food Freedom. 
  
PREPARE YOURSELF FOR THE WHOLE30, USING TIPS AND TRICKS STRAIGHT FROM OUR NEW BOOK, THE WHOLE30. 
New to the Whole30? Perfect. Learn more about the program, the results you can expect, and how to prepare between now and January 1st. A Whole30 veteran? You'll value the insider tips, personalized advice, and community connections you'll make at this limited-seating event.  
In this two hour seminar, Melissa will cover:  

The goals of the Whole30: mental, emotional, and physical
How it works--why 30 days, why it's "no cheats, no slips," and why we don't let you make pancakes. 
How to prepare for the program 
Tips for creating habits that stick and maximizing your willpower dollars
How to manage some of the social, psychological, and time pressures that can throw us off our healthy-eating game. 

Finally, we'll have copies of our first book, It Starts With Food available at the event for sale ($20), and we'll find time for Melissa to sign your copy as well.
 
DO YOUR HOMEWORK 
Because we have limited time at this event, Melissa expects you to do some basic homework.  

Read the Whole30 program rules at http://whole30.com/whole30-program-rules
Read either It Starts With Food or our basic Manifesto series on sugar, alcohol, grains, legumes, and dairy to better understand why we eliminate those food groups on the program

  
SEMINAR DETAILS 
This seminar runs from 6 PM - 8 PM, with a book signing/meet and greet until 8:30 PM. We'll also open up the Lululemon store just for you, so you can shop after the event is over! 
Seating is limited to just 80 guests, so Melissa can better address your individual questions. With your registration fee, you'll also receive samples of some Whole30® Approved products we love. 
  
REFUND POLICY  
If you purchase a ticket, but discover due to work or family obligations you are unable to come to the event, please let us know in writing at least one week prior to the event date for a full refund. You may also transfer your ticket to another person--just email headquarters@whole9life.com with their name and email address. We do not grant refunds to attendees who simply fail to show up for the event.

description.text: Smart Faith is an organization dedicated to training Christian believers and helping them to grow more confident in their convictions, more courageous in their conversations, and more culturally aware of conflicting worldviews. Smart Faith seeks to do this through yearly conferences as well as other training and educational opportunities scheduled throughout the year.  For our annual conference, we bring top speakers and educators from around the Phoenix area, to give invaluable instruction and encouragement to Christian teens, college students, young adults and parents on the topics of faith, truth and reason. For more information, please visit smartfaith.org.Canyon church of Christ has graciously offered to host the 2015 conference again and we are so incredibly thankful to them for doing so. The event will be held in their beautiful building located in the North Phoenix area, in the heart of Arizona's amazing desert surroundings.  For more information about the church, please visit canyonchurch.org.

March 28th - Conference Schedule 
8:30 - 8:55 AM - Doors open 9:00 - 9:45 AM - Brent Simpson - special guest 9:45 - 10:00 AM - break 10:00 - 10:45 AM - "Feet Firmly Planted in Mid-Air: The Truth about Truth" ~ Shawn White 10:45 - 11:00 AM - break 11:00 - 11:45 AM - "Evolution's Evidence Examined" ~ James Umber 11:45 AM - 1:00 PM - Lunch 1:00 - 1:45 PM - "Why Trust the Bible?" ~ Robby Lashua 1:45 - 2:00 PM - break 2:00 - 2:45 PM - "Reason or Rhetoric? Homosexuality, the Bible, and the Debate on Facebook" ~ Marty Clapp 2:45 - 3:00 PM - break 3:00 - 3:45 PM - "Why the World Craves Super Heroes: An Argument For God" ~ Jacob Allee 3:45 - 4:00 PM - break 4:00 - 4:45 PM - Panel Q&A 4:45 - 5:00 PM - Wrap-up  
Just a few of stipulations regarding this conference: 1. This is for teens - the age range is from 6th grade through freshman in college. 2. If an adult wants to attend, that is fine, but they must register and bring a teen with them (the teen must be registered, too). 3. There will be periods of Q&A during the event, we ask that if adults attend that they refrain from asking questions during our formal Q&A time and allow the teens this time to interact with the speakers. 4. We will not be providing lunch on that day, but there are places within walking distance from the host site that teens can go to (Taco Bell, In N Out, Chili's, Subway, etc). This means that they should either plan to bring extra money for lunch or bring a lunch with them. 5. We will have snacks and drinks available for purchase during the conference if anyone wishes to buy those. 6. We will have limited space for merchandise tables so there will be some apologetics items available for sale as well. 7. The location we are at will seat about 280 people - so first come first serve. :)

description.text: Welcome to Taste of Tucson Downtown – Culinary and Cultural tours. We are ready to lead you on a delectable and informative tour through the historic sights and local eateries of Downtown Tucson. On our three hour walking tour you’ll experience the rich history of Tucson; walking along the first city walls of the Presidio built by original Tucson settlers, learning about the history of the classic Fox Theatre, strolling under the arches of the Old Pima County Courthouse and much more. Along our journey we will indulge your taste buds with sample cuisine at 5 eateries where you will learn what inspires their chef’s culinary creations. You will even get to ride our newly launched modern streetcar. Bring your camera and your appetite because it’s going to be a feast of fun. Order your tickets today to join one of our upcoming tours atwww.TasteofTucsonDowntown.com

description.text:
The Arizona Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies has formed an imprint subsidiary to publish historical fiction centered in the medieval and Renaissance periods. Founded in 2011, Bagwyn Books is dedicated to publishing well-researched historical fiction that is appropriate for an audience ranging from young adult (ages 14+) to an adult audience. We are open to different styles and genres of writing.
Created to give lovers of the medieval and Renaissance eras an opportunity to express their creativity in fiction, Bagwyn Books is a history-lover's dream. Bagwyn Books invites the submission of proposals for book-length fiction manuscripts from new, emerging, and established authors. Priority will be given to works centering on or connected to the medieval and Renaissance periods (400 C.E. to 1700 C.E.).

description.text:
Shamans, Jesuits, and Rebels: Encounters in the New World 
Presented by Lori Eshleman, Author 
Wednesday, March 25, 2015 at 7:00pm  Changing Hands Bookstore  6428 S McClintock Dr  Tempe, AZ 85283  Free and open to the public 
  
About the Program  ASU author Lori Eshleman will discuss the main characters in her historical novel, Pachacuti: World Overturned: a medicine man, a Jesuit, and a rebellious Spanish girl. She explores how their personal struggles embody complex issues of race, gender, politics and religion, after a revolt in 18th century South America raises hopes of a reversal of fortunes between the Spanish and Native Americans. The concept of a world overturned is expressed by the Quichua word Pachacuti--meaning “world-turning”--a cyclical view of time in which the world starts over again and again. The Spanish conquest of the Inca Empire in the 16th century was itself seen as a Pachacuti by the native people of the Andes, and the expectation lived on that another Pachacuti would undo the conquest. This presentation raises universal questions that are still relevant in today’s world of revolts, racial tensions, religious conflicts, and gender inequities. The novel is inspired by both personal experience in Ecuador and extensive research in Spanish chronicles, travel narratives, folk songs, and works of anthropology, history, and religion. The program will include views of the novel’s exotic setting in the Andes and the baroque city of Quito, a reading and book signing. 
About Lori Eshleman  Lori Eshleman has a Ph.D. in Art History from the University of Minnesota and is an Instructor at Arizona State University in the College of Letters and Sciences. She teaches English and Interdisciplinary Studies, and has taught many courses in Medieval art, Mexican art, and art of the Americas. She lives in Tempe, Arizona, and has lived and traveled extensively in Ecuador. Her research and teaching interests focus on cultural encounter and hybridity. This is her first historical novel.

description.text:
INTRODUCTION: You’re invited to the 47th CLASP meeting, scheduled to begin at 8:30 a.m. (registration from 8:00 – 8:30 a.m.) on March 24th and continue through 4 p.m. on March 25th. Our host will be BAE Systems, 7822 S. 46th St, Phoenix, AZ. The point-of-contact for the meeting is Ms. Tina Hanson (tina.hanson@baesystems.com) phone number: (480) 753-2111. The meeting website is http://47thclasp.eventbrite.com. This meeting will be at the classified level both days. The meeting is open to Government, industry and academia that have the appropriate clearance. 
BACKGROUND: CLASP was started in the mid 80s, originally assembled to coordinate light armor activities between the US Army and United States Marine Corps. During the past ~30 years CLASP has provided a venue for working level discussions and expanded to sharing information between Government services, industry and academia in virtually all areas of survivability. The name (CLASP) highlights light armor discussions due to its origin but is much more today. CLASP is a “working-level” meeting for engineers and technical personnel from both the Science and Technology development as well as systems engineers from the Program Management to exchange information. This creates an ideal opportunity for the technology developers to get direct feedback from the platform system engineer. As such, the vast majority of the discussions will be technical in nature. This is an ideal opportunity for leading industry and academic research teams to meet with their Government counterparts. We will be discussing current programs and current issues of interest to the survivability community.  
MEETING FORMAT: All presentations should be planned for less than 20 minutes with time included for questions and answers. INDUSTRY PARTICIPANTS ARE REQUIRED TO BRIEF the technical aspects of an ongoing survivability effort that is funded by a Government agency. This is required for three reasons:  

To ensure that all participants are contributing to the meeting.
To keep the gathering to a reasonable size.
Eliminate marketing briefings 

Industry participants, be advised that if there are other fellow industry participants in the audience who you would rather not have see your presentation, you may request that they leave the room. You, the presenter, are solely responsible for any need to know restrictions and authorizations required for your presentation. In addition, if there are numerous requests for a government only session for Industry presentations, we will consider setting that up the afternoon of the 25th. 
REGISTRATION: Please submit an unclassified Title and brief abstract to Rod Peterson at   <rodney.peterson@navy.mil>. Include your organization and state whether or not the presentation will be Classified; if so, what Security Guideline is being used. Cut-off date for all Title/Abstracts submittal (both classified and unclassified) is 16 MAR 15.  
AGENDA: The meetings will include presentations from the Department of Defense, academia, National Labs, and industry personnel on state-of-the-art research in ballistics protection including ongoing light armor development, light armor upgrades, landmine blast attenuation design for TWVs, nanolaminate materials for defense uses, and shock mitigating seats to name a few. For more information on the agenda, please visit the meeting website. In addition, BAE Systems will be providing a brief overview of the various R&D and manufacturing programs at the Phoenix location. 
MEETING PRESENTATIONS AND DISTRIBUTION: We would like to make as many briefings as possible available to the group after the meeting. We will likely be assembling all briefs into a zip file and forwarding via a safe FTP site. If you want your presentation made available to others you are responsible for removing all proprietary and classified information. This will be discussed in more detail at the meeting. 
CLASSIFICATION LEVEL: The meetings are restricted to US Citizens only and proof of citizenship is required for all participants. Sessions will be conducted at the SECRET level in a secure facility. No laptops, cell phones, thumb drives or any electronic media are allowed. It is recommended that visitors bring presentation materials on a compact disk that can be viewed directly from the BAE Systems conference room computer (you will not get the CD back, so be sure it doesn’t contain anything that you don’t want others to see). All classified presentations can be sent to MS. Suzanne Kachigian, P.O. Box 50712, Phoenix, AZ 85076-0712 by 03/16/15 date while  unclassified presentations should go to tina.hanson@baesystems.com. 
SECURITY CLEARANCE INFORMATION:  The JPAS SMO Code for BAE Systems is 547865 POC is Ms. Suzanne Kachigian. Purpose: Attend 47th CLASP meeting. 
LUNCH COST: There will be a lunch fee of $10:00 per day (includes sandwich, chips and drink) for the two day meeting. On the website you will be asked if you plan to attend one or both days. All other refreshments during the day are provided at no charge. Please let us know if you have any dietary restrictions when registering.  
ATTENDANCE CONFIRMATION: Due to the potential for a large number of attendees, we must limit industry representation to two per contractor facility. As you confirm your attendance, remember to provide a title and an unclassified abstract of your presentation on the registration submittal as dicussed above. Rod Peterson will confirm accepted papers and the meeting agenda will be updated on the meeting website. Other than the lunch costs, there is no registration fee because this is not a conference. 
Note: There is no classification level or security information on the meeting website. All security information can be found in the two paragraphs above. For additional information, contact Suzanne Kachigian, Facility Security Officer for BAE Systems, at (602) 643-7202 or suzanne.kachigian@baesystems.com. 
DIRECTIONS, HOTEL, AIRPORT AND TRANSPORTATION INFORMATION: A map  and associated listing of local hotels are attched. 
  
 PHOENIX AREA LODGING 
  
Buttes Resort - Marriott - distance to BAE Systems 2.71 miles 
602.225.9000 
2000 W. Westcourt Way 
Tempe, AZ

description.html:
INTRODUCTION: You’re invited to the 47th CLASP meeting, scheduled to begin at 8:30 a.m. (registration from 8:00 – 8:30 a.m.) on March 24th and continue through 4 p.m. on March 25th. Our host will be BAE Systems, 7822 S. 46th St, Phoenix, AZ. The point-of-contact for the meeting is Ms. Tina Hanson (tina.hanson@baesystems.com) phone number: (480) 753-2111. The meeting website is http://47thclasp.eventbrite.com. This meeting will be at the classified level both days. The meeting is open to Government, industry and academia that have the appropriate clearance.

BACKGROUND: CLASP was started in the mid 80s, originally assembled to coordinate light armor activities between the US Army and United States Marine Corps. During the past ~30 years CLASP has provided a venue for working level discussions and expanded to sharing information between Government services, industry and academia in virtually all areas of survivability. The name (CLASP) highlights light armor discussions due to its origin but is much more today. CLASP is a “working-level” meeting for engineers and technical personnel from both the Science and Technology development as well as systems engineers from the Program Management to exchange information. This creates an ideal opportunity for the technology developers to get direct feedback from the platform system engineer. As such, the vast majority of the discussions will be technical in nature. This is an ideal opportunity for leading industry and academic research teams to meet with their Government counterparts. We will be discussing current programs and current issues of interest to the survivability community.

MEETING FORMAT: All presentations should be planned for less than 20 minutes with time included for questions and answers. INDUSTRY PARTICIPANTS ARE REQUIRED TO BRIEF the technical aspects of an ongoing survivability effort that is funded by a Government agency. This is required for three reasons:

  1. To ensure that all participants are contributing to the meeting.
  2. To keep the gathering to a reasonable size.
  3. Eliminate marketing briefings

Industry participants, be advised that if there are other fellow industry participants in the audience who you would rather not have see your presentation, you may request that they leave the room. You, the presenter, are solely responsible for any need to know restrictions and authorizations required for your presentation. In addition, if there are numerous requests for a government only session for Industry presentations, we will consider setting that up the afternoon of the 25th.

REGISTRATION: Please submit an unclassified Title and brief abstract to Rod Peterson at   <rodney.peterson@navy.mil>. Include your organization and state whether or not the presentation will be Classified; if so, what Security Guideline is being used. Cut-off date for all Title/Abstracts submittal (both classified and unclassified) is 16 MAR 15.

AGENDA: The meetings will include presentations from the Department of Defense, academia, National Labs, and industry personnel on state-of-the-art research in ballistics protection including ongoing light armor development, light armor upgrades, landmine blast attenuation design for TWVs, nanolaminate materials for defense uses, and shock mitigating seats to name a few. For more information on the agenda, please visit the meeting website. In addition, BAE Systems will be providing a brief overview of the various R&D and manufacturing programs at the Phoenix location.

MEETING PRESENTATIONS AND DISTRIBUTION: We would like to make as many briefings as possible available to the group after the meeting. We will likely be assembling all briefs into a zip file and forwarding via a safe FTP site. If you want your presentation made available to others you are responsible for removing all proprietary and classified information. This will be discussed in more detail at the meeting.

CLASSIFICATION LEVEL: The meetings are restricted to US Citizens only and proof of citizenship is required for all participants. Sessions will be conducted at the SECRET level in a secure facility. No laptops, cell phones, thumb drives or any electronic media are allowed. It is recommended that visitors bring presentation materials on a compact disk that can be viewed directly from the BAE Systems conference room computer (you will not get the CD back, so be sure it doesn’t contain anything that you don’t want others to see). All classified presentations can be sent to MS. Suzanne Kachigian, P.O. Box 50712, Phoenix, AZ 85076-0712 by 03/16/15 date while  unclassified presentations should go to tina.hanson@baesystems.com.

SECURITY CLEARANCE INFORMATION:  The JPAS SMO Code for BAE Systems is 547865 POC is Ms. Suzanne Kachigian. Purpose: Attend 47th CLASP meeting.

LUNCH COST: There will be a lunch fee of $10:00 per day (includes sandwich, chips and drink) for the two day meeting. On the website you will be asked if you plan to attend one or both days. All other refreshments during the day are provided at no charge. Please let us know if you have any dietary restrictions when registering.

ATTENDANCE CONFIRMATION: Due to the potential for a large number of attendees, we must limit industry representation to two per contractor facility. As you confirm your attendance, remember to provide a title and an unclassified abstract of your presentation on the registration submittal as dicussed above. Rod Peterson will confirm accepted papers and the meeting agenda will be updated on the meeting website. Other than the lunch costs, there is no registration fee because this is not a conference.

Note: There is no classification level or security information on the meeting website. All security information can be found in the two paragraphs above. For additional information, contact Suzanne Kachigian, Facility Security Officer for BAE Systems, at (602) 643-7202 or suzanne.kachigian@baesystems.com.

DIRECTIONS, HOTEL, AIRPORT AND TRANSPORTATION INFORMATION: A map  and associated listing of local hotels are attched.

description.text:
The Arizona Recruiters Association 
(Over 1200 active members local to Arizona) Free to join bit.ly/JoinARA2015  
 Attend the upcoming “Talent Acquisition Unconference” - #AzUncon 
The Unconference format focuses on the attendees to drive the discussions and share interest around trending recruitment topics. Grab a drink, relax, and build your face-to-face network, meet with Arizona’s top recruitment professionals. Go beyond social media to actually meet Talent Acquisition peers, share ideas, and build solid foundations sustainable career growth. Only event attendees will receive our famous Nitro Networking contact list. Our list will provide an instant boost to your LinkedIn/Twitter networking connections. #AzUncon 
There are a few rules: No Name Badges, No Presentations, and No Pitching. 
Date - Thursday March 26th starting at 4:00pm 
Where - (Center Stage Bar) at the Hyatt Regency Scottsdale Resort and Spa at Gainey Ranch, 7500 E. Doubletree Ranch Road, Scottsdale, AZ 85258 (map link -http://bit.ly/CenterStageBarMap)  
Discussion Topics: Current and future state of Talent Acquisition in Arizona. Does job security exist for recruiters? Centralized recruiting vs. decentralized recruitment and the likely hood your company could make the change?   
Tickets include; entrance to unconference, networking, and Nitro Networking contact list. 
Only 50 tickets will be made available for this event 
  
For more information feel free to contact me directly,  
  
Thomas F.X. Licari 
Arizona Recruiters Association 
Email: thomas@recruitersassociation.org 
http://about.me/thomaslicari 
www.linkedin.com/in/licari  
Help us get the word out #AzUncon

description.text: Secular Coalition for Arizona (Secular AZ)  advocates to ensure a secular state government. We represent the majority of Arizonans - theist and nontheist alike -  who believe that public policy free of religious favoritism is the best way to ensure freedom of conscience for individuals of all faiths and of none.
description.html: Secular Coalition for Arizona (Secular AZ)  advocates to ensure a secular state government. We represent the majority of Arizonans - theist and nontheist alike -  who believe that public policy free of religious favoritism is the best way to ensure freedom of conscience for individuals of all faiths and of none.

description.text:
HAVE YOU REGISTERED YET?  JOIN the growing number of Arizonans scheduled to attend our annual Secular Lobby Day at the Arizona State Capitol on March 26  

Hear from leaders who work daily to ensure that Arizona policy remains free of religious favoritism at taxpayer expense


Meet with Arizona lawmakers and their staff


Hear from leaders who work daily to ensure that Arizona policy remains free of religious favoritism at taxpayer expense


Strengthen our collective voice on upcoming legislation 


Mingle with like-minded secular leaders and citizens

  
Schedule of Events: 
11:00 Arrive at the Capitol  
11:30 Southern Arizona Members meet with Sen. Olivia Cajero Bedford 
12:00 Tours of the Capitol, hosted by Representative Juan Mendez in the House and Senator Olivia Cajero Bedford in the Senate 
12:30 Shared Values Gathering in Capitol Courtyard 
1:30 Humanist Invocation by Representative Mendez 
2:00 Secular Coalition members introduced from the House floor 
3:00 Happy Hour with legislators offsite - Appetizers and drinks 
  
A few tips:  

It’s important that we all show up on time.  As an aid, we encourage. all member organizations to coordinate carpools. This will facilitate easier parking and ensure everyone is able to make it, especially for those coming from outside the valley.
More information on available free parking will be sent to event registrants.
All those attending lobby day will be given Secular AZ t-shirts.
We will invite legislators to attend our happy hour. This is a great opportunity to meet and get to know them.

description.text:
We all want to look good and feel good and we want the best for our families.  Whether your health journey is beginning now or you've been along this path for a long time, we invite you to be inspired, learn why your DNA is not your destiny, and what the best steps are that you can take going forward -for both you and your children.  
Dr. Phillips is an honors graduate and All-American Swimmer at Harvard University, a medical honors graduate of Wright State University School of Medicine, as well as a highly accomplished Ironman triathlete.  His knowledge of medicine, his experience as an athlete, and his role as a father and husband give him a unique perspective of how our overall health and vitality lead to performing and aging better! 
*Childcare will be available for $5/child ONLY for those who email LeAnne Campbell at Getthemtoeat@gmail.com 
This event is sponsored by Juice Plus+.

description.text:
The Arizona National Scenic Trail is a continuous, 800+ mile diverse and scenic trail across Arizona from Mexico to Utah. It links deserts, mountains, canyons, communities and people.
The Arizona Trail Association protects and maintains the 800-mile Arizona National Scenic Trail so that hikers, bikers and equestrians can experience the diverse and spectacular landscape and friendly communities across Arizona.

description.text:
Free camping at La Selvilla Campground for Arizona Trail Day!  
Join the Arizona Trail Association for the Colossal Campout- please register only if you are planning on spending the night. 
Arizona Trail Day is a full day and night of fun with hikes, bike rides, and horseback rides in the morning, an Outdoor Expo at Posta Quemada Ranch from 12-3 pm with activities for all ages, a trail work event, archaeology walk, and a roundtable discussion from 3-5 pm. 
The Colossal Campout goes from 5-9pm at La Selvilla Campground with music by Eb Eberlein and friends, food by It's Greek to Me, and Arizona Trail Ale by the campfire. 
No charge for camping for Arizona Trail Day- dinner is $10, please register at http://www.aztrail.org/trail_day/ccmp.html. 
Gates at Colossal Cave will close at 9:00 pm and will not open until 8:00 am the following morning. 
In the morning, complimentary continental breakfast will be served.  
Equestrian Camping will be at La Posta Quemada Ranch where there is ample room for horse trailers. See map below for area marked Horse Trailer Parking and follow the signs when you come into the park.  
Directions to La Selvilla Campground at Colossal Cave: 
From east 22nd Street, turn south onto scenic Old Spanish Trail and follow it about 17 miles to Colossal Cave Mountain Park.  
Or, take I-10 east from Tucson to exit 279 (the Vail/Wentworth exit), turn north, and follow the signs for about 7 miles. Once in the park, La Selvilla is the second left all the way down the primitive road.

description.text:
2015 Bonding Education Program & Access to Capital Workshop 
The US Department of Transportation (DOT) Bonding Education Program (BEP) is a partnership with the Surety and Fidelity Association of America and Arizona Department of Transportation to help small businesses become bond ready. 
Goal: To educate small business contractors about industry challenges and to assist participants in their efforts to obtain surety bonds, or increase their bonding capacity. 

The program offers unique workshops that apply to companies seeking transportation-related contracts, though any small business seeking public works projects will find it valuable as well.


Participants will interact with service providers, bond producers, bankers, public agency representatives, prime contractors and other business owners and learn how to conduct business with local, state, and federal agencies.  

Space is limited and all applicants may not be accepted into the program.  
There is NO COST TO ATTEND. 
  
When:  Expanded Workshops 
Attendance is required for all 5 expanded workshops 
Wednesday, March 25th & April 1st: 8:30 AM - 11:30 AM 
Friday, April 17th & April 24th: 8:30 AM - 11:30 AM 
Friday, May 1st: 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM 
  
Where: 
ADOT HRDC Grand Canyon Room 
1130 N. 22nd Avenue 
Phoenix, AZ  85009 
  
Week 1 - Wednesday, March 25, 2015 Agenda 
8:00 AM - 8:30 AM: Registration and Networking 
8:30 AM - 9:00 AM: Welcome 
9:00 AM - 10:00 AM: Bonding 
                              Tracey Lawrence, President - HEIS Surety and Insurance Services, Inc. 
                              Deborah Williams, Member - DEWCO, LLC 
10:00 AM - 10:15 AM: Break 
10:15 AM - 11:15 AM: Banking - National Bank of Arizona 
                                Ken Kellaney, Regional Commercial Manager 
                                Paul Michael, VP Business Banking 
                                Rico Miller, VP Credit Solutions Group Small Business Credit Manager 
                                Catherine Arvizu, VP Business Banking 
11:15 AM - 11:30 AM: Q&A 
  
For more information, please contact: 
Jessie Doan, Project Coordinator - SBTRC - SW 
Office: (916) 443-5957   
Email: jdoan@sacasiancc.org

Goal: To educate small business contractors about industry challenges and to assist participants in their efforts to obtain surety bonds, or increase their bonding capacity.

  • The program offers unique workshops that apply to companies seeking transportation-related contracts, though any small business seeking public works projects will find it valuable as well.
  • Participants will interact with service providers, bond producers, bankers, public agency representatives, prime contractors and other business owners and learn how to conduct business with local, state, and federal agencies.  

Space is limited and all applicants may not be accepted into the program. 

There is NO COST TO ATTEND.


When:  Expanded Workshops

Attendance is required for all 5 expanded workshops

Wednesday, March 25th & April 1st: 8:30 AM - 11:30 AM

Friday, April 17th & April 24th: 8:30 AM - 11:30 AM

Friday, May 1st: 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM

 

Where:

ADOT HRDC Grand Canyon Room

1130 N. 22nd Avenue

Phoenix, AZ  85009


Week 1 - Wednesday, March 25, 2015 Agenda

8:00 AM - 8:30 AM: Registration and Networking

8:30 AM - 9:00 AM: Welcome

9:00 AM - 10:00 AM: Bonding

                              Tracey Lawrence, President - HEIS Surety and Insurance Services, Inc.

                              Deborah Williams, Member - DEWCO, LLC

10:00 AM - 10:15 AM: Break

10:15 AM - 11:15 AM: Banking - National Bank of Arizona

                                Ken Kellaney, Regional Commercial Manager

                                Paul Michael, VP Business Banking

                                Rico Miller, VP Credit Solutions Group Small Business Credit Manager

                                Catherine Arvizu, VP Business Banking

11:15 AM - 11:30 AM: Q&A


For more information, please contact:

Jessie Doan, Project Coordinator - SBTRC - SW

Office: (916) 443-5957

description.text: Topgolf is the emerging global leader in golf entertainment. Players hit golf balls containing computer microchips that track each shot’s accuracy and distance while also awarding points for hitting targets on the outfield. Topgolf offers an upscale, laid-back experience that features climate-controlled hitting bays and an impressive food and beverage menu crafted by our executive chef. Mix in dynamic event spaces for groups of all sizes, and Topgolf stands as the premier entertainment complex where the competition of sport meets the neighborhood’s favorite hangout.
