description.text:
Topgolf Spring League 
Grab your buddies, sign up for the league and keep your Topgolf game in shape! What better way to improve your game, meet some fellow Topgolfers and win cash prizes? 
Don’t think your scores are high enough? Our Handicap system will level the playing field!  
 When does it start? 

4-person teams begin play on Monday, Mar. 30 at 7 p.m.
2-person teams begin play on Tuesday, Mar. 31 at 7 p.m.
Each league has a 6 week regular season and 2 weeks of playoffs 
Includes at least 2 hours of Topgolf play each week

 How much does it cost? 

Entry Fee: $40 per 2-person team and $80 per 4-person team
Weekly Fees: $20 per person for Lifetime Members and free for Platinum Members*  


What do I get if I win? 
The entry fee will be pooled and split up accordingly to the top finishing teams (depending on league size) after the last playoff game.** 
 Visit www.topgolf.com/leagues for full league rules and details.
 
 
*Applicable sales tax will be added at point of purchase. **Prize payouts may vary by location. Please make sure to check with your Director of Instruction on the first night of league play. The chance to win is free for league members, and no consideration is required.

description.text: Brian Lesage has practiced Buddhist meditation since 1989 and has taught meditation since 2000. He has studied in the Zen, Theravada and Tibetan schools of Buddhism. He was ordained in the Rinzai Zen tradition in 1996. His training in Vipassana Meditation includes doing extended meditation retreats in Myanmar (Burma), Nepal, and India as well as numerous retreats in the U.S. He leads retreats and teaches meditation courses nationwide. Brian also has a private practice in Somatic Experiencing, which is a naturalistic approach to healing trauma.

description.text:
This silent meditation retreat will include sitting and walking meditation, meditation instruction, dharma talks, and discussion time. 
This is a non-residential retreat. The hours are 9-5 on Saturday and 9-3 on Sunday. 
Please bring a sack lunch. Refrigerator and microwave are available.  Fruit and cookies will be provided. 
If you have any trouble with directions please call Laurel at 480 299-6550 or Bruce at 480 294-4672. 
Bring a water bottle and a sitting cushion or bench for a comfortable sit. The meditation hall has a tile floor.  Area rugs cover some of the sitting area and plenty of chairs will be available.  Whether using a chair or sitting on the floor, it is advisable to bring your cushion.  
There is NO FEE for this retreat. The teachings of the Buddha have been sustained by the 2,500 year old tradition of Dana, a Pali word meaning "generosity.” Retreatants may offer donations to the teacher at the retreat's end. 
Registration is required. To register please follow the instructions on this website to get your ticket. 
After you have registered please answer the questions below and email them to the teacher at this email address Brian Lesage:      brian@liberatingawareness.com 
To support retreatants, having information regarding the following questions will help the teacher support retreatants effectively.  
Your answers to these questions will be read only by the teacher of this retreat; these forms will be destroyed after the retreat. We encourage your candor in responding. If you would like to discuss any particular question with a teacher rather than write your response, please e-mail Brian Lesage at brian@liberatingawareness.com.  
  
Have you practiced a formal meditation technique before?   Yes_____ No_____ 
If yes, what technique(s), for how long and any retreats you’ve done: 
Are there physical or emotional conditions that might make meditation difficult for you at this time?   Yes_____ No_____ 
  
If yes, please describe: 
  
Are there any additional comments or information you would like to convey?

Register here at Eventbrite so we know your family is attending.
Register to contribute to the potluck via the link above in blue at sign up genius.

description.text:
AppointmentPlus invites you to enjoy a presentation by Lauren Baily, President of Factor 8 and the Phoenix Chapter of AA-ISP.  Voted as one of the "Top 25 Most Influential Leaders in Inside Sales" by the American Association of Inside Sales Professionals in 2013 and 2014, Lauren will be sharing her expertise on "Hot Trends in Inside Sales". 
AppointmentPlus is so thrilled to be hosting this event with such an dynamic "Force for Good" in Sales and we hope you will be able to join us!  
Doors will open at 530pm (well, technically our doors are open all day long) on Tuesday, March 24th* and Lauren will begin at 6pm.  After her, no doubt, amazing talk, please feel free to hang out, learn, network and connect.  Hor d'oeuvres and beverages will be on hand to keep the hungries at bay. 
  
*date changed from the 5th to the 24th due to the unexpected stuff that life sometimes dishes out.  but 24 is a lucky number and Tuesday is our favorite day of the week so it's all good!  hope everyone is still able to join us!

description.text:
Entrepreneurship is more than nurturing an idea from what if to what is. It’s a lifelong commitment to embracing change, to rethinking the possible, to taking risks you believe in and making others believe in them.
At the Center for Entrepreneurship at the W. P. Carey School of Business, we foster and empower entrepreneurs in the classroom and across the wider ASU community. We work closely with executives and mentors, who share their ideas with the next generation of great entrepreneurs. And we celebrate entrepreneurial Arizona businesses that persevere and create their own success.

Whether it’s the next Facebook or simply a better mousetrap, we believe in encouraging ideas and connecting students and start-ups with the resources they need to keep moving forward.

description.text:
Class cost is $85 per person (Scouters)
 
$10 add-on CPR and AED training.
 
Mon 3/23, Tues 3/24, Wen 3/25, Thurs 3/26 6pm to 9:30pm. 

 
16 hour Wilderness First Aid training
 
(BSA and GSA approved).
 
(Adults and kids over 12 welcome.)
 
 
 

Wilderness First Aid 
Wilderness first aid is needed for activities in remote areas such as hiking, climbing, camping, sailing, hunting, birding or snowmobiling. Anyone living, working, traveling, or just enjoying the wilderness should be prepared to manage medical emergencies. A definition of "wilderness" is a location that is 1 or more hours away from definitive medical care. Included would be remote communities, developing countries and urban areas after a disaster. Also included would be remote areas where outdoor occupations are conducted (farming, mining, commercial fishing, forestry and some construction sites). 
Wilderness first aid is the immediate care given to an injured or suddenly ill person. It does not take the place of definitive medical care. It consists only of giving assistance until a more advanced level of medical care is obtained or until the chance for recovery without medical care is apparent. 
Wilderness first aid has a distinct focus because: 
·         Injuries and illnesses occur outdoors, often in adverse conditions that affect both victims and rescuers. 
·         Definitive medical care may be delayed for hours or days by a difficult location, bad weather, and lack of transportation or communications. 
  

·         Certain injuries and illnesses are more common in remote areas. 
·         Medical care beyond urban first aid may be needed. 
·         First Aid supplies and equipment are limited. 
·         Difficult decisions must be made. 
Designed for those who work or travel in remote locations, this comprehensive program will teach you what to look for and what to do in the event of an emergency, and direct you to the most appropriate type of care.  At the end of each course students will have to pass a written test and upon successful completion the student will receive a three (3) year certification card. This program meets the American Camp Association (ACA) guidelines.

description.text: As conference goers ourselves, we saw a post-conference trend happening - the long to-do list of ideas was set aside and never implemented. SoFabU on the Road features hands-on, interactive sessions for influencers to implement what you're learning on the spot. The sessions are paired with a fun city-specific adventure where attendees will get to put their newly learned skills to test. Join us as we take SoFabU on the Road to a city near you! Events are open to all bloggers and influencers!

description.text:
Where: The Scottsdale Plaza Resort 
When: Saturday, March 28th 
Speaker: Aliza Sherman   
Aliza Sherman is a trailblazer in the Web industry whose work paved the way for today’s social media marketing industry. She is a Web pioneer, award-winning author, and international speaker with a mission to empower women through technology. Sherman founded the first woman-owned, full-service Internet company - Cybergrrl, Inc.; the first global organization for women - Webgrrls International; and one of the first social media marketing agencies. She is the author of 10 books including Social Media Engagement for Dummies; Mom, Incorporated; The Everything Blogging Book; The Complete Idiot’s Guide to Crowdsourcing and PowerTools for Women in Business. Newsweek named her one of the “Top 50 People Who Matter Most on the Internet” for her early Internet work (1995). Fast Company named her one of the “Most Influential Women in Technology” (2009). She has been featured in USA Today, People, Time, CNN, CNBC, MSNBC and more for her pioneering work on the Internet. She consults clients through her new company Spark The Creative Agency. 
Session: Harnessing Your Content with a Social Media Strategy & Editorial Calendar 
Learn how to plan ahead not just for your blog post content but also daily social media messaging, social advertising, PR pushes, and time-sensitive promotions. Attract your target audience, boost your online presence, and save yourself a whole lot of time. Tips and tricks for efficient content planning for cross-platform efficiency. Learn how to map out all of your content and the process for posting your content for maximum impact. 
Adventure: More details coming soon!

description.text: Many mental health disorders often begin during adolescence.  This 8-hour (12:30-5:00pm both days)community-focused training provides information on identifying the signs and symptoms of mental health disorders/crises in youth, as well as risk factors and protective factors for this population.  The 5-step Mental Health First Aid action plan is explored and applied to youth mental health disorders and crisis situations through the use of discussions, case examples and videos.  This action plan includes approach skills, effective communication of concern and support, and connecting youth and families to professional and community resources.

description.text: Oakwood Creative Care was organized as Sirrine Adult Day Care of Mesa, Inc., in 1975 by a group of concerned citizens who recognized a need in the community to provide a safe, nurturing day environment for adults, age 55 and older, facing physical and/or mental challenges of daily living and unable to remain alone at home. Founders envisioned a program that would help seniors remain in the community as long as possible, provide an alternative to costly in-home and institutional care, and support the seniors’ family through the transitions brought about by failing health and decline. Recognizing a need for formal organizational structure, we were incorporated and granted nonprofit status by the Internal Revenue Service in 1987. At the same time, we were licensed by the Arizona Department of Health as a health facility serving persons with the diagnoses such as dementia, Parkinson's, strokes, disabilities, etc.  The corporate name was changed to Oakwood Creative Care in early 2013 in response to a need to develop an identity that is easily remembered and better expresses our mission. Our goal is to support our community to age gracefully and to truly enjoy the golden years.  We are changing the way adult day health care is done. We are a part of the community, the community is part of us, and we know that each of our participants has something to contribute.

Founders envisioned a program that would help seniors remain in the community as long as possible, provide an alternative to costly in-home and institutional care, and support the seniors’ family through the transitions brought about by failing health and decline. Recognizing a need for formal organizational structure, we were incorporated and granted nonprofit status by the Internal Revenue Service in 1987. At the same time, we were licensed by the Arizona Department of Health as a health facility serving persons with the diagnoses such as dementia, Parkinson's, strokes, disabilities, etc.  The corporate name was changed to Oakwood Creative Care in early 2013 in response to a need to develop an identity that is easily remembered and better expresses our mission.

description.text:
HEARING OUR SOULS THROUGH ART 
We invite you to join us in the celebration of the elderly, as we continue to strive to improve their everyday lives through the support systems that Oakwood Creative Care (OCC) has instilled. The event, Oakwood Dignifies, will give us the opportunity to showcase the talents of the members and that their voices are heard through community partnerships with other local artists. You will see, hear and be touched by the talents and the truly soulful intertetpations of our members and their stories. The event will consist of a hosted bar, light hor'deurves, a short presentation, a raffle, a live auction and a time to give to the organziation. It will end with more hosted cocktails at a dessert reception. Come mingle, laugh, live, give, and be entertained as we give the members and their souls to confirm that they are still here and they have something to express to you.

description.text:
About this event: 
  
Damage Prevention & Safety Seminars are free. All contractor and utility excavation personnel, safety managers, trainers, foremen and supervisors working in the private or public sector in Arizona are welcome and encouraged to attend. These seminars provide important information to prevent serious injuries and protect the utilities we all rely on every day. Speakers include representatives from Arizona 811 (formerly Arizona Blue Stake), utility owners/operators including natural gas transmission and distribution, electricity and communications; the Arizona Corporation Commission; and the Arizona Utility Contractors Association (AZUCA). 


Check-in for this seminar will begin at 6:30 a.m. and the program will begin promptly at 7 a.m. 


Complimentary breakfast is included. 


Program duration is 2.5-3 hours. 


Seating is first-come, first-served. Parties who want to sit together should arrive early. 


  
  
Please adhere to the following: 


Because of space limitations, and so we can plan for meals, pre-registration is required. 


Attendees must register at least one week prior to the seminar date. If registration is full, a waiting list will be created and individuals will be contacted in the order they were placed on the waiting list. Unfortunately we cannot accommodate walk-in attendees!  


Companies and local governments are welcome to send multiple attendees. However, a registration form must be completed for each individual who is attending. 


Attendees are expected to honor their RSVP. Substitutions can be made at any time. NOTE:This is a free event; however individuals who RSVP and fail to show up without canceling at least 72 hours in advance will be billed $30 to cover the costs of pre-paid meals and training expenses. If you RSVP but cannot attend, please cancel your reservation at least 72 hours in advance or designate a substitute attendee from the excavation industry! 


For the benefit of all seminar participants, professional and courteous behavior is expected at all times. Alcohol is not served or permitted at Damage Prevention & Safety Seminars. At their discretion, organizers reserve the right to refuse entry and/or continued participation to any individual who is disruptive.  


As a courtesy to other attendees, please put mobile devices on vibrate or silent mode when the program begins. If you must take or make a call, kindly do so outside of the training room. 


  
If you have questions, please contact: 
  
Sunita Rowe, Public Services Liaison 
Arizona 811 (formerly Arizona Blue Stake) 
sunita.rowe@Arizona811.com or (602) 659-7508

description.text:
Barrett, The Honors College at Arizona State University is a selective, residential college that recruits academically outstanding undergraduates across the nation.
Barrett has a rich history of providing the university community and greater Phoenix area with a wide array of engaging, intellectually-stimulating, and world-renowned speakers through a variety of lecture series and in-residence guests.These events uniformly provide an academic and accessible environment that is both intellectually stimulating and speak to the important events of the day, while also highlighting important historical trends and beliefs that have come to shape how humans view the world.Lectures have been held across a wonderfully eclectic set of venues both on the Arizona State University campus and off.Tickets are generally required for admission, but are free of cost.

description.text: Topgolf is the emerging global leader in golf entertainment. Players hit golf balls containing computer microchips that track each shot’s accuracy and distance while also awarding points for hitting targets on the outfield. Topgolf offers an upscale, laid-back experience that features climate-controlled hitting bays and an impressive food and beverage menu crafted by our executive chef. Mix in dynamic event spaces for groups of all sizes, and Topgolf stands as the premier entertainment complex where the competition of sport meets the neighborhood’s favorite hangout.

description.text:
Topgolf Spring League 
Grab your buddies, sign up for the league and keep your Topgolf game in shape! What better way to improve your game, meet some fellow Topgolfers and win cash prizes? 
Don’t think your scores are high enough? Our Handicap system will level the playing field!  
 When does it start? 

4-person teams begin play on Monday, Mar. 30 at 7 p.m.
2-person teams begin play on Tuesday, Mar. 31 at 7 p.m.
Each league has a 6 week regular season and 2 weeks of playoffs 
Includes at least 2 hours of Topgolf play each week

 How much does it cost? 

Entry Fee: $40 per 2-person team and $80 per 4-person team
Weekly Fees: $20 per person for Lifetime Members and free for Platinum Members*  


What do I get if I win? 
The entry fee will be pooled and split up accordingly to the top finishing teams (depending on league size) after the last playoff game.** 
 Visit www.topgolf.com/leagues for full league rules and details.
 
 
*Applicable sales tax will be added at point of purchase. **Prize payouts may vary by location. Please make sure to check with your Director of Instruction on the first night of league play. The chance to win is free for league members, and no consideration is required.

description.text:
“I’ve been using social media to get what I want since 1995 – you can, too!”
Gia Heller began using social media in 1995 to jump-start her social life. Ten years later, she had expanded her network to her real estate business. Using only social media, she was able to turn the trust and credibility she earned with her clients into millions of dollars’ worth of property sales. As former Marketing & Research Director at CB Richard Ellis, her marketing background is long proven.
When Gia first recognized that Facebook could be used to promote business and establish brand loyalty with customers, people ridiculed her. Today Gia has the last laugh: Fortune 500 companies and small businesses alike have come to use Facebook for branding and advertising.
Gia has taught thousands of entrepreneurs how to maximize their Facebook marketing. She has created a collaborative community of like-minded entrepreneurs who are committed to promoting within the network. Her mission is to empower over one million entrepreneurs with the skills they need to succeed!
Start building buzz around your business today!

description.text:
Alex Hermosillo is an internationally known healer, author and spiritual teacher who was born with the natural gift of healing  In 1997, he journeyed to Heaven through a near-death experience where he gained great wisdom.  With the gifts given to Alex, along with his experiences of healing, research and dedication, he developed a simple, fast and effective energy healing technique that anyone can do for themselves and others called, Mastery of Energy Healing.  He has helped people heal from heart disease, cancer, tumors, migraine headaches, depression, grief and much more.  He touches the lives of thousands who seek healing through his private sessions, lectures and classes.  Alex is a messenger from Heaven who brings peace, wisdom and healing to all who seek it.  Alex is the founder of Mastery of Energy Healing, a healing center located in Phoenix, Arizona, and he has been performing energy healing services for more than ten years.  In addition to offering his services from his hometown, Alex travels speaking and teaching nationwide at medical colleges, conferences, bookstores, churches and related facilities including The Cancer Treatment Centers of America, the International Association for Near-Death Studies, the Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine, Southern Arizona Veterans Health Center and the Southwest college for Naturopathic Medicine.  He has been featured on ABC, CBS and FOX News, Phoenix.
Visit masteryofenergyhealing.com for more information about Alex and his life work.Facebook: facebook.com/masteryofenergyhealing You Tube: youtube.com/user/LightLoveHealing  Phone: (480) 345-9972

description.text:
Alex has helped people heal of cancer, heart disease, migraines, depression, grief and much more... 
As seen on ABC, CBS, and Fox News, Phoenix 
Learn how to nurture and heal yourself and others! 
  
Mastery of Energy Healing 
Alex Hermosillo is the founder of Mastery of Energy Healing (M.E.H.).  M.E.H. is a gentle, non-invasive healing technique that assists the individual in releasing the energies and memories of unserving thoughts, emotions, and patterns in the mental, emotional and physical bodies.  Through this releasing process, individuals experience a release of anxiety, stress, worries, fear, confusion, and aches and pains, allowing greater clarity, peace of mind and relief from symptoms of illness. Many have received healing from problems such as tumors, migraine headaches, backaches, heart disease, cancer, depression and grief.  Alex shares, “No two energies can occupy the same space. When one allows the release of non-nurturing energies, we create space to bring in Light, Love and Healing balancing your physical, mental and emotional bodies so they may heal."  Please join us for this wonderful class of Lifting the Spirit! 
Watch a Fox News interview with Alex (5 minutes): http://youtu.be/WTfikf50Z_U 
  
Class Description - Level 1 
In this class, Alex will give a demonstration of a gentle non-invasive technique as students practice working on themselves and then on others. You will learn about negative and positive energies, what they are and how they affect us. Alex gives you the tools that are easily understood and implemented to become aware of these energies, and then how to release the negative energies that create illness in the physical, mental and emotional bodies. Learning this quick and simple yet powerful technique benefits you for a daily “self-practice” as well as achieving an M.E.H. Level 1 Certificate of Completion to assist your loved ones and clients alike.  
Students will feel energized, clear and positive, having rasied their consciousness to a higher state of being, and walk away with tools to incorporate into their daily lives for a brighter future for ALL! 
  
New and Prior Students 
FOR 'NEW' LEVEL 1 STUDENTS:  Welcome! The cost is $275 (discount available with earlybird registration two weeks in advance) 
 FOR 'PRIOR' LEVEL 1 STUDENTS:  We welcome you to take class as many times as you like to further develop your skills and confidence; and we support you in this! The cost is $175 (discount available with early bird registration)  *BE SURE to click on the orange-colored link, "Enter Your Discout Code" and enter your code to receive the 'prior student' discount. 
  
Seats are limited, so be sure to reserve your seat! Registration deadline date is MARCH 26th. 
  
Empower yourself with the simple tools you will receive, so that you may bring healing to yourself, your loved ones, clients, and humanity! 
In service, 
THE SUPPORT STAFF 
MASTERY OF ENERGY HEALING 
  
FAQs 
  
What can/can't I bring to the event? 
PLEASE ARRIVE at 9:15am FOR CHECK-IN 
WE ASK THAT YOU BRING:      1.  Wear comfortable clothing, and bring a sweater (hotels tend to be chilly).    2.  Pad of paper and pen to take notes if you wish.    3.  Items to lay on such as yoga mat, sleeping bag, blanket and/or pillow.  SPECIAL NOTES:      1.  This 7-hour class includes a 1 1/2-hour break for lunch; restaurants are available near the hotel.      2.  As a courtesy please don't wear perfume or cologne the day of class (deodorant is okay!).    3.  Video or audio recording devices are NOT permitted. 
  
How may I book a hotel room? 
This class is being held at the RADISSON SUITES / PHOENIX-CHANDLER where we have a block of rooms reserved for students of Mastery of Energy Healing.  The cost for a Standard King or Standard Double sleeping room is $99 USD per night. (The Standard Double holds up to 4 people).  There is a Breakfast Buffet available for $12.95 or Continental Breakfast for $7.95 in their Southgate Restaurant on-site.  (Rate does not include tax, which is 12.67% and a nightly $2.00 city surcharge.)  Deadline date to book your room with our group discounted rate is 21 days prior to class when they will release our block of rooms, though you may still book a room at their regular rate if one is available. To book your room, please contact Central Reservations at (888) 201-1718 or Allison at the hotel (480) 961-4444.  If you have questions, please email Allison.Rawley@radisson.com.  Be sure to let her know that you are with the Mastery of Energy Healing group to receive the special discounted rate!  :-) 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Free parking is available at the venue. 
  
If I am on a restricted diet, may I bring a bag lunch? 
Yes, but please be discreet, as as hotel policy coincides with Arizona state legislation stating no outside food is allowed in hotels.  (It has to do with food poisoning issues.)  Having said that, we do have this hotel's permission. 
  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
If you have a question, you can email us through our website Contact Us page at www.masteryofenergyhealing.com, or call our healing center at (480) 345-9972.  
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
The minimum age limit of attendees is 15 years, and they must be accompanied by a parent/guardian who is also attending class.  The ticket must be purchased by parent/guardian.  ID is not required at the door.   
  
Is my registration/ticket transferrable? 
No.  Another person may not attend in your place. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
Your paper ticket is kindly accepted, but not required.  
  
What is the refund policy? 
Payments, unless noted otherwise on the MEH website calendar event description (such as The Basics of Healing events, which are non-refundable), if I pre-paid and need to cancel a pre-scheduled training class or other event, I understand that a 48-hour advance notice, by phone to the M.E.H. office at (480) 345-9972, is required.  If I give more than 48-hours notice, I will receive a full refund in the form of an M.E.H. gift certificate, which I can use for any product and/or service M.E.H. provides.  
  
The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? 
No.  The person who registered must attend.
description.html:
Alex has helped people heal of cancer, heart disease, migraines, depression, grief and much more...

As seen on ABC, CBS, and Fox News, Phoenix

Learn how to nurture and heal yourself and others!

 

Mastery of Energy Healing

Alex Hermosillo is the founder of Mastery of Energy Healing (M.E.H.).  M.E.H. is a gentle, non-invasive healing technique that assists the individual in releasing the energies and memories of unserving thoughts, emotions, and patterns in the mental, emotional and physical bodies.  Through this releasing process, individuals experience a release of anxiety, stress, worries, fear, confusion, and aches and pains, allowing greater clarity, peace of mind and relief from symptoms of illness. Many have received healing from problems such as tumors, migraine headaches, backaches, heart disease, cancer, depression and grief.  Alex shares, “No two energies can occupy the same space. When one allows the release of non-nurturing energies, we create space to bring in Light, Love and Healing balancing your physical, mental and emotional bodies so they may heal."
Please join us for this wonderful class of Lifting the Spirit!

Watch a Fox News interview with Alex (5 minutes): http://youtu.be/WTfikf50Z_U


Class Description - Level 1

In this class, Alex will give a demonstration of a gentle non-invasive technique as students practice working on themselves and then on others. You will learn about negative and positive energies, what they are and how they affect us. Alex gives you the tools that are easily understood and implemented to become aware of these energies, and then how to release the negative energies that create illness in the physical, mental and emotional bodies. Learning this quick and simple yet powerful technique benefits you for a daily “self-practice” as well as achieving an M.E.H. Level 1 Certificate of Completion to assist your loved ones and clients alike. 

Students will feel energized, clear and positive, having rasied their consciousness to a higher state of being, and walk away with tools to incorporate into their daily lives for a brighter future for ALL!

 

New and Prior Students

FOR 'NEW' LEVEL 1 STUDENTS:  Welcome! The cost is $275 (discount available with earlybird registration two weeks in advance)


FOR 'PRIOR' LEVEL 1 STUDENTS:  We welcome you to take class as many times as you like to further develop your skills and confidence; and we support you in this! The cost is $175 (discount available with early bird registration)  *BE SURE to click on the orange-colored link, "Enter Your Discout Code" and enter your code to receive the 'prior student' discount.


Seats are limited, so be sure to reserve your seat! Registration deadline date is MARCH 26th.


Empower yourself with the simple tools you will receive, so that you may bring healing to yourself, your loved ones, clients, and humanity!

In service,

THE SUPPORT STAFF

MASTERY OF ENERGY HEALING

 

FAQs

 

What can/can't I bring to the event?

PLEASE ARRIVE at 9:15am FOR CHECK-IN

WE ASK THAT YOU BRING:  
   1.  Wear comfortable clothing, and bring a sweater (hotels tend to be chilly).
   2.  Pad of paper and pen to take notes if you wish.
   3.  Items to lay on such as yoga mat, sleeping bag, blanket and/or pillow.

SPECIAL NOTES:  
   1.  This 7-hour class includes a 1 1/2-hour break for lunch; restaurants are available near the hotel.  
   2.  As a courtesy please don't wear perfume or cologne the day of class (deodorant is okay!).
   3.  Video or audio recording devices are NOT permitted.

 

How may I book a hotel room?

This class is being held at the RADISSON SUITES / PHOENIX-CHANDLER where we have a block of rooms reserved for students of Mastery of Energy Healing.  The cost for a Standard King or Standard Double sleeping room is $99 USD per night. (The Standard Double holds up to 4 people).  There is a Breakfast Buffet available for $12.95 or Continental Breakfast for $7.95 in their Southgate Restaurant on-site.  (Rate does not include tax, which is 12.67% and a nightly $2.00 city surcharge.) 
Deadline date to book your room with our group discounted rate is 21 days prior to class when they will release our block of rooms, though you may still book a room at their regular rate if one is available. To book your room, please contact Central Reservations at (888) 201-1718 or Allison at the hotel (480) 961-4444.  If you have questions, please email Allison.Rawley@radisson.com.  Be sure to let her know that you are with the Mastery of Energy Healing group to receive the special discounted rate!  :-)

 

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

Free parking is available at the venue.

 

If I am on a restricted diet, may I bring a bag lunch?

Yes, but please be discreet, as as hotel policy coincides with Arizona state legislation stating no outside food is allowed in hotels.  (It has to do with food poisoning issues.)  Having said that, we do have this hotel's permission.

 

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

If you have a question, you can email us through our website Contact Us page at www.masteryofenergyhealing.com, or call our healing center at (480) 345-9972. 

 

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

The minimum age limit of attendees is 15 years, and they must be accompanied by a parent/guardian who is also attending class.  The ticket must be purchased by parent/guardian.  ID is not required at the door.  

 

Is my registration/ticket transferrable?

No.  Another person may not attend in your place.

 

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

Your paper ticket is kindly accepted, but not required. 

 

What is the refund policy?

Payments, unless noted otherwise on the MEH website calendar event description (such as The Basics of Healing events, which are non-refundable), if I pre-paid and need to cancel a pre-scheduled training class or other event, I understand that a 48-hour advance notice, by phone to the M.E.H. office at (480) 345-9972, is required.  If I give more than 48-hours notice, I will receive a full refund in the form of an M.E.H. gift certificate, which I can use for any product and/or service M.E.H. provides. 

 

The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay?

No.  The person who registered must attend.

description.text: NCSA Athletic Recruiting helps students transform their lives through sports. Our digital tools help student-athletes and their families simplify the recruiting process.

description.text:
The college athletic recruiting process doesn't just happen. Learn how you can take control of your athletic journey in this presentation by Paul Putnam. You'll learn about the timeline and guidelines college coaches use to contact student-athletes, and discover tips to evaluate schools and programs to get the most out of your college experience. 
This event is free and open to the public. 
  
About the Speaker 
College athletic recruiting expert Paul Putnam broke state records in track & field in high school before becoming a conference champion in decathlon while at Weber State University. To help athletes and families get ahead in recruiting, Paul travels the country educating them on the recruiting process. 
  
Hosted by Queen Creek High School 
  
FAQs 
Wait! I'm confused about something. 
No worries. If you have any questions, just email Anne Garrity. 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
Nope! We'll be prepared to help you enter the event without a ticket. 
What if this event is so awesome that I want to host my own event? 
We know the feeling. Go ahead and email Anne Garrity.

The purpose of the Green Valley Camera Club is to promote and develop skills in photography for its members, to foster an appreciation and understanding of photography and digital imaging as art and as a medium of communication, and to provide equipment, assistance and training, and to maintain facilities for the common good of its members.
In order to participate in classes, workshops and special interest groups (SIGs), you must be a member of the Green Valley Camera Club and GVR.

description.text:
Photographers are needed for the Green Valley Seniors Games! This is your chance to have fun taking sports photographs. Your photos will be combined into a show for the participants at their Awards Dinner and you might even see your shots on the GVR digital screens throughout the social centers. 
Sign up NOW!  The games start Monday, March 2nd, and continue through Friday, March 27th. 
Pick the event you are interested in photographing, sign up on Eventbrite (get a ticket), and go get some great photos! 
If you want to photograph an event that spans several days, you only need to photograph on one of the days. Pick the one that suits your schedule best. 
Be sure to take photos of the volunteers as well as the event participants.  Then promptly copy your photos to a CD and mark the date and event that you covered along with your name, phone and email. (So our slide show creator can contact you if there are questions.) Drop them in the specially marked box on the monitor's desk at the Camera Club.  Ask the monitor to give you a blank CD from our supply if you would like a replacement.   
Click here for the official GVR Senior Games information. 
Thanks for participating and have fun!

description.text: Free Arts for Abused Children of Arizona is the only nonprofit organization in Arizona delivering creative and therapeutic arts programs to abused and homeless children, ages 3 to 21 years.  Established in 1993, Free Arts offers four distinct programs and serves more than 7,000 children annually. We partner with 32 child welfare agencies, spanning 100 + sites throughout Maricopa County, including group homes, crisis shelters, residential treatment facilities, and unaccompanied minor programs.  Since our inception we have provided creative healing services to more than 80,000 youth. The dedicated adult volunteers and employees of Free Arts are proud of our twenty-one year history of consistently and compassionately providing quality programs that result in changed lives for vulnerable and neglected children in our community.

description.text:
TLS Weight Loss Solution Day 1 & 2 with Susan Pasqual, MSN, RN, CNSc, TLS Director of Field Development & Sales, Certified TLS Coach & Trainer, 2010 TLS Coach of the Year, 2012 NE Regional Top Coach, 2013 TLS Trainer of the Year, 2013 NE Region Coach of the Year. 
  
What is TLS Day 1 & Day 2 Training?  

TLS® trainings are now being offered locally/regionally to make important information about the TLS® Weight Loss Solution lifestyle widely available and affordable.

Day 1: $50 (guests and Clients are permitted and Welcomed!!) 
 Day 1 is all about weight loss. The only way to be a great coach- is to experience the system as your client would. The best way to start your TLS journey is to see the Big Picture of the whole system! $50 for a WHOLE day of Empowerment is an Awesome investment in your Quality of Life!!  We will take you through the Fact Factors and step by step. Step 1 Dieter Profile. Step 2 understanding Low GI and the TLS Guide. Step 3 navigating your weight loss support tool tlsSlim.com. Step 4 understanding TLS supplements to accelerate and maximize results. Step 5 exercise with tlsSlim.com tool Step 6 next steps and point of focus for the week. 
 Day 2: $50 (distributors ONLY)  Day 2 is ALL business!! Get ready to be Empowered AND Inspired to help people change their lives Physically AND Financially!!!  We will help you identify your TLS business goal, setting your plan and marketing.  * Understanding business model * Goals and Action Plan * 6 Steps to marketing TLS and common mistakes * TLS Business Tools * How to conduct initial consultation and FYF events * Understanding TLS labels and are you comparing apples to apples * Building your network through TLS * Coaches Next Steps... (New Hassle Free Coaching) 
Day 1:  
Who is it for? 

Anyone that wants to learn more about the new TLS® program and anyone who is interested in losing weight
Guests welcome to attend (Everyone MUST register)
Cost is $50 per person

Day 1 Agenda Overview  

Why we struggle with weight
Why the TLS® Weight Loss Solution is better
- Weight Loss Profile (online/paper)
- Menu options
- Why TLS® Supplements work
- Choosing the right TLS® Supplements
- TLS® Weight Loss Guide
- Setting health goals and starting Detox

Navigating TLS® site for weight loss success  

- Dashboard
- Meal Planner
- Exercise
- Alerts, mobile apps and more resources!

12 weeks of lifestyle tips  
Question & Answers 
Summary of Day 1  
  
Day 2: 
Who is it for?  

Anyone that wants to learn how to be effective with sales
Those who want to be able to effectively discuss TLS and the competition
Those who would like to be able to effectively expand their team utilizing TLS™ system
Guests are NOT permitted to attend (you must be a distributor)
Cost is $50 per-person (MUST attend Day 1 first)

Day 2 Agenda Overview: 

Identifying Market Base and Business Structures
Knowing the TLS® materials
- Approaches
- Presentation
- Close
- Invitation Card (healthy night out events)
Supplement Details (highlighting TLS® products as compard to the competition)
Marketing Fundamentals
Social Media Basics
Marketing Do’s and Don’ts (legal)

12 week program syllabus  

Coaching Tips and Coach’s Dashboard

  
90 Day Action Plan  

Creating Fitness Goals
Creating Business Goals and Action Plan
Building an organization
Coaches Start Up Guide

Questions & Answers  
Summary of Day 2 
Next steps for TLS Professionals   
Day 1 & 2 training will be done by conducted Susan Pasqual  
  
This Day 1 & Day 2 TLS® training is the first step in becoming a Certified TLS coach. For more information on benefits and requirements to become a CERTIFIED coach please check details on www.marketamericaevents.com. Day 1 & 2 tickets are non-refundable.  You may transfer a ticket after contacting your TLS trainer.

description.text:
The Denise Amber Lee Foundation was founded by Denise’s loving husband, Nathan, who sought changes to a 9-1-1 system that failed her that day.  The Foundation is here so no other person, family, or community has to endure the pure hell of a similar event and that no other children have to endure a lifetime without the comfort and guidance of their loving mother.
We envision a time when a citizen's first call for help will be answered by a state-of-the-art 9-1-1 call center staffed with dedicated and highly trained professionals. A time when 9-1-1 will fail no-one.

description.text: Nathan Lee, founder and President of the Denise Amber Lee Foundation, and Geoff Weiss, dispatch supervisor for the San Diego Sheriff’s Department tie together the elements of the Denise Amber Lee tragedy. A positive and uplifting presentation, students will learn of the obvious failures that day to the more in-depth concepts such as leadership, hiring, training and encouraging employees in a communications center. Hosted by Chandler Police Department.

description.text: IGDA is a bunch of game developers getting together to talk about games, and learn stuff!  Students, hobbyists, indies, and full time game devs usually show up.  Anyone is welcome!
description.html: IGDA is a bunch of game developers getting together to talk about games, and learn stuff!  Students, hobbyists, indies, and full time game devs usually show up.  Anyone is welcome!

description.text:
Gravity Ghost: A Spooky Design Talk 
Presented by Erin Robinson 
Local indie game developer Erin Robinson shares the experience of designing her game Gravity Ghost. She provides an overview of the decisions necessary for turning a simple physics toy into a complete commercial game. Three design tenets were used: 1) Always abandon ideas that don’t work, 2) Learn what to listen for when playtesting, and 3) Stay true to a theme in every aspect of the art, design, and story. 
 
Erin Robinson has been an independent game developer for 10 years. Her games include Gravity Ghost (2015), Puzzle Bots (2010), Nanobots (2008), and Spooks (2006). She was recently named as one of Fast Company’s most influential women in tech, and she lectures, writes, and teaches about independent games all over the world. She holds a degree in Psychology from Queen’s University. 
Location 
http://www.asu.edu/computerclassrooms/building/byac/byac-150.html 
The presentation will be located in classroom 150 in the Brickyard Artisan Court building at ASU.  The entrance is located at the fountains right next to Ike's Place on Mill.  After the presentation we'll be heading upstairs to Endgame for food, drinks, and hanging out! 
Parking 
Parking is available in many locations surrounding the event.  The 5th and Farmer lot (http://www.millavenue.com/go/5th-and-farmer-lot) does not require a parking permit after 6:00pm.  The City Hall Garage (http://www.millavenue.com/go/city-hall-garage) is free if you enter the garage after 6:00pm unless there is a special event going on. 
Metered parking spots not directly located on Mill Avenue (http://www.millavenue.com/go/single-space-meters) are free after 6:00pm.  Check the map for more details: http://www.millavenue.com/_files/docs/meter-map-by-hours-2013----letter.pdf 
Some ASU parking lots are available after 7:00pm without a permit: https://cfo.asu.edu/pts-parking-holiday A map is available here: http://www.asu.edu/parking/maps/tempe-current.pdf 
Other than that parking options are generally available on public lots at a rate of $1.50 or $2.00 an hour. 
FAQ 
Q: Do I need to bring my ticket? A: No, we only use RSVPs a head count for seating and reserving space. 
Q: Do I need to be a member of IGDA to attend? A: No, anyone is welcome at our meetings. 
Q: How long does a meeting usually last? A: We usually get the ball rolling a little bit after 7pm, and run until 8:30pm to 9pm. 
Q: What is the meeting structure? A: We start with community related announcements, followed by a presentation from a speaker. The speaker may or may not answer questions at the end. After the presentation feel free to hang out and mingle with your fellow game developers! 
Q: How do I get my announcement into list of opening announcements? A: Just email chair@igdaphx.org with the details of your announcement. A picture and a few words to go on the presentation slide. You'll have 2 to 3 minutes to give your announcement at the start of the meeting. 
If you have any futher questions, please contact chair@igdaphx.org 
For more details and announcements, check out the IGDA Phoenix blog at http://igdaphx.org

description.text:
Child Care Resource & Regerral (CCR&R) provides assistance to families seeking child care and to child care providers.  Resources that are available at no charge include:
 
For Families:

Information about your child care choices/child care referrals
Guidelines about what to look for in quality child care
Parent Newsletters
Information about assistance and options for paying for child care

 
For Providers:

Listing on the child care referral database
Referrals to your business/program
Help with business, child care, and regulatory questions
Information about trainings and workshops
Arizona Child Care Job Bank
Receive a quarterly newsletter

 
For the Community:

Information about classes and trainings
Child care supply and demand information 

 
To receive more detailed information about child care programs and what to look for in quality child care, please contact CCR&R at:
1-800-308-9000

Child Care Resource & Regerral (CCR&R) provides assistance to families seeking child care and to child care providers.  Resources that are available at no charge include:

description.text:
E-filing with AZTurboCourt 
  
The AZTurboCourt e-filing application is available for use starting on February 17, 2015 for Pima County for Civil initiating (complaint) and subsequent filings.  
This training provides an overview presentation and live demonstration for users who have already registered in AZTurboCourt and those new to AZTurboCourt. The first 30 minutes of the training will cover registration and payments. 
Even though you may have filed in Maricopa County Superior Court using AZTurboCourt, it is highly recommended that you attend training as this version of the software has difference unique to Pima County Superior Court. 
  
  
Learn How To:  
  
ü  File a new Civil case and retrieve your issued Summonses 
ü  Correctly attach documents for Pima County filings  
ü  Attach multiple document in one submission 
ü  Efficiently set-up & utilize AZTurboCourt in your office 
ü  E-file and pay filing and user fees on-line  
ü  Reduce data entry for multiple filings 
  
 All trainings are located at  
  
2225 E Ajo Way, Building M, Tucson AZ 85714  
The building is on your right as you come in to the Juvenile Court facility.  
Doors open 30 minutes before training.

The AZTurboCourt e-filing application is available for use starting on February 17, 2015 for Pima County for Civil initiating (complaint) and subsequent filings. 

This training provides an overview presentation and live demonstration for users who have already registered in AZTurboCourt and those new to AZTurboCourt. The first 30 minutes of the training will cover registration and payments.

Even though you may have filed in Maricopa County Superior Court using AZTurboCourt, it is highly recommended that you attend training as this version of the software has difference unique to Pima County Superior Court.

 

 

Learn How To: 

 

ü  File a new Civil case and retrieve your issued Summonses

ü  Correctly attach documents for Pima County filings 

ü  Attach multiple document in one submission

ü  Efficiently set-up & utilize AZTurboCourt in your office

ü  E-file and pay filing and user fees on-line 

ü  Reduce data entry for multiple filings

 

 All trainings are located at 


2225 E Ajo Way, Building M, Tucson AZ 85714 

The building is on your right as you come in to the Juvenile Court facility. 

Doors open 30 minutes before training.

description.text:
The Desert Southwest Chapter of the Alzheimer's Association is a charitable organization incorporated in the State of Arizona and governed by a local board of directors.  While we are an affiliate of the National Alzheimer's Association based in Chicago, all our work is devoted to providing service and support to Alzheimer's patients, family members and caregivers throughout Arizona and Southern Nevada.


Our Mission To eliminate Alzheimer's disease through the advancement of research; to provide and enhance care and support for all affected; and to reduce the risk of dementia through the promotion of brain health.


Our Vision A world without Alzheimer's disease.


Our Purpose To empower and support individuals, families, care partners and communities affected by dementia in Arizona and southern Nevada.

description.text:
Join us for the Northern Arizona Annual Alzheimer's Education Conference! This conference has become a must-attend event for individuals, families, and professionals facing Alzheimer's disease and related dementias. Attendees will experience a full day of information, education, and support from renowned dementia experts.  

Conference attendance is limited. Register with payment early to secure your space. No spaces will be held without payment. 
Professional CEU recipients must attend the entire day to receive CEUs.
All conference materials are on a disc, privided free with paid registration.
Copies of speaker handouts will be available at the individual breakout sessions.
Registrations must be received by Friday, March 20th.    

Cancellation Policy: Full refunds are granted if a request is made in writing by mail or fax to the Alzheiemr's Association 48 hours prior to the event. Refunds requested within 48 hours are granted for emergencies only. No refunds for no-shows.   Questions? Contact Patty at pwinkels@alz.org or 928.771.9257.

description.text:
Our faculty and staff are committed to the success of our students as they pursue one of our degrees. We offer degrees in Applied Computing, Applied Mathematics, Life Sciences, and Statistics. We have numerous options within these degrees so that students can tailor their degree to their interests and goals. These include concentrations in environmental science, forensics, pre-med, networks, digital media, databases, and secondary education. We also offer Minors in Chemistry, Life Sciences, and Mathematics.
Our strength as a division can be seen not only in the research our faculty and students are pursuing but in the types of jobs our alumni are accepting upon graduation. Our graduates may be working as surgeons, physical therapists, computer scientists and graphic designers to name a few. Our students acquire a solid scientific and mathematical knowledge base, proficiency in scientific inquiry, and the ability to apply these skills to life situations.

description.text:
Do you know of any talented young women who enjoy math? 
We are interested in inviting some bright young minds to the West campus of Arizona State University on Saturday, March 28th, 2015, for our seventh annual  
Sonia Kovalevsky High School Mathematics Day, 
honoring Sonia Kovalevsky, a pioneer for women in mathematics. 
Sonia Kovalevsky was regarded as one of the world's best mathematicians in her time. Her amazing life included several firsts for women. Her stunning achievements include: becoming the first female member of the Russian Academy of the Sciences and the first modern European woman to attain full professorship; establishing the first significant result in the general theory of partial differential equations; winning the Prix Bordin prize; becoming an editor of a prominent mathematics journal in addition to being a gifted writer. Although society at that time did not allow women to succeed in academia, Sonia Kovalevsky had positive mentors in her life that supported her in pursuit of a career in mathematics. 
Many young women do not excel in the sciences due to lack of role models or just because they don't know that careers in science are open to them! 
This Sonia Kovalevsky Day is an opportunity to engage middle school and high school girls in a day of networking, mentoring, and fun! The day will begin at 8:30am with registration followed by a keynote lecture, a hands-on mathematical activity and a career panel. There is also a special professional development session for teacher's just before lunch. The event is completely free and lunch and giveaways are provided. You must pre-register by March 23rd to particpate. 
After lunch we will participate in an exciting game called, "Who Wants To Be A Mathematician,"sponsored by the American Mathematical Society. PArticipants in this game show can win up to $3000 in scholarships and fancy Texas Instruments calculators. To participate, students must complete a qualifying quiz, administered by their math or science teacher. Only one student per school may be nominated for this gameshow. Nomination must occur by March 14th. Please contact the organizer if you are interested in participating in this exciting gameshow.  
For more information please check the official website for the 2015 Sonia Kovalevsky High School Mathematics Day 
links.asu.edu\skday2015 
  
or contact 
Dr. Omayra Ortega 
Arizona State University West 
Mathematical and Natural Sciences 
omayra [dot] ortega [at] asu [dot] edu 
602 543 8158

description.text:
Black Artists and Designers (B.A.D.) is governed by students at Arizona State University, on the Tempe Main Campus. The purpose of B.A.D. is to utilize the artistic talents of students by providing various opportunities to showcase their skills, provide artistic services to the community, and encourage educational student success.
The National Council of Negro Women (NCNW) is a nonprofit organization whose mission is to harness the power of African American and other women of color to ensure full access and participation in the socio-economic and political systems which impact upon the quality of life for all persons.

description.text:
To inform and educate women and men about proper skin, hair, and nail care as well as inform them about the various products available to them so they can make the best decision regarding these areas in the future.  
This event is free to the community! 
We will also be having a raffle, as well as goody bags for attendees that walk in.  
Refreshments will also be available 

  
FAQs 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
This event is all ages! 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
You can either park at the Gammage Parking, which is located near the Gammage Auditorium, near Apache and Forest Ave. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
You can bring either your phone with the ticket confirmation or a printed one!

description.text:
It's that time again!  Come TEST THE BEST Road Bikes available at the Ahwatukee location of Global Bikes!  Specialized road demo driver, Andrew Tierney, will be out setting up bikes starting at 7:00 in the morning and will be up and running before our group ride goes out with Al Vega.  Al will be doing a little shorter than normal route so you can try multiple bikes if desired.  That will also be week 4 of our Progressive beginner ride, probably about 20-25 miles at an easy pace as well.  Multiple group rides to join, or go out and hammer on one on your own!  
  
As always, free food and refreshments will be on hand!  Coffee on hand for the early birds, as we will be here by 7am setting up and getting you fitted to your bike of choice.  Tarmac, Roubaix, Ruby, Amira, Venge, and even the Diverge will all be on hand in most sizes! After the ride, we will have an open demo until 2:00pm for those looking to ride multiple bikes, or who have prior engagements in the morning. 
  
Whether you're in the market for a new bike, or just want to try something different, this is a really unique opportunity to test out some of the best road bikes available! Send any questions or concerns to andrew.tierney@specialized.com. 
  
What should I bring? 
Pedals Appropriate footwear - cycling shoes or sneakers Helmet Credit Card  Photo identification 
  
What to expect? 
  
Upon arriving check in with the Field Marketing Rep. They will have fill out a waiver and set you up on your bike. 
  
What bike should I ride? 
  
Chat up your field marketing rep! They have a plethora of knowledge and will be happy to assist you in finding the perfect bike for you. See below for a full list of available bikes. 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
  
Anyone can test a bike. Children under the age of 18 will require a legal parent or guardian present. Parent or guardian must accompany the minor during the ride. You will need a valid photo ID and credit card. 
  
What bikes will be available? 
  
 S-WORKS TARMAC Di2 DISC 
  
The new S-Works Tarmac Disc is Rider-First Engineered™ to provide every size frame with the hill destroying stiffness and legendary descending prowess the Tarmac is known for. It's a no compromise race-bred machine and now with full hydraulic Shimano disc brakes, slowing down has never been easier. 
  
TARMAC PRO RACE The new Tarmac Pro Race is Rider-First Engineered™ to provide every size frame with the hill destroying stiffness and legendary descending prowess the Tarmac is known for. With a Shimano Ultegra 11-speed drivetrain for flawless shifting, it has all the performance to take your riding to the next level. 
  
VENGE PRO RACE  
  
The Venge is fast. Plain and simple. Behind it sits a myriad of science, testing, aerodynamic tweaking and design. What does all this mean for you? A bike that's faster in the flats, faster over rollers, and faster in sprints. The Venge will save you 45 seconds over 40 km compared to a Tarmac. Couple that with FACT carbon that's nearly as light as it is stiff and the only excuse you have for going slower are those things you're standing on. 
  
S-WORKS AMIRA SL4 
  
Ridden by the most successful women's cycling team in the world, Specialized-lululemon, the S-Works Amira SL4 is the lightest, stiffest, and fastest women's bike around, featuring a FACT 11r carbon frame with women's-tuned geometry, tapered headtube, and internal cable routing; plus Pro Tour-proven Shimano Dura-Ace components, and our feather-light Roval Rapide CLX 40 wheels. 
  
ALLEZ COMP RACE 
  
The all-new Allez is built to explode off the front and deliver unbridled speed to the ride, and all without blowing up your wallet in process. With pro-level looks, high-end performance, and a feisty demeanor that’ll serve you well on weekend rides or when lining up in local races, this bike is ready to take you to the next level in your riding. 
  
ROUBAIX SL4 PRO DISC RACE UDi2 
  
Smoother is faster. The more comfortable and less fatigued you are at the end of a 4-hour ride, the stronger you'll be. Like shocks on a race car, the Zertz vibration damping inserts on the Roubaix SL4 help absorb road impact and keep power planted firmly on the road—couple that with a FACT carbon 10r frame and it's still plenty stiff to thrash around in a sprint. Just ask 2014 Paris-Roubaix champion, Niki Terpstra. 
  
RUBY PRO DISC UDi2 
  
The Ruby Pro Disc is a quick and efficient, FACT carbon bike, with OSBB and Zertz vibration dampers in the frame and fork, designed to cover long distances with maximum control, efficiency, and comfort. The Shimano Ultegra Di2 electronic drivetrain provides effortless shifting, paired with Roval Rapide CL 40 Disc wheels means this Ruby's ready for a gran fondo or local race.

description.text:
Happy Spring! AZ Tech Beat Lunch and Learn is revved up and ready to help you build your business. 
 
Our guest expert is Justin MacDonald, Infusionsoft's Manager of Customer Experience. Justin serves as a manager of Customer Experience where he researches and advises nearly all business units of the company about its customers’ experience. In its quest to help small businesses succeed, Infusionsoft is learning to apply the art and science of the enterprise business discipline of “Customer Experience”.  
As both a leader at Infusionsoft as well as a small business owner, Justin blends his passion for customer experience, executed excellence, and small business success. 
  
Sign up soon as free tickets sell out quickly!  
Date: Friday | March 27, 2015 
Time: 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. 
Topic: 6 secrets to enhancing your Customer's Experience - get CX-y for your customers 
Location: Axosoft 
13835 N. Northsight Blvd |  #205 
Scottsdale, AZ 85260 
FREE LUNCH TICKETS ARE LIMITED 
Each month, AZ Tech Beat gathers the startups and entrepreneurs for an afternoon of free food, community and great content. Connections, startups and friendships have started here!  
Please note that free tickets are limited so grab them now!  
As part of the attendance, you will receive the AZTB newsletter with all the latest headlines you might have missed during the week! We will also be taking pictures that will be used for commercial purposes, on social media channels and online. Thanks for reading. Visit our website at www.aztechbeat.com  
Thank you to our lead sponsor Hool Coury Law Firm

description.text:
Brenda is a purple belt in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu under Manuel Flores and Ricardo “Franjinha” Miller, creator of Paragon Brazilian Jiu-jitsu.  Brenda teaches all the women’s BJJ classes at Daimyo BJJ Academy and her style includes techniques from self-defense to competition style Jiu-jitsu. The self-defense aspect of our training covers real life scenarios and effective techniques that will teach you how to deal with a bigger and stronger opponent, all based on Brazilian Jiu-jitsu techniques.
Brenda and Manuel have been providing self-defense seminars for women and anti-bullying seminars for children for more than 3 years.  Manuel and Brenda have more than 20 years of combined experience in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and Martial Arts.

description.text:
2nd annual "Let's Roll All Girls Open Mat" this is a Brazilian JiuJitsu event, its FREE and open to girls ages 10 and older, and women of all ages! Our goal is to empower women of all ages through the beautiful art of Brazilian JiuJitsu, by supporting each other, sharing our stories, and inspiring those around us.  
This is a non-competitive environment where we have the opportunity to roll (spar) with other girls! The open mat is divided into three sessions, warm up, technique, and rolling. This event is open to anyone, new or with experience in the sport. If you always wanted to know what BJJ was all about, this is the perfect opportunity – NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY!  This is a gi event, if you don’t have one, no worries we can lend you one J 
This is an ONLY Women Event!!

description.text:
Agents Benefiting Children and Scottsdale 20/30 Club help raise money for The Care Fund and over 20 other Arizona children charities. 
So...... come and join our Pub Crawl in Old Town Scottsdale, slap on your best MUSTACHE and let's raise some money for the kids! 
  
Tickets cost $30 and includes: 
- a Pub Crawl t-shirt  - a raffle ticket to win the choice of a NEW Toyota or $15,000 cash  - Drink Specials (2-for-1's, shots, etc.)  - games, prizes, and additional raffles at each bar  (and remember, ALL PROCEEDS go to charity) 
  
Check-in is at Bevvy @ 11:30am and then we will continue onto Wasted Grain, Mr. Biggs, and then finish at Boondocks where we will be playing drinking games and you'll have more opportunities to win more raffle tickets 
  
For more information about Agents Benefiting Children and the charities they support, check out their website: 
http://www.scottsdale2030.org/charities/ 
If you can't make it to the Pub Crawl but still want to donate to get some raffle tickets, go to the following website and make sure you select our team "Occasio Realty" at checkout. 
http://www.scottsdale2030.org/ticket/agents-children-olympiad-sponsorships/

description.text:
This is an 8 Week Mentorship event to provide an intimate and impactful experience for women in real estate who struggle with balancing home life while pursuing a wildly successful real estate career. 
I will combine personal development with real estate tactics and strategies. You will leave the 8 weeks with the playbook on what you need to achieve the happiness you've been looking for in this amazing business. 
The only ceiling in the real estate industry is the one we place on ourselves so we will work together to remove it! 
  
  
We will meet every Wednesday from 12pm - 2:30pm beginning March 25th and ending on May 18th.

description.text:
Join us on March 28th in Mesa Arizona!   
Our mission is to provide safe, affordable, educational, spiritual and healing experiences where those with like minds can meet and network with those who want to learn more about Christ-centered Energy Healing & Alternative Health Practices.   These are not events exclusive to practitioners.  We invite all men, women and youth who have a desire to learn more wherever they may be on their journey.  
We did a conference previously to this in Ogden on June 18-19 of 2014. We had 1,400 come from 19 states AND Canada. We have now done a series of them around the country.  
http://www.energyhealingconference.com/mesa-az---march-28-2015.html 
  
Presenters: 
Karol Truman, Tamara Laing, Kimberly Watts, Courtney Beardall, Sarah Hinze,  
Beverly Kingsford, Tam Pendleton, Chris Cook and many more!

description.text:
Grab Your Girlfriends & Join Us for 
  
Your Road Runner Sports 
  
Run Like A Girl Fun Run! 
     
  
Take on a friendly 3–5 mile fun run with your girlfriends from RRS Scottsdale every 4th Wednesday of the month from May–September. Plus, be entered to win a full travel package for you and a friend to the Women's Running Scottsdale Half Marathon on November 2nd* each time you participate in Run Like a Girl! 
  
Event Schedule: 
  
6:00pm - Sign in, Shop & Test the Hottest New Shoes 
  
6:30pm - 3 to 5-mile Group Fun Run 
  
7:30pm - Post-Run Stretch, Refreshments, & Raffle 
  
   
Earn EXTRA Raffle Tickets When You: 
  
-RSVP by 12pm on Event Day 
  
-Rock R-Gear (RRS Brand apparel) on Your Run 
  
-Test Run New Shoes 
  
-Spend $25+… Earn 1 Ticket for Every $25 You Spend 
  
*At the conclusion of the season (September), we will draw two winners nationwide for a FREE 2-person travel package to the 2014 Women's Running Series Half-Marathon in Scottsdale, AZ! The winners will each recieve 2 entries, 2 plane tickets, and a hotel room for two! Winners will be randomly drawn from raffle tickets collected througout the RLAG season. The more you run, the better your change to win!

description.text: We recognize that you need access to data when you need it and that you don't know what you need until you see it. We know that when seeking an answer to a question, often times the data received prompts new questions leading to the need for more data. Knowing that, we realize that we can never provide this information fast enough or in a timely manner. As a result, we know we need a way to make that data available to you whenever you need it, in such a way that you can find answers to whatever your questions are, no matter where those answers lead you. An option we have found that will allow us to meet your needs is the Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite of Tools. We feel this toolset is agile, robust and gives us the most options to give you what you need when you need it.

description.text:
This workshop is reserved for ASU faculty and staff. 
This class will show you how to build queries that can be used in the Microsoft tools.  It will focus on database design and how to write efficient queries using Toad Data Point. 
This class will also introduce you to a data model, what it is, how you design it, build it and even what to do with it. This class is meant for a beginner who knows nothing about data models since it will only focus on building a model. 
This is a hands-on workshop is conducted in a computer lab where each participant has a workstation and works through examples in the software. 
Note:  To attend this class, you will need to have access to the Business Intelligence Terminal Servers along with a Data Warehouse (DW_) account. 
Information about accessing the Business Intelligence Terminal Servers can be found at https://asu.service-now.com/ess/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0011815.   
To request a DW_ account, submit a Service Now request to the Analytics team. If you do not recall your DW password, please have that reset and resolved  before class. 
This workshop is subject to cancellation up to 24 hours prior to its scheduled time if there are less than 2 registered attendees. 
NOTE: Pursuant to the Americans with Disabilities Act, if you require specific aids or services, please contact Vicki Davis at VS.Davis@asu.edu.  ADA REQUESTS MUST BE MADE AT LEAST 2 WEEKS BEFORE THE CLASS BEGINS TO ENSURE TIMELY RECEIPT.

description.text:
On Saturday, March 28, 2015 Team Red White and Blue, Team Rubicon and The Mission Continues will join forces and Run as One for a 3k or longer in over 100 United States locations to celebrate collaboration, community and camaraderie. This national event is in honor of Marine veteran Clay Hunt, an original member of Team Rubicon who took his own life after battling PTS and depression.   The event will not only serve as the celebration of a continued partnership, but will be a symbol of leadership, action, and collaboration across the veterans support landscape.  Come Run or Walk with the Flag. Please feel free to bring flags if you have them. 
Bring your family, children and friends! 
Attire:  Your Mission Continues T-Shirt, pants/shorts/shoes that are comfortable to run or walk in. 
Schedule of events: 
8:00am - Registration. Big thanks to American Legion Post 1 for providing fruit, danish, coffee, juice and water. 8:30am - Kickoff comments. 8:35am - 22 for 22 - To honor the 22 Veterans that we lose each day to suicide, those who are willing and able will do 22 pushups as a team.  8:40am - Run as One Group and Walk as One Group begin their Walk/Run to the Memorials at the Capital.  **Special Note: Event is completely free, but if you can purchase an event T-shirt for $15. 
See you there!

This national event is in honor of Marine veteran Clay Hunt, an original member of Team Rubicon who took his own life after battling PTS and depression. 

The event will not only serve as the celebration of a continued partnership, but will be a symbol of leadership, action, and collaboration across the veterans support landscape.

Come Run or Walk with the Flag. Please feel free to bring flags if you have them.

description.text:
Do you or someone you know have No Credit or Bad Credit? Do you have Late Payments, Collections, Judgments, Bankruptcies or Liens on your Credit Report? 
Regardless of what some will tell you, there is no reason to live with bad credit. Credit Repair is legal and it works! For over twenty five years I have helped clients build credit scores, remove negative credit including late payments, collections, judgments, bankruptcies and liens and increase their scores. I have seen many clients and even some of the big "credit repair companies" lower a score even further by doing the process incorrectly. It seems there are many who believe they know it all when it comes to credit. Join us to learn how a credit score is computed, how to build or re-build good credit and how to get rid of the negative credit on your credit report. 
I often relate the process to one doing their taxes. With a little knowledge of tax law and the proper forms, it's not that tough. I have broken the process into an easy to follow step by step plan that anyone can follow. Many clients pay hundreds or even thousands of dollars for these services. You will receive all the knowledge, forms and documents you will need to complete this process on your own at no additional cost other than a few postage stamps. 
The course is designed to be easy to understand even for even those with no previous knowledge about credit or finance and is fun and interactive. We will have fun learning and I promise you won’t feel like you’re in Traffic School. You will be given sample forms and documents and showed which ones to use for each circumstance. 
Still a bit shy or afraid to go it alone through the process? The day of the workshop, all attendees will have the opportunity to purchase two twenty minute telephone consulting sessions with a Credit Specialist for $49.00 if they choose to do so. (A $98.00 value) 
Workshops currently scheduled in; 
                                Superstition Springs Mall area, Mesa, Arizona 4th Saturday of each month 
Don't worry... Your privacy is always respected and we will never ask you any embarrassing questions or single you out in front of the group. Workshop sizes are limited so there is always time to insure that all your questions are answered before you leave. Students may attend to learn how to correct their own report or that of a friend or relative. Our classes do fill up quick so sign up as soon as possible for the next available class. 
$399.00   $ 249.00 Earlybird discount 
 Tuition – (includes instruction, workbook, sample forms and documents needed) 
** Our Guarantee – We stand behind our course 100%. Take this course and follow the process as we have outlined and if your credit score does not increase, we will refund every dime of your money paid to take the course. 
**(To get a 100% refund we simply ask that you send us copies of; Your credit report with scores before you started, copies of the completed documents we asked you to send to the bureaus, lenders etc., copies of the return correspondence from the bureaus, lenders etc. and a final copy of your credit report showing no increase in scores. Of course you will have to pay your current bills on time and not incur additional derogatory items.) 
IMPORTANT DISCLAIMER - (Our Lawyers make us do it) While we will laugh, joke and talk quite a bit about the many Federal and State laws protecting your credit rights and about the procedures we have used to help clients get awesome results over the past 25+ years we must disclose that the course is taught by a Credit Specialist and not an attorney. Any legal discussion is mere opinion and no legal advice is given at this workshop. If you wish to receive legal advice, we must advise you to consult an attorney. 
Don't want to learn and just want someone to take care of the credit repair process for you? Contact us by clicking on the "Contact Credit AllStars" button below and we will have an experienced Credit Specialist contact you.

description.text:
The Arizona Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies (ACMRS) was founded in 1981 as a state-wide research unit charged with stimulating the interdisciplinary exploration of medieval and Renaissance culture. Its activities cover a period roughly from AD 400 to 1700. ACMRS coordinates programs at ASU, Northern Arizona University in Flagstaff, and the University of Arizona in Tucson. Among the activities and programs the center sponsors are a semi-annual distinguished lecture and ad hoc lecture series, an annual distinguished visiting professorship, an annual conference, a public symposium, and summer study-abroad programs in the United Kingdom and Italy. The Center also awards undergraduate and graduate certificates in medieval and Renaissance studies to students completing required coursework.

MAJOR RESEARCH PROJECTS AND PUBLICATIONS

Medieval and Renaissance Texts and Studies
Arizona Studies in the Middle Ages and Renaissance (Brepols Publishers)
Iter: Gateway to the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, an online bibliography and digitized library
Late Medieval and Early Modern Studies (Brepols Publishers)
Studies in Medieval and Renaissance History, an interdisciplinary journal (AMS Press)
Oxford Dictionary of the Middle Ages, a resource of first resort, completed in 2010
Klaeber’s Beowulf, the 4th version of the most important edition of the poem ever published

MAJOR RESEARCH FUNDING SOURCES

National Endowment for the Humanities
Program for Cultural Cooperation Between Spain’s Ministry of Education, Culture and Sports and U.S. Universities
Iter Inc., (University of Toronto)
Samuel Kress Foundation
Institute for Humanities Research
