description.text:
The Grim Reaper as Religious Icon 
Presented by Eric Breault, Graduate Associate, Religious Studies, ASU 
Tuesday, March 24, 2015 at 11:00am Coor Hall, Room 4403 ASU Tempe Campus Free and open to the public 
 
About the Program The Grim Reaper is an image derived from a collection of ancient Greek, Judaic, biblical, and pseudepigraphical writings and imagery. An analysis of metonyms, material culture, and secondary historical sources associated with personifications of death demonstrate how Christians in medieval Iberia perceived the Grim Reaper as a religious icon. 
About Eric Breault At Arizona State University, Eric is in the Anthropology of Religion Ph.D. track of Religious Studies. His work investigates unofficial folk saints in Latin America with a special focus on Mexican-Catholic folkloric icons that are not recognized by the Vatican, especially La Santa Muerte. This research examines the historical trajectory of how the cult of the saints was brought to the Americas via Spanish conquest, why such folk devotions became pervasive in Latin America, and finally the manner in which these religious practices constitute societies based on a shared sense of meaning unique to the Latin American context.

The Grim Reaper as Religious Icon

Presented by Eric Breault, Graduate Associate, Religious Studies, ASU

Tuesday, March 24, 2015 at 11:00am
Coor Hall, Room 4403
ASU Tempe Campus
Free and open to the public

About the Program
The Grim Reaper is an image derived from a collection of ancient Greek, Judaic, biblical, and pseudepigraphical writings and imagery. An analysis of metonyms, material culture, and secondary historical sources associated with personifications of death demonstrate how Christians in medieval Iberia perceived the Grim Reaper as a religious icon.

About Eric Breault
At Arizona State University, Eric is in the Anthropology of Religion Ph.D. track of Religious Studies. His work investigates unofficial folk saints in Latin America with a special focus on Mexican-Catholic folkloric icons that are not recognized by the Vatican, especially La Santa Muerte. This research examines the historical trajectory of how the cult of the saints was brought to the Americas via Spanish conquest, why such folk devotions became pervasive in Latin America, and finally the manner in which these religious practices constitute societies based on a shared sense of meaning unique to the Latin American context.

description.text:
Utilize InDesign to Create Powerful Proposals You asked for it! 
This training will cover:  
Day 1 -  Managing the InDesign Environment, Designing Documents, Enhancing Documents Tables Styles, Master Finalizing Documents, and Preparing for Print/Digital Output   
Day 2 - Workflow Timesavers, Shortcuts, Libraries, and Basic Design Principles  
About the instructors: 
Deirdre Gilmore, CPSM, Sargent Strategy, TankGirl Marketing  
Deirdre Gilmore is a Certified Professional Services Marketer who has spent the past 15 years focused on the AEC community. She has worked for small niche firms, to three of the top ENR companies. She earned her Bachelor’s degree in English Literature from Sonoma State University. 
Deirdre is the immediate past President of the Arizona Chapter of the Society for Marketing Professional Services and serves on the board of the Arizona Association of Economic Development.    
Deirdre specializes in business and marketing planning, training and coaching key staff on business development activities, assisting in strategic project pursuits as well as supporting those firms through the implementation of the tactics needed for success. Deirdre is the Sargent that keeps your firm moving. 
Tonia Swanson, Captain Creative, TankGirl Marketing  
Tonia Swanson brings 13 years of design experience and a whole ammunition chest full of irreverence to TankGirl Marketing. She is responsible for all aspects of graphic design, marketing collateral, and corporate identities. Tonia earned her Bachelor of Science degree from North Dakota State University, holds certifications in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel, and extensive training in Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, and Photoshop.   
Tonia specializes in logo and identity design, ad design, PowerPoint presentations, computer illustration, proposal design and page layouts, brochures, e-marketing, infographics, and photo retouching. Tonia is Captain Creative, bringing the “pow” to your brand and all of your collateral. 

" The Tank Girl team did a fantastic job in facilitating our transition from more archaic software programs to InDesign.  The training they provided was purposeful and well-paced, but accounted for a variety of skill levels.  It has been the foundation of a very successful move into the 21st Century!” 
Jeffery Dorf, Rosendin Electric. 

Date:  March 26, 2015, with an optional second day on March 27, 2015 
Where:  Corbins Electric, 4829 South 38th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85040 
Cost:  $175/$50 for Members; $250/$100 for Non-members 
Program:  Registration 7:30 A.M.; Event 8:00 A.M. - 4:00 A.M. (both days) 
Event Contact:  Kristi Bigelow, CPSM, David Evans and Associates, kbigelow@deainc.com, 602.474.9244 
  
SMPS will offer a refund up to three days prior to the event; no refunds will be granted after this time.

description.text:
Meditation Teacher Training Program. 
This program is taught live as well as being offered online. The live classes are recorded in Mesa AZ, and provided the following day for online students world wide. 
Continue reading for opportunities to participate online and more detailed information 
Upon completion of the program the student will gain cognitive and experiential knowledge of every aspect of meditation and finish the program as a confident group and private meditation instructor. 
This is an in depth study program. There are five, six week courses that must be completed in the program to receive the Teacher Training Certification. 
Register at any time prior to the starting date of each course  
Course dates for the 2015 teacher training program are set as follows: 

·       January 15th, 22rd, 29th, February 5th, 12th, 19th
·       March 26th, April 2rd, 9th, 16th, 23th   30th
·       May 28nd, June 4th, 11th, 18th 25th  July 2nd  
·       August 6th, 15th, 20st, 27th, Sep 3th, 10th
·       October 8th, 15th, 22rd, 29th November 5th, 12th

This program will be exploring all of the primary methods of meditation as well as the following topics in detail:  
  
Topics Covered: 
Anapanasati (Mindfulness of breathing) 
Vipassana (insight) 
Metta Bhavana 
Walking Meditation 
Zazen 
Koan meditation 
Shikantaza 
Transcendental meditation 
Yoga 
Self Inquiry (Atma Vichara) 
The relaxation response 
Mantra meditation 
Visualization (contemplation, guided visualization) 
Passage meditation 
Ngondo 
Tonglen 
Tantra 
Dream yoga 
Qigong 
Tai chi chuan 
Kundalini 
Jhana 
Guided Meditation 
Defining Meditation 
Knowing what meditation is 
Explaining to others what is being taught 
The history of meditation 
An ancient practice 
The early meditators 
The function of the brain in meditation 
How the brain responds to meditation 
Why it works and related brain studies 
 Using the EEG-understanding brainwaves 
Understanding brain waves 
Hands on use of the electroencephalogram (EEG) 
 Religious and non-secular aspects of meditation 
How religions use meditation 
Meditation as a non-secular practice 
Health benefits of meditation 
De-stressing with meditation 
 Evidence of meditation's health effects 
The Physiological and Psychological effects of meditation 
Physiological changes that occur with regular meditation practice  
The psychological changes that occur with regular meditation practice 
Working with ADD 
How meditation heals and its effects on specific health conditions 
Anxiety 
Chronic pain 
Depression 
Hypertension 
Coronary artery disease 
Cancer and its related symptoms 
Identifying guidelines for practicing meditation 
Meditation equipment 
Meditation postures 
The Meditation place 
 What is insight? 
Experiential understanding and how to identify it 
Seeing reality 
Your true nature 
 Mindfulness  
The history of mindfulness 
What it can do 
How to use mindfulness 
Feelings and addictions 
                        What are feelings? 
What is an addiction? 
Substance abuse 
How feelings lead to addiction 
Setting up and promoting a private practice 
Advertising what you do 
Building confidence in your gift 
Getting the word out 
Working with the media 
Publishing books/articles 
When and when not to spend money 
Finding employment as a meditation instructor 
Working independently 
Incorporating meditation into your area of work 
Working with others 
 Class organization 
Who are you working with? 
Time restrictions and allowances 
·       Presenting a lecture 
The Power point option 
Why present and to whom 
Setting up a meditation retreat 
Giving retreaters what they want 
Retreat duration 
The program 
Giving the retreater nothing to do 
Centering techniques 
112 Meditation centering techniques 
The hindrances and aids to meditation 
The hindrances that course difficulties for the practice 
Using the aids in our meditation practices 
Mindfulness and concentration practices 
How concentration works 
The difference between Mindfulness and concentration 
Leading a meditation group 
Direct experience in facilitating a meditation class 
(Each student will gain hands on experience and confidence in leading and teaching meditation classes) 
  
Who should attend? 
Physicians and Physician Assistants 
Nurses and Nurse Practitioners 
Psychiatrists, Psychologists and Social Workers 
Pastoral Counselors 
Veteran Healthcare Providers 
Yoga Therapists 
Massage Therapists and other Body Workers 
Educators 
Occupational Therapists 
Complementary & Alternative Medicine Professionals 
Other Allied Health Professionals 
Individuals wishing to deepen their practice of meditation 
  
The instructor 
Shane Wilson is the course instructor; he founded the Meditation Learning Center in 2004 and is certified in meditation and is a minister through ordination by the Los Angeles Buddhist Union and the International Order of Buddhist Ministries. He studied meditation throughout the world with America, European, Chinese, Sri Lankan and Thai instructors and is fully dedicated toward helping those wishing to experience life with more joy and balance. He believes that by incorporating the correct practice and study of meditation and its related practices and modalities in to one’s life, this joy and balance can easily be accomplished by everyone. Shane provides meditation and class instruction for the Arizona International Buddhist Meditation Center of Mesa Arizona (A.I.B.M.C.) as well as providing opportunities through the Meditation Learning Center in the form of classes, courses, retreats and by meeting with individuals as a spiritual mentor and counselor using traditional western therapies along with meditation and mindfulness practices. For more information visit: www.shanewilson.org 
  
Enrollment Fees: 
  
 All five modules must be completed to receive The Meditation Learning Center, Teacher Training Certificate.  
  
The enrollment cost for each six week module is $240 there are a total of five modules within the program with a total cost of $1,200. Each course can be paid individually or the entire program can be paid in advance at the reduced rate of $1040. (The student will have two weeks to decide on participation in the program after the full payment option is received and the module has started).The full payment option can be paid for on this site or by mailing a personal check to the address below. 
 This online course study will consist of  weekly video viewing, Study materials and a weekly quiz. The course format will be the same material as the live classes which are offered to thoses in the Pheonix Arizona area. The live classes are recorded and viewed on line. 
Any refunds will be considered for total program payments only, prorated based on the individual six week module price minus any processing fees. 
Please direct any questions about this program to: 
 Shane Wilson at: Shane@meditationlearningcenter.com or by calling 480.513.7747 (please be prepared to leave a message) 

Registration - Payments can be made by check by mail or by credit card here on this site.  
Send check for the appropriate amount (depending upon your choice of live or online options) include: email address, home or street address, and phone number to: 
The Meditation Learning Center 
1030 W. 9th Street 
Mesa, AZ 85201 

If you would like to pay by check, once a check is received you will be contacted immediately and a receipt will be mailed to you. 
Please call 480-513-7747 if another form of payment is preferred or if there are questions

description.text:
Using Today's Tools to Gain More Listings 
**3 Hours General Credit - Hot Lunch Provided**  
In this class, agents are given the necessary tools and understanding needed to create the Ultimate Listing Presentation.  Agents using this method are sure to impress even the most discriminating seller.  We teach you to use cutting-edge tools in order to maximize a listing's exposure and utilize it to then attract new business. 
Agents will leave with: 

An in-depth understanding of the expectations of today's sellers
The ability to use technological tools, including single property websites, syndication, and social media that will amaze your sellers
The ability to do Search Engine Optimization (SEO) for the listing prior to the appointment
An understanding of why these tools are necessary in today's high tech world
A step-by-stop guide to create the Ultimate Listing Presentation, using these tools
A FINISHED PRODUCT!  You will leave our workshop with a fantastic listing presentation to engage your clients and win the listing!

RSVP by Friday, March 20th to secure your seat!

Experience Dyslexia! 
     After a brief description of dyslexia, participants experience firsthand the emotional, behavioral, and psychological impact that individuals with dyslexia and other language difficulties experience in educational situations every day. 
     The participants are exposed to “learning” stations involving reading, writing, spelling, and listening at an adult level to ‘simulate’ students' interaction with many aspects of the curriculum.

description.text:
Healthcare costs are going up.  Community rating is right around the corner.  Employees are unhappy.  The Affordable Care Act continues to change the playing field.  What you have been doing will not work going forward. 
Lovitt & Touché has stayed on the forefront with information and new ideas.

description.text:
THE COMPLETE GUIDE TO SETTING UP QUICKBOOKS ONLINE HANDS-ON TRAINING FOR THE ENTREPRENEUR AND SMALL BUSINESS  
QuickBooks is the most popular bookkeeping software for entrepreneurs and small business. Special guest speaker, Holly Trafelet will be covering in detail the process of setting up and using QuickBooks Online. The newest version for small business, entrepreneurs and startups is an online subscription service. This seminar is a part of the MCE Pro Series and is a two hour hands-on workshop. The first hour will be focused on the steps required to effectively set-up your bookkeeping on QuickBooks. The second hour will be a detailed questions and answer period. You may bring your computers, iPads or paper printouts and ask specific detailed questions which Holly will answer when possible.  
(If you use the desktop version, the concepts are similar even if the screens look different.) 
 SPECIAL GUEST: Holly Trafelet is a Degreed Accountant and Certified QuickBooks Proadvisor. Partnered with her father, Myron P. Trafelet Jr. CPA at Trafelet Accounting PLLC, she has served the small business community in Maricopa since 2007.

description.text:
The Southern Arizona Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics (S-AzAND) is the local district of our national parent organization, the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics, and our State organization, the Arizona Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics. Members include Registered Dietitians and Dietetic Technicians, residing in the counties of Pima, Santa Cruz, Greenlee, and Cochise. Members from Pinal and Graham counties may choose either to be members of the Southern or Central District.
S-AZAND district is your advocate in the field of dietetics and nutrition. The district supports its members through continuing education and networking opportunities. Our members provide the public with food and nutrition information and education through participation in local health fairs and events such as Food Day at University of Arizona.

Don't miss our Quest for the Best vocal competition and reception March 28, 2015. Get tickets.

The Opera Guild assists local voice students, both undergraduate and graduate, with scholarships, grants, competitive prizes, and opportunities to perform for the community.

Don't miss our Quest for the Best vocal competition and reception March 28, 2015. Get tickets.

description.text:
Think you’re a good judge of vocal talent? Here’s an opportunity to test your ears against a few hundred fellow listeners while enjoying operatic arias sung by the best of southern Arizona’s voice students. 
The event is the twelfth annual Quest for the Best vocal competition and recital, to be held at Holsclaw Hall, in the Music Building on the UA campus, Saturday, March 28, 2015, at 1:00 p.m. 
UA voice students will vie for cash prizes, in separate graduate and undergraduate categories. The vote of the audience, by written ballot, will determine the winners. While ballots are counted, the Opera Guild of Southern Arizona hosts a wine and hors d’oeuvres reception where the audience can chat with the singers and faculty. 
To enter the competition students must be nominated by their professors. Last year, 15 students competed and $8000 was awarded. The event is presented to the community by the the Opera Guild of Southern Arizona, in cooperation with the University of Arizona’s School of Music. 
Admission to Quest for the Best is $50, partially tax-deductible; student and Fine Arts faculty admission is $20. 
Please Note: Ticket prices are higher on the day of the event. Please book early.  
Free parking and shuttle service are available at the Park Avenue Garage; it is a short walk through the underpass below Speedway Blvd. to Holsclaw Hall.

description.text:
Being a killer coder is great, but what if you had a go-to designer who could help create amazing visuals and make your sites look even better? On the flip side, every digital designer knows a good developer is the key to making your work come to life. Join us to network with other digital workers who can partner with you on projects, help create an even better final product, and make you look like a hero to your clients. 
Here's how the event will work: 
- Attendees will have name tags and "Speeding Tickets", which will include everyone's names, email addresses, and specialty areas so you can easily stay in touch. 
- Just like speed dating, each designer/developer duo will have a few minutes to talk and then fill out a form to see if there's a mutual desire to follow up. 
- There also will be open networking before or after the event so everyone can mix and mingle. You'll leave with new business contacts, friends, and inspiration for your next project. 
**Event registration includes one complimentary drink and appetizers.** 
Note: Please, no recruiters. We love helping people find jobs, but this event is for peer networking only.

description.text: Adam and Rosie Stoffel have been married for 20 years and have been members of Cornerstone Christian Center for 22 years. This is their second marriage, blending their family together with 3 daughters (1 from each of their marriages). Adam and Rosie have been counseling couples for the past five years under the National Association of Marriage Enhancement and feel a burden for blended families.  In addition to the NAME certification, they have also been a member of AACC with diplomas in Biblical Counseling through Light University.

description.text: This conference is specifically designed to help build a proper framework for blended families. Blended families come in all shapes and sizes with their own unique set of challenges.  Our desire is to minister to blended families in areas that are most prevalent and difficult to navigate. Topics for this conference will include: Foundations of a Remarriage, Trust, The Triangle, His Hers and Ours, Love and Respect, Breaking the Curse of Divorce, and Mission Possible.  In addition to the teachings, you will be to participate in a question and answer panel session with the Stoffel Family.

description.text:
Wedding Planning 101  
  
At the Arizona Wedding Circles Wedding Planning 101 workshop you will hear from our team of professionals who will give you tips and some pretty good advice on what to look for when hiring wedding professionals and services.  
Hear from our wedding and event planner Christina Anderson of Big C Consulting Services LLC in Peoria Arizona, as she covers some very basic information and answer the big question "why do I need to hire a planner?" the answer might surprise you. 
Looking for invitations or Save the Date cards? our invitation specialist Tami Swerdfeger of Posh Invitations in Phoenix will explain some basics about choosing the right invitation, font style and proper wording to make your invitations classy and elegant. 
Our officiant  Reverand Mary Riley of Creating Weddings from the Heart  who is also an accomplished author will go over some information and excerpts from her new book "Help, I'm getting married!" soon to be released on Amazon.com. 
And last but not least have your photo taken by our professional  photographer Angela Hetherington if Images by Angela. 
After the workshop you will be able to mix and mingle with our other vendors and get a guided tour of the Glendale Civic Center, your registration automatically enters you to win some fabulous gifts and prizes. 
Last month we gave away a wedding cake valued at $350.00!  
So no matter where you are with planning your big day there will be something for everybody!   
  
FAQs 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No, just check in at the registration table. 
  
  
  
FAQs 
  
What is the refund policy? 
The vendor fee is not refundable. 
  




  
Tami Swerdfeger
Posh Invitations
Invitation Specialist


  
Angela Hetherington
Images by Angela
Photographer


  
Reverend Mary Riley
Creating Weddings From the Heart
Officiant/Author


  
Christina Anderson
Big C Consulting Services LLC
Certified Wedding Specialist

description.text:
Great Hearts Academies is a non-profit network of public charter schools dedicated to improving education in the Phoenix metropolitan area by developing excelling preparatory academies that offer 6th through 12th grade. As such, Great Hearts is able to provide our families with a top-tier preparatory education in a fully public and tuition-free setting. 
Please join us for an informational tour of our campus.  
*To use our time most effectively, a minimum of three separate attendees will be required in order to hold the tour. A notice will go out to attendees if the tour is rescheduled. Thank you!

description.text:
Windows Azure public cloud platform is one of the three pillars of Microsoft’s Cloud OS vision that will transform the traditional datacenter environment, help businesses unlock insights in data stored anywhere, enable the development of a wide range of modern business applications, and empower IT to support users who work anywhere on any device while being able to manage these devices in a secure and consistent way.  
The other two pillars of the Cloud OS are, of course, Windows Server 2012 R2 and Microsoft System Center 2012 R2.  
Data Management 
Windows Azure data services allow businesses to store, access, analyze, and protect their data while making it available from anywhere and at any time. From storing data in SQL databases in the cloud to analysis and reporting, Windows Azure provides different services that can meet the needs of your business. 
Analytics 
Windows Azure also includes business analytics solutions you can use for discovery and data enrichment. Windows Azure Virtual Machines allows you to deploy and use SQL Server business analytics technologies like Reporting and Analysis Services and Microsoft SharePoint Server in virtual machines running in the cloud. Organizations that need to maintain control over their business analytics solutions can build hybrid solutions with data and applications that span both on-premises databases and storage in the Windows Azure public cloud. 
Applications 
Running applications is the heart of what Windows Azure is all about. To enable running your business applications in the cloud, Windows Azure provides services for managing user identity, enabling applications to interact with each other, push out notifications to users, deliver compelling media experiences, and more. 
Join us for what will be an interesting presentation and discussion on how Windows Azure and its many features—from your server to the cloud to your productivity—may enhance your business! 
With your registration you will receive advance notification of future live partner showcase events!

description.text:
Sat 3/28: The One I Love – (2014) R (91 min) 
Doors Open 5:30 – Movie starts at 7PM 
Mark Duplas, Elisabeth Moss     LADIES’S NIGHT!  
The highly anticipated debut feature from acclaimed author Charlie McDowell, THE ONE I LOVE is an original tale that continues to showcase McDowell's keen observations of human relationships with a distinct and comedic voice. Says more about intimacy and individuality than any romantic comedy or romantic tragedy in years.                    
 Film Festival Award Winner  -  Reinvigorates the Romantic Comedy! 


Dining - Tickets - Policies 


The BISBEE ROYALE is open from 5:30pm-10:00pm on Friday & Saturday Nights!  
Dine in the Royale Theatre during your movie or in the upscale Casablanca Bar & Lounge. Enjoy great Food, WIne, Beer & Cocktails before, during and after the film. 
We also offer Pizza, Wine & Beer TO GO 

           MENU 
WE OFFER A GREAT SELECTION OF WINE, BEER & COCKTAILS!  
APPETIZERS 
CLASSIC SHRIMP COCKTAIL 10 Five Large Shrimp with Cocktail Sauce & Lemon 
HUMMUS PLATE 5 Assorted Veggies with Crackers and Red Pepper Hummus 
EDAMAME 5 Steamed Soy Bean Pods, Himalayan Salt 
SPICY CHICKEN WINGS 10 Baked Wings (8), Asian Dipping Sauce, Veggies & Ranch 
RAVIOLI APPETIZER 7 Ravioli with Marinara Sauce & Garlic Bread 
ITALIAN MEATBALL APPETIZER 8 House Made Meatballs, Marinara & Garlic Bread 
Hand Crafted 9" Artisan Pizzas 
SAY CHEESE: 8 Marinara Sauce & Mozzarella 
THE GODFATHER: 9 Marinara Sauce & Mozzarella with Pepperoni 
THE ROYALE: 10 Roasted Eggplant with Garlic, Caramelized Onions, Brie Cheese and Pesto 
CRAZY HEART (specify VEGGIE or VEGAN ): 10 Artichoke Hearts, Spinach, Marinara Sauce, Roasted Red Peppers with Feta Cheese 
THE CASABLANCA: 11 Pesto Chicken, Sun Dried Tomatoes, Steamed Broccoli with Ricotta Cheese 
LA DOLCE VITA: 11 Spicy Italian Sausage, Roasted Red Peppers & Onions, Marinara, Mozzarella 
RAISING ARIZONA: 12 Shrimp, Salsa, Mozzarella w Fresh Jalapeños, Cilantro, Spicy Sour Cream 
ENTER THE DRAGON: 14 Roast Duck, Hoisin Sauce, Mozzarella, Scallions, Carrots & Cucumber, Ginger, Sesame Seeds 
(GLUTEN FREE PIZZA NOT AVAILABLE) 
COMBO PLATES 
EDAMAME & SPICY ASIAN WINGS 14 
RAVIOLI & MEATBALL DINNER 14 (with two pieces of Garlic Bread) 
ASSORTED HOUSE MADE DESSERTS 
  
Tickets & Policies  
• All ticket sales final. Refunds, exchanges or retroactive discounts are not possible. 
• Cameras, camera phones, texting & cell phones during performances not permitted. 
• Absolutely no outside food or beverages allowed inside the Royale, including water bottles. 
• We reserve the right to refuse service to anyone no matter who you are, who you think you are, or who your Daddy is.  
  
Age Restrictions  
• No Patrons under the age of 16 admitted to this event. 
• Due to the mature nature of our venue, babies are never allowed inside the Royale.

Disability Concerns helps churches intentionally seek:  To end the isolation and disconnectedness of persons with disabilities and their families;  To nurture the spiritual lives of people with disabilities so that they become professing and active members  of their churches; and  To encourage the gifts of people with disabilities so that they can serve God fully in their churches.

Thanks so much for planning to attend the ONE Conference. We are excited about our keynote speaker and workshops that we are able to offer for the glory of God and the strengthening of his church. Our keynote speech and Q&A session will be live in Temecula and broadcast to conference sites in Ripon, CA and Glendale, AZ.  
  
Individual registration is $49. If others members of your church are attending the conference, you can receive a discounted rate of $39 per attendee. To receive the discounted rate, please enter promo code "ONECHURCH" when directed.  
  
By registering for this conference I authorize Christian Reformed and Reformed Church in America Disability Concerns Ministries (Disability Concerns) to record my name, image, and voice at this conference. I also agree that Disability Concerns may use this recording, video/audio, film or photograph or any part thereof and may use my name, likeness, and voice for publicity or promotion without any compensation or payment being made for any such use.  
  
We want people to be able to attend. A limited number of partial scholarships are available if even this discounted rate is burdensome. Please ask your church first for assistance to attend this conference. If you cannot receive assistance from your church, please call Beverly at 616-224-0844 for scholarship information.

description.text:
Join Learning Ovations and Read On Arizona, along with public school superintendents, charter school leaders, foundation leaders, legislators and community advocates to learn about the latest research and technology out of ASU. This technology can teach 94% of children to read by the end of third grade, and increase proficient and advanced reading rates to 75%.   
Jay Connor, the Founder and CEO of Learning Ovations will be speaking about how professional development for individualizing instruction and A2i (Assessment to Instruction) technology can make all the difference for your student's achievement.  
He will also discuss our partnerships for funding for this solution, including the Digital Learning Alliance who are working to move legislation to fund education technology, philanthropic support, and using Move On When Reading funding to implement this literacy focused research and technology in your school.  
  
How Learning Ovations' Technology Works 
www.LearningOvations.com

description.text: Founded in 1947, Tempe Republican Women works to politically educate its members and contribute to our community.
description.html: Founded in 1947, Tempe Republican Women works to politically educate its members and contribute to our community.

description.text:
This month, don’t miss out on a very special Tempe Republican Women meeting. Marc Victor, Phoenix Defense Attorney, and Bill Montgomery, Maricopa County Attorney, will be facing off in a debate on Marijuana Legalization. Victor will be representing the side that is supportive of legalization and Montgomery will be representing the side that is against legalization. 
TRW is very excited to announce that Shane Krauser, constitutional law expert, will be moderating the debate. 
This will be an interesting and attention grabbing event. Seating is limited. First come, first served – although confirmed members and associates of TRW will be given seating preference at the front of the room. If you want a guaranteed seat, then now is a good time to join our club: Join Us. Membership is open to all registered Republican women in the state of Arizona. Registered Republican men may join as associates. 
Please confirm your attendance. 
This event is open. However, TRW reserves the right to have security remove members of the audience at our discretion. Photography is allowed - video recordings of the event are not allowed. No exceptions. 
This event is FREE. A suggested donation is $10, although any dollar amount is helpful. Donate Here.  
Donations are not tax deductible. TRW is a 527 organization.   
Where: Pyle Recreation Center, 655 E Southern Ave, Tempe 
When: March 23rd, 6:30PM 
 
  
Marc J. Victor has represented clients in more than a thousand major felony cases including first and second degree murder, sex cases, gun cases, major drug cases, complex white collar cases, federal appeals, and other complex state and federal matters. Jury trial experience includes several murder trials including death eligible matters as well as complex sex cases. 
  
 
Bill Montgomery was first elected Maricopa County Attorney in a Special Election in 2010 and re-elected in 2012 on a pledge to fight crime, honor victims’ rights, and protect and strengthen our community. As a West Point Graduate, decorated Gulf War Veteran, former Deputy County Attorney and a professional prosecutor, he has dedicated his personal and professional life to serving others. 
Bill earned his J.D. from ASU’s College of Law, graduating Magna Cum Laude and receiving the Order of the Coif. As a prosecutor with the Maricopa County Attorney’s Office, he quickly gained a reputation as an aggressive prosecutor, later serving as a Bureau Chief of the Auto Theft Bureau, which recorded a 35% drop in auto theft under his leadership. 
  
  
Shane Krauser is the director of the American Academy for Constitutional Education and widely sought after due to his expertise. He is an adjunct professor of constitutional and criminal law, a certified NRA firearms instructor, the chief instructor of K-Force Vanguard and a former prosecutor. He is also the author of Your Nation to Save and is a radio talk show host in Arizona.

description.text:
First Time Homebuyer Workshop
 
Attend this workshop to learn about programs and resources available for first time homebuyers.  Topics include the following:

Individual Development Account (IDA) program- get up to $15,000 (forgivable loan)
Community Land Trust (CLT) program – is a CLT home right for you
Sources for down payment assistance and other resources
Neighborhood Stabilization Program (NSP) opportunities
Credit issues – what do lenders expect
How do lenders decide your loan amount
How to calculate your buying power
How you can increase your buying power
How Newtown Housing Counselors can help

description.text:
Tempe Festival of the Arts   Spring event   March 27-29,2015 
Become part of a vibrant, skilled volunteer community with opportunities for training and progressing in volunteer leadership with the festival. Learn new skill developement, enjoy the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped others, and have fun. 
 Every volunteer recevies the Offical Tempe Festival of the Arts T-shirt. For descriptions of volunteer oppertunities please log onto   www.tempefestivalofthearts.com  
The Tempe Festival of the Arts semi-annual events are among the oldest and largest festivals of their kind in the Desert Southwest. The Fall Festival spans more than four decades, and the Spring Festival is more than 30 years old. These two events are routinely ranked among the top fine art festivals in the nation.Each of the Festivals attracts more than 225,000 guest during its three days on Mill Avenue in Dowtown Tempe Arizona.

description.text:
INTRO TO SOUL SEX - Phoenix AZ 
  
*** EARLY BIRD $85 PER PERSON *** 
Early Bird until MAR 18, $85 per person. After MAR 18, $95 per person. 
 Questions: jenny@jennyferry.com or 503.902.1197  
  
This workshop is open to singles and partners. LGBTQI-friendly.  
This is advanced human development training; there is NO nudity, sexual demonstration or activity at this event. 
Note of love + generosity: No one will be turned away for lack of funds. Please contact me directly with your financial truth + to be considered for a partial or full gift registration: jenny@jennyferry.com 
THIS IS A 3-HOUR WORKSHOP 
*** 
Someone once said, how you show up in bed is how you show up in your life. What if you could make small changes to your sex life and have the results affect your life as a whole? 
WHAT IS SOUL SEX? 
First of all, it’s not what you think. It’s not about having some pie-in-the-sky spiritual experience. It’s about being embodied + fully alive from the bottom up. (Pun intended!) 
Soul Sex is about bringing mindfulness into every aspect of our daily lives; about living a life that’s in alignment with what we really want, a life that’s connected to our body. Grounded, real + in the present moment. And fully embodied as a sexual being. 
AND, did you know you have an organic sexual response? How do you interact with sexual energy in a healthy + generative way? How do you express your sexuality consciously? 
INTRO TO SOUL SEX is about learning to skillfully recognize + navigate how you respond to sexual energy. You’ll gain deep insight into the three ways you respond, akin to the primal defense responses of fight, flight or freeze. You’ll learn to identify how you show up + how your partner shows up in intimate discussion + interaction. And you’ll learn the precise antidote for restoring flow to yourself + within your relationship. 
Soul Sex is about cultivating conscious relationship + intimacy at the speed of connection and in the fertile soil of trust. All while holding yourself + your partner within the context of curiosity, compassion + playfulness.  
At INTRO TO SOUL SEX you'll learn to incorporate these guiding principles in all areas of your life. Ultimately, you’ll: 


LEARN to skillfully and competently manage your sexual beingness and energy.
IMPROVE how you communicate and engage, increase your capacity for sensation.
TRANSFORM how you show up in the bedroom + in the world for the better


 
And it starts with your sexuality as the doorway to creating sustainable changes and thriving your life. 
At INTRO TO SOUL SEX, through simple instruction, lively discussion and PG-rated interaction you will drop into your body, challenge your mind, and live just a little farther outside your box than usual. 
This workshop is CO-ED and LGBTQI-friendly. OPEN to singles and partners. This is advanced human development training; there is NO nudity, sexual demonstration or activity at this event. 
Come spend 3 hours gently pushing your edges with other fun, adventurous people in a beautiful, safe, judgment-free space. 
***** “Revolutionary and paradigm shifting! Jenny has a gift of both directly and gently inviting people to look at their assumptions and understanding of sex. She offers a refreshing micro (individual) and macro (societal) perspective on owning our sex in a way that’s nourishing.” ~Kelly L., Boulder, CO 
“This was a self-healing, eye-opening experience in a big way. Some very powerful stuff was ignited for me tonight.” ~Patricia K., Victoria, BC, Canada  “Jenny’s workshop gave me the courage to desire really owning my sensuality and creativity, my unique flavour of who I am and what I feel. I feel that with Jenny my fear and my pain are as valid, honoured and acknowledged as my power and my sex.” ~Maartje G., Victoria, BC, Canada  *****  JENNY FERRY is an emerging leader in the field of conscious sexuality, creator of the ground-breaking Intro to Soul Sex workshop, and author of the forthcoming book, Soul Sex: A Field Guide to Redeeming Our Primal Desire to Connect. 
A visionary and dynamic teacher, Jenny is based out of the Pacific Northwest and leads workshops throughout the U.S. and Canada. She is highly regarded for her down-to-earth, compassionate training, speaking, and leadership. Learn more about Jenny at: http://jennyferry.com 
"After a series of deeply connected + successful visits of sell-out workshops from LA to Vancouver, I am excited to meet people who are vitally interested in raising awareness, engaging in honest + respectful discourse + approaching their sexuality with consciousness."   QUESTIONS? FEEL FREE TO REACH OUT:  jenny@jennyferry.com / 503.902.1197

description.text:
The Arizona Healthcare Executives (AHE) is the Arizona Chapter of American College of Healthcare Executives (ACHE) - a network of healthcare professionals dedicated to the career development of its membership. AHE represents professionals from across the healthcare continuum including hospitals, managed care organizations, long term/chronic care organizations, governmental bodies, educational institutions, consulting services, federations, and associations.
The organization promotes corporate social responsibility to ensure its social performance meets/exceeds the social objectives it has established for itself. To promote member success, AHE provides supportive and respectful professional collaboration that fosters educational opportunities, offers networking events, provides mentoring opportunities, and encourages volunteering opportunities to nurture the professional and personal advancement of its members.
AHE is committed to its members' success by improving operations, being a good steward of the organization's resources, pursuing opportunities to promote the organization's capabilities, ensuring a good reputation in the community, and attracting potential members and partners in the community. AHE's Board of Directors and Chapter members are expected to model the mission, vision, and values for the organization at all times.

description.text:
When developing new products and services, healthcare professionals must have a comprehensive understanding of their consumers—their needs, values and communication preferences. Accordingly, a well-thought out marketing strategy is vital to the success of your organization. To stay competitive, the strategy must continuously measure effectiveness and make appropriate adjustments. 
Topics for Discussion: 
Marketing Fundamentals  The importance of marketing—build awareness, influence consumer decision making  The role of the four Ps of market positioning—product/service, price, place, promotion  The impact of the marketing strategy on the bottom line  The role of senior executives—resource allocation and prioritization, serve as liaison between administration and marketing staff Market Research  How to ascertain the need for new products and services and why these needs are currently unmet  What tools are needed to evaluate the size of potential market?  What are the key criteria is determining the viability of a new product or service?  Why a thorough competitive analysis is a critical component. Developing a Marketing, Implementation, Measurement Project Plans  Conduct an internal audit/environmental scan—current products/services, consumer characteristics and      utilization patterns  Identify and prioritize strategies, goals, objectives and actions  Develop an implementation matrix for each action—list required resources (e.g., staff time, money)  Identify report card metrics/measurement tools and protocol Measuring Effectiveness  How to measure effectiveness  Measurement tools and resources  Cost benefit analysis—are the benefits worth the costs? 
Please Join our Expert Panel: 
Jeff Narcoci 

Mr. Nardoci joined Banner Health in 2014 as Senior Vice President/Chief Strategy and Marketing Officer. In this role he leads four consumer-oriented departments including Branding, Public Relations, Service Excellence, and Strategy and Planning.

Jeffery Buehrle 

Jeffery Buehrle joined Banner Health (then Lutheran Health Systems) in 1987 as a cost accountant. He was promoted to several positions including Finance Manager, Finance Director and was named Finance Administrator and CFO of the Lutheran Healthcare Network in 1998. In 2000 he was promoted to a corporate role as the System Director of Budget and Decision Support.  In 2006 he was named the System Vice President of Planning and Decision Support.  In 2009 Buehrle was promoted to his current role of Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Arizona East Region.

Sean Glen 

Sean W. Glenn is an Associate Administrator for Mayo Clinic in Arizona and is responsible for the Department of Internal Medicine and the Transplant Center.   Additionally, Sean is the senior administrator for the Outpatient Care Delivery Platform, which is the group responsible for providing leadership to the outpatient practice across all of Mayo.

description.text:
SALARA is southern Arizona’s only membership organization which focus on the education and advocacy needs specific to the hotel and resort industry. More than 80 members strong, SALARA provides a unified voice on issues that impact our businesses and employees.
SALARA’s Mission Statement
SALARA’s mission is to create and sustain an environment which enhances member & industry success today and in the near future.
SALARA’s Core Values
SALARA’s core values are to create and sustain an environment which enhances member and industry leadership success today and in the future by partnering with community interests in developing opportunities for growth and sustainability. It is essential that SALARA continuously presents to its members revenue enhancing ideas as well as cost saving initiatives that may assist them in managing more profitable operations. Our members have opportunities to be educated on industry trends, have the ability to network with industry colleagues and have a collective voice in local political issues.

description.text:
SALARA Member Luncheon 
  
When:              Wednesday, March 25, 2015 
11:30 a.m.—Registration / Check-In Opens 
12:00-12:30 p.m.—Luncheon 
12:30—1:15 p.m.—Program 
  
Location:         Viscount Suites, 4855 E Broadway Blvd., Tucson, Arizona 
  
Cost:                $29 Members   |   $39 non-Members/Guests           
  
Speaker:         Kimberly Klein 
  
Topic:              SAFE Properties: How the Lodging Industry is Combating Child Sex Trafficking 
  
Description:   
While it may be hard to believe, human trafficking is happening in communities just like yours. Researchers estimate as many as 300,000 American youth may be at risk of being exploited for commercial sex in the U.S. annually. Arizona benefits from a wonderful climate as well as high profile events and major sports attractions, which sadly, are also targeted by traffickers. The O'Connor House SAFE (Safeguarding Adolescents From Exploitation) Action Project is working to train hospitality staff to ensure their properties and businesses aren't unknowingly being used to facilitate this heinous crime. In this lunch presentation, learn about the training options available to your property and how you can become a part of a network of aware and committed hotel industry professionals working together to address this issue. 
GMs are encouraged to attend, but bring your front desk people, your doormen, your security personnel and your sales staff. This problem is currently in the national news and is not going away. Your awareness of this issue will prepare your team to avoid problems. Don’t miss this meeting.  
  
We will also have an update on our legislative efforts in Phoenix to re-purpose the Pima County Sports and Tourism Authority.  
Register by: Monday, March 23, 2015

description.text: Sara Gullickson is the Executive Director of DispensaryPermits.com, the Vice President of Sales and Marketing for MariMedAdvisors.com and a national leader in the medical marijuana consulting industry. As an influential woman in the cannabis reform movement, Sara has a vision for the medical marijuana industry of wellness and accessibility. It is with this vision, that she has passionately guided clients through every step of the medical marijuana process. From application processes to logistics and cultivation practices, Sara has successfully advised numerous groups in seven states’ medical cannabis processes over the last four years. Combined with nearly a decade of experience executing online and traditional marketing campaigns, Gullickson has used her comprehensive knowledge to assist and consult on successful applications across the United States and currently is working with applicants in Illinois, Nevada, New Hampshire, Delaware, Florida and New York. Sara has mastered the intricate balance between community involvement, knowledge of local markets, awareness of ever-changing legislation, and most importantly, wellness that has proven to be the key to success throughout the U.S.

description.text:
Curious how women are finding their way to the top of the cannabis industry around the country? Jazmin Hupp, Women Grow's Co-Founder & Executive Director, will present how women are building national brands and preparing for international legalization. In an industry where you're always focused on the local, now is the time to think national. You'll learn what steps you can take now to ensure your business will not get lost in the flood of newcomers as marijuana goes mainstream.  
This event is for men and women at any stage of their cannabis career. Whether you are just researching the industry or have already launched your business, you'll learn how to choose the best next steps.  
EVENT AGENDA 

12:00PM Check-in and Networking
12:15PM Lunch is Served
12:30PM How Women Can & Should Dominate the Cannabis Industry with Jazmin Hupp, Women Grow Executive Director
1:00PM Panel on Preparing for Recreational & National Legalization with Industry Best Practices. Featuring Laura Bianchi, Esq. (Rose Law Group) and Jane Fix (Monarch).
2:00PM Event Concludes

ABOUT OUR SPEAKER 
Jazmin Hupp, Women Grow 
Jazmin Hupp is the Executive Director & Co-founder of Women Grow, which connects, educates, and empowers the next generation of cannabis industry leaders by creating programs for aspiring and current business executives. Building upon over a decade of entrepreneurship in technology and retail, she consults women starting businesses in the legal cannabis field. 
Jazmin works with clients launching or pivoting new businesses at the business strategy consulting and marketing agency, MEIER. Collaboratively they’ve launched BrandingCannabis.com to further marketing conversations in the industry. 
Follow Jazmin on Twitter @jazminhupp. 
FAQs  
Who attends? 
You'll meet women and men at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. You'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.  
Why should I attend? 
Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. 
Together we have more power.  As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.  
How can I get the most out of networking events? 
We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members. 
Can I pay at the door? 
Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring $80 cash. 
Are tickets refundable or transferrable?  
You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.  
Will this event be held again? 
This is a special one-time-only event in Phoenix. Women Grow holds a monthly networking event in Phoenix. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.   
Why do you charge for events? 
Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.  
Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? 
Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

Follow Jazmin on Twitter @jazminhupp.

Who attends?

You'll meet women and men at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. You'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself. 

Why should I attend?

Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members.

Together we have more power.  As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders. 

How can I get the most out of networking events?

We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Can I pay at the door?

Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring $80 cash.

Are tickets refundable or transferrable? 

You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable. 

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us. 

Will this event be held again?

This is a special one-time-only event in Phoenix. Women Grow holds a monthly networking event in Phoenix. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.  

Why do you charge for events?

Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities. 

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry?

Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

description.text: Join bestselling author and mental health expert, Rebecca Hintze, M.Sc. for a morning of happiness as she discusses the contents of her new book, "Essentially Happy!"  The book is based on research regarding the connection between mental health and nutrition (particularly doTERRA's LLV supplement program), life-style choices, and healthy relationships.  With over 350 million people suffering from depression world-wide, Rebecca Hintze offers powerful solutions available through mother nature.  Join Rebecca for an event you will cherish and one that will change the way you look at recovering from mental illness.

description.text:
Would you like to learn  
Youth Mental Health First Aid  
(YMHFA)? 
NARBHA and MHFA-USA are conducting a FREE 8-hour YMHFA training course to train individuals to provide YMHFA in their communities.   
This training is provided by Nationally-Certified Instructors. 
  
  
Our audience is often: 

teachers, school administrators, first responders, coaches, faith-based leaders, behavioral health providers, community leaders, parents, youth leaders, etc.

Our goals are to: 

increase awareness and knowledge about mental illness and substance use
decrease fear and negative reactions to human beings experiencing problems
walk away feeling comfortable to help youth in our community

  
Youth Mental Health First Aid is a program that teaches family members, friends, teachers, coaches, and neighbors how to recognize and help someone who may be developing a mental health problem or experiencing a mental health or substance abuse crisis. You can help those in need.

Child Care Resource & Regerral (CCR&R) provides assistance to families seeking child care and to child care providers.  Resources that are available at no charge include:
 
For Families:

Information about your child care choices/child care referrals
Guidelines about what to look for in quality child care
Parent Newsletters
Information about assistance and options for paying for child care

 
For Providers:

Listing on the child care referral database
Referrals to your business/program
Help with business, child care, and regulatory questions
Information about trainings and workshops
Arizona Child Care Job Bank
Receive a quarterly newsletter

 
For the Community:

Information about classes and trainings
Child care supply and demand information 

 
To receive more detailed information about child care programs and what to look for in quality child care, please contact CCR&R at:
1-800-308-9000

You are invited to join us for a special talk on the Transcendental Meditation (TM) technique. Space is limited so we suggest you reserve your seat now. Admission is free. 
The TM® Technique has been learned by over 6 million people, and over 350 published studies have found it effective for relieving stress, anxiety, improving health and wellness, and more.  
What you'll learn: 

Why TM is so effective for stress and anxiety
How TM promotes health and wellness
What happens during TM
Why anyone can practice TM
Why TM works from the start
How to learn TM in Scottsdale

And of course we'll allow ample time for your questions.

description.text:
Welcome to Arizona Salon Professionals. This group was founded by Christian James in order to create an atmosphere to share Education, Ideas, Industry News, Post Pictures and Salon Job Opportunities! This group was created by Stylists FOR Stylists. The Arizona Salon Professionals Page is a POSITIVE, Respectful, Friendly, Uplifting, Passionate, Knowledgeable, REAL group of professionals and cosmetology students...here for one reason- our immense love and passion for the beauty industry! The rules are Clear and Simple:  Please read and abide by all of them in order to ensure a positive, orderly group environment.*You must be a licensed cosmetologist/barber or enrolled cosmetology student/barber.*Critique to provide positive feedback...for the purposes of learning and growth. THINK before you post..."Will my comment hurt or offend another member?" If so, you might want to keep it to yourself or find a way to communicate your point in a positive, constructive manner.
*When referring to manufacturers and products, you are more than welcome to talk about how great your products are, or the products you use.  Please refrain, however, from making negative and/or defamatory comments about other products lines.  If you're product is great, there is no reason to distract from it by mentioning another line.
*In order to mitigate any chance of legal action, we no longer allow posts regarding disorders of the skin and scalp. The main purpose is to eliminate risk to clients and members by misdiagnosis or improper treatment. For your safety and that of others please refer to physician.*Please do not post screenshots that show client names or other stylist's names, profile pictures, or identifying marks. Please protect everyone’s privacies. *Arizona Salon Professionals exercise ZERO tolerance for hurtful, rude, condescending, malicious or offensive behavior. Topics such as race, religion, sexuality and politics are not suitable for group discussion.*Plagiarism is STRICTLY PROHIBITED! If you would like to use an image another member has posted...please ask permission and credit the artist. It is HIGHLY recommended that you watermark all of your images.*This isn't the place for ranting, venting or bad mouthing. This is not the place.*No spamming/selling non-professional products (typically MLM products) This includes It Works Wraps, extensions, Mary Kay, etc. This group is specifically for Salon Professionals who are making a living selling products specifically geared toward the salon.  We also want to support our own industry.
*Make sure when you submit your request to join us, that your profession in our industry is CLEARLY listed on your FB Page, otherwise you may be ignored.
Please be advised: our administrators reserve the right delete inappropriate posts and/or block anyone who is not abiding by the rules stated above or for any other purpose not listed here.
That's that, simple enough we're all here for the same reason...to share knowledge and most of all -to HAVE FUN :) We're here to celebrate our love and pride for this industry and to not compete with one another but UNITE as stylist’s.Arizona Salon Professionals TeamChristian JamesPhilip RingAlfonzo Chavez
description.html:
Welcome to Arizona Salon Professionals. This group was founded by Christian James in order to create an atmosphere to share Education, Ideas, Industry News, Post Pictures and Salon Job Opportunities! This group was created by Stylists FOR Stylists. The Arizona Salon Professionals Page is a POSITIVE, Respectful, Friendly, Uplifting, Passionate, Knowledgeable, REAL group of professionals and cosmetology students...here for one reason- our immense love and passion for the beauty industry!

The rules are Clear and Simple:  Please read and abide by all of them in order to ensure a positive, orderly group environment.

*You must be a licensed cosmetologist/barber or enrolled cosmetology student/barber.

*Critique to provide positive feedback...for the purposes of learning and growth. THINK before you post..."Will my comment hurt or offend another member?" If so, you might want to keep it to yourself or find a way to communicate your point in a positive, constructive manner.

*When referring to manufacturers and products, you are more than welcome to talk about how great your products are, or the products you use.  Please refrain, however, from making negative and/or defamatory comments about other products lines.  If you're product is great, there is no reason to distract from it by mentioning another line.


*In order to mitigate any chance of legal action, we no longer allow posts regarding disorders of the skin and scalp. The main purpose is to eliminate risk to clients and members by misdiagnosis or improper treatment. For your safety and that of others please refer to physician.

*Please do not post screenshots that show client names or other stylist's names, profile pictures, or identifying marks. Please protect everyone’s privacies.

*Arizona Salon Professionals exercise ZERO tolerance for hurtful, rude, condescending, malicious or offensive behavior. Topics such as race, religion, sexuality and politics are not suitable for group discussion.

*Plagiarism is STRICTLY PROHIBITED! If you would like to use an image another member has posted...please ask permission and credit the artist. It is HIGHLY recommended that you watermark all of your images.

*This isn't the place for ranting, venting or bad mouthing. This is not the place.

*No spamming/selling non-professional products (typically MLM products) This includes It Works Wraps, extensions, Mary Kay, etc. This group is specifically for Salon Professionals who are making a living selling products specifically geared toward the salon.  We also want to support our own industry.


*Make sure when you submit your request to join us, that your profession in our industry is CLEARLY listed on your FB Page, otherwise you may be ignored.

Please be advised: our administrators reserve the right delete inappropriate posts and/or block anyone who is not abiding by the rules stated above or for any other purpose not listed here.


That's that, simple enough we're all here for the same reason...to share knowledge and most of all -to HAVE FUN :) We're here to celebrate our love and pride for this industry and to not compete with one another but UNITE as stylist’s.

Arizona Salon Professionals Team
Christian James
Philip Ring
Alfonzo Chavez

As part of our ongoing Client Appreciation Program we are taking Clients, Past, Current and Future, for a ride ont he rails.  This is a unique experience.  Located not far off of I17 on Pinnacle Peak Road is a private members train park.  We are lucky enough to know a 6 year old boy named Brandon that has agreed to take our Clients for a private ride.  There is no cost to this event, but being that this is a private club ran completely by donation we would encourage you to bring a few dollars to toss in the hat.  If you have a 4 year old Son that is into triains this may be mandatory, but it is really pretty fun for everyone.  Space is limited, so grab your tickets right away.  
Here is a link to the Club's Website for more details.

Locations:  22603 North 43rd Avenue Glendale, AZ  85310

description.text:
What does it mean to have a Strengths-based business? How can using your natural talents & abilities help you increase  your profits? Learn why it is more empowering to focus on what you do best rather than fixing weaknesses. Learn the 3 Steps to Maximize Your Potential. Learn how to  leverage your Strengths to overcome specific business challenges  by learning how to  use what you are already do best.  
Come to this session with your Top 5 strengths in order to benefit most from this session. If you have your Top 5 already, great, bring your reports. Can find your old report? You can access it by going to gallupsstrengthscenter.com and entering the email address you used to take the assessment the first time. There is no need to take the assessment more than once. 
If you don't know your strengths yet, then follow the link below to visit gallupstrengthscenter, complete the assessment. This is a web-based assessment of 177 questions. It takes 40 mins to complete, you should answer each question within 20 seconds, so no need to think long to analyze, respond with your first thought.  You will rank the responses on a scale of 1-5 (strongly agree, agree, neutral, disagree or strongly disagree) Each items consists of pairs of potential self descriptors such as “I read instructions carefully” or “I rush right into things.”.  
Themes are made up of many talents and talents once developed become strengths.  Once you complete the assessment,  you will receive 4 detailed reports. 







          - Theme Sequence Report - view all 34  themes in order  - includes videos of each theme in action (if you purchase full 34)




            - Signature Themes Report - Top 5 strengths full descriptions 




            - Strengths Insight Report - personalized  Top 5 strengths with insights for your development - portrays insights personalized to you based on the order of the talents in the report.




            - Strengths Insight & Action Planning Guide - Top 5 - learn ways to use your strengths & discover how to create a strengths based action plan (includes tips on how to develop all the themes)







Your Top 5 will tell you your most dominant themes - sufficient for this workshop 
If you already have your Top 5 and have decided it would be helpful to know your remaining 29, you can select that option by using the same email you used to take the Top 5. 
Your full 34 themes will give you your dominant themes, supporting themes and lesser themes. It is a complete picture of your talents. This can be very helpful in increasing your awareness and creating a  plan of action to move forward. 
                                www.gallupstrengthscenter.com/purchase/en-US/Product 
Top 5 - $9.99 
Full 34 - $89.99 
Additional 29 (if you already have your Top 5) - $79.99 
Please let me know what questions you have. 
See you there. 
Maria 
p.s. you will have the option to send your results to anyone you choose after completing, please send me a copy of your results to mtb@mtbsolutions.us

description.text:
Phone: 480-965-9376
Email: psychology@asu.edu,
 Attn: Cindy Theisman (cindy.theisman@asu.edu) 
The Department of Psychology on the Tempe campus is among the largest and most popular departments at ASU. Our mission is to create an environment that prepares our students to take their place in the world using the skills they have learned to pursue careers that benefit their community. Interactions among faculty and students across the department are central to a variety of ongoing research and educational programs. These interactions allow our faculty to grow their expertise in both teaching and scholarship. Faculty and students are also actively involved with a number of other centers, institutes, and research groups on campus that promote transdisciplinary approaches to issues of local and national significance, affording outstanding research and training experiences that extend beyond traditional disciplinary boundaries.

description.text:
All of your favorite AWF stars will be in action for this historic night in Arizona wrestling! The first ever AWF Tag Team Champions will be crowned at Gold Rush, Saturday March 28th at the AWF Academy Arena in Glendale! 
 
Get your tickets and come be a part of AWF history, as the first ever AWF Tag Team Champions are crowned at Gold Rush! 
Last year, the AWF introduced its AWF Championship with the first ever Gold Rush tournament. This year, they will hold the Gold Rush tournament to crown its first ever Tag Team Champions!  
Also featuring: AWF Champion Danny Gee; Alexander Hammerstone; Kahmora; Chris Evans; Awesome Andy; Aydan Colt; Gabriel Gallo & Dom Vitalli - the Keepers of the Faith; Alex Sinister; Adrian Hawkins; Jay Garland; Clutch; Los FoxStars; Hawaiian Lion; Joe Graves; Deans of Chaos; and more! 
(Card subject to change.) 
 ***Video cameras and still photography ARE allowed and encouraged!*** 
 Purchase multiple tickets at once and save! (See package pricing below) 
AWF Academy Arena 5658 N 51st Ave Glendale, AZ 85301 (SW corner of 51st Avenue and Montebello Avenue) 
Doors: 5:30 pm - Bell Time: 6:00 pm - ALL AGES!

***COLORS: Maroon colored shirts are now available in limited sizes!*** 
SPACE AND SUPPLIES ARE LIMITED! MAKE SURE TO GET YOUR TICKETS TODAY!

description.text: Camp HERO is an intensive twenty hour training designed to teach the principles and skills of community organizing to lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender activists and their allies. Drawing on techniques honed for decades by progressive social movements, Camp HERO teaches empowerment, team building, leadership development, and grassroots organizing skills.  Camp HERO will gather some of our movement's best thinkers and organizers to conduct an intensive grassroots organizing curriculum. Workshop topics will include "Developing Strategies and Building Coalitions," "The Nuts and Bolts of Organizing," "Finding Your Voice: Telling Your Story", and more. The training will also include concrete skill-building sessions tailored to the specific needs and interests of participants.   Participant Comments  “This has been an AMAZING experience; I cannot express how thankful I am for having had the opportunity to be a part of Camp HERO. Very well organized and a very open environment. Thank you!”  “Because of this wonderful camp I no longer feel alone. I now feel accepted and worthy. CAMP HERO is a camp to teach you to be a leader, but it taught me that I am loved accepted and to be proud.”   “I feel more empowered and better informed. I met some great people with great ideas. I’ve been presented with opportunities that will allow me to utilize my skills and abilities for worthwhile causes!”   “I feel very inspired by the people I’ve met here, the stories I’ve heard and the tools I’ve learned. I feel really optimistic and excited about my path to activism, and I’m anxious to see where it takes me.”  “Camp HERO has been an amazing experience. I’ve had the opportunity to process ideas and thoughts I originally never gave much time to.”
description.html:
Camp HERO is an intensive twenty hour training designed to teach the principles and skills of community organizing to lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender activists and their allies. Drawing on techniques honed for decades by progressive social movements, Camp HERO teaches empowerment, team building, leadership development, and grassroots organizing skills.

Camp HERO will gather some of our movement's best thinkers and organizers to conduct an intensive grassroots organizing curriculum. Workshop topics will include "Developing Strategies and Building Coalitions," "The Nuts and Bolts of Organizing," "Finding Your Voice: Telling Your Story", and more. The training will also include concrete skill-building sessions tailored to the specific needs and interests of participants.


Participant Comments

“This has been an AMAZING experience; I cannot express how thankful I am for having had the opportunity to be a part of Camp HERO. Very well organized and a very open environment. Thank you!”

“Because of this wonderful camp I no longer feel alone. I now feel accepted and worthy. CAMP HERO is a camp to teach you to be a leader, but it taught me that I am loved accepted and to be proud.” 

“I feel more empowered and better informed. I met some great people with great ideas. I’ve been presented with opportunities that will allow me to utilize my skills and abilities for worthwhile causes!” 

“I feel very inspired by the people I’ve met here, the stories I’ve heard and the tools I’ve learned. I feel really optimistic and excited about my path to activism, and I’m anxious to see where it takes me.”

“Camp HERO has been an amazing experience. I’ve had the opportunity to process ideas and thoughts I originally never gave much time to.”

description.text:
Special guest - Team Training with the legendary Tom "Big Al" Schreiter! 
 
  
If you’ve never met Tom Schreiter, you are in for a treat. As he writes in his own bio on the back of his books, he is a “tall, dark, handsome Texan”.  Well, maybe this is a bit of an oversell, but it is no exaggeration that Tom is one of the best network marketing trainers ever.  He relies heavily on humor to convey his message, both on stage and in his books, and at times he is truly hilarious.  He grew his network marketing business to 100,000 people in two years utilizing simple, yet effective phrases that he will teach our teams. 
Be an inspiration for positive change in your life and people around you...join us at our monthly SOC Business Showcase & Team Training.  Find out how Send Out Cards is revolutionizing the greeting card and gifting industry, much like Netflix did for movies, Amazon did for books and iTunes did for music. 
If you're looking for a way to have time and financial freedom, Send Out Cards may be the answer you're looking for! 
  
Agenda: 
12:30pm-1:00pm - Check In 
1:00pm-1:45pm - Business Showcase (Presented by Paul Newell) 
1:45pm-2:00pm - Break 
2:00pm-4:00pm - Team Training: (With special guest: Tom "Big Al" Schreiter)  
This will be an ideal event to invite guests you know who own their own business or want to grow their client base and increase sales!!! 
  
 
  
**Hosted by our AZ Leaders: 
Kristi Lee 
Paul Newell 
Jim Pitman 
Mary Hannon 
Judy O'Higgins 
Geri & Mark Whaley 
Karen Kanefsky 
  
Questions?  Please contact: Kristi Lee 623-910-4630 
KristiLeeIntl@gmail.com

description.text:
Chaparral Christian Church is pleased to offer a self-guided labyrinth experience during Holy Week. The labyrinth is not a maze, but a prayer and meditation tool. Walking the labyrinth does not demand great skills of concentration in order to benefit from the experience. Instead, the sheer act of walking a intricate path begins to focus the mind. The labyrinth experience sensitizes us, educates us and creates a space for us to reflect. During Holy Week, the self-guided labyrinth experience will focus on the Seven Sayings of Jesus from the Cross.  
  
The Chaparral Labyrinth’s © unique design contains five internal and two external stations.  The final form of the labyrinth, built by Creative Environments, is comprised of 9,585 pavers creating a path of 1,187 feet. 
  
For more details on the Chaparral Labyrinth, please visit chaparrallabyrinth.org.

description.text:
Physiques Gym presents TRUTH & FACTS 
Don't miss this amazing opportunity to hear Craig Tinnelle, the TINN-MANN, talk straight about nutrition and the role food plays in your overall health and well-being! The event will be held at the Rustic Cafe located at 20811 North Cave Creek Road in Phoenix.  Those who attend will also be able to meet in person the training staff of Physiques Gym.  Come and learn more about our facility, membership options and the new upcoming renovations. 
Ticket price includes your food during the event as well as your admission!  We'll see you on March 28th at 1pm! 
FAQs 
Can I buy my tickets at the gym?  
Yes. You can pick your pickets up at the gym. The cash price is $25.00. 
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Phone: 602-953-1111 Email: info@physiquesgym.net  www.physiquesgym.net  
Is my registration/ticket transferrable? 
One person is admitted per ticket, however if you are unable to make it, your ticket is transferrable!

description.text: Echelon is a community of diverse young adults, ages 21 to 35, collectively rising up to serve The Salvation Army through fellowship,  fundraising, service, and volunteering. Echelon was founded in 2010 in Dallas, Texas and has since been branded as the National Young Adult Auxiliary of The Salvation Army. SalvationArmyEchelon.org

description.text:
Come join ECHELON and STAND UP LIVE on March 27 @ 7:30 to enjoy the talent of comedian hypnotist Flip Orley. This incredible show continues to amaze the most skeptical audience members. Flip's show draws anxious fans to clubs across the country where they storm the stages, hoping to be among the lucky volunteers to grab a seat and become the stars of the show. Orley is adamant about not embarassing his volunteers. He prefers his audiences to laugh with the volunteers, not at them.  
Better yet, your money is going to a great cause, Echelon keeps 100% of the proceeds to donate toward different causes of the Salvation Army.
