description.text:
(Peter) Moshe Loth is a holocaust survivor who was born in Stutthof Concentration Camp to his imprisoned Jewish Mother. Having lived through great tribulation, pain, and brokenness, Mr. Loth is able to communicate an outlook on life that is inspiring and life-changing. Regardless of religion, race, or creed; whether one is rich or poor, educated or not, his story has the ability to break even the hardest of hearts. 
For other CAC Events, visit the CAC Calendar. 
For On-Campus directions Click Here!!!! 
Make CAC your destination for the evening! Enjoy dinner in our Dining Hall’s All-You-Can-Eat Buffet. Show your ticket for a 20% discount. Dining Hall hours are M-Th from 4:45 p.m.to 7:00 p.m., and F, S from 4:45 p.m. to 6:15 p.m. Discount valid for same day as your Show Ticket.

description.text: Prolifics Dance Company is a project-based company working out of Phoenix, Arizona under the direction of Christopher Biles, founder and Artistic Director. The company produces shows that use the art of dance in order to express and create Art. Christopher's vision for the company is to create performances containing a mixture of both art and popular culture, for the artistic mind and the mind for those who enjoy art. Performances are meant for the audience to connect to something, on some level. Prolifics's performances contain a variety of dance styles and also vast music selection.

description.text:
Do you have what it takes to be the next great public speaker? 
Build a three-person team from your high school, find a coach (18 years or older) and participate in the speaking competition on March 27 and 28 at the ASU West Campus!  
No speaking experience? No problem! We encourage participants from all backgrounds. On Friday, March 27 from 1:00 - 3:00 p.m. our certified peer mentors will coach you in our nationally recognized Communication Assessment and Learning Lab.  At 3:30 p.m., the the fast-paced competition begins!  The competition is one part "Chopped," one part "American Idol"...all fun. 
The top four teams return Saturday morning for the final round of the competition. The winning team will receive a $100 prize per person and the Golden Sparky traveling High School trophy. Sign-up today! 
  
*Please note change in time. Contest will take place: 
Friday March 27- 1:00 pm  to 6:00 pm 
Saturday March 28 - 10:00 am to 12:30 pm

description.text:
CGI Spring Speaker Series: March 2015 Brown Bag 
Joel Cutcher-Gershenfeld is a professor and former dean in the School of Labor and Employment Relations (LER) at the University of Illinois. His talk will present current research examining the science enterprise through the lens of stakeholder alignment, with a focus on agile institutions. Societies around the world are looking to the science enterprise to deliver results on “grand challenges” ranging from global climate change to severe weather prediction to secure cyberinfrastructure to personalized medicine to the inner workings of the human brain to sustainable energy. Examples of stakeholder alignment in complex systems will include: communication and coordination to better address aircraft noise and emissions, precompetitive markets for biomedicine, and interdisciplinary engagement in the cyberinfrastructure for the geosciences.  Each example features open and collaborative dynamics that are emblematic of what can be a new social contract between science and society.

description.text:
ANA Workshop #16 
LOOK WHO’S TALKING: HOW TO BE A SPOKESPERSON 
DATE: Wednesday, March 25, 2015  
TIME: Check In   9:00am |   Workshop   9:30am – 11:30am 
LOCATION: National Bank of Arizona Conference Center  
6001 N 24th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85016  
COST: $39 per person 
  
For the good and the bad, there needs to be someone at your organization who can be a spokesperson. In front of the media, at a large social gathering or perhaps at a fundraiser, your spokesperson becomes a force for direct impact. But how does it work? Who gets up in front of the cameras and who is the persons talking. Get ready for your close-up and learn the tricks of the trade. Understand what words are best to use, how to deal with negativity and navigate through a challenging media interview.   This workshop covers dressing for the camera, how to prepare and the processes that the best spokespeople use to tell their story.

description.text:
Trocadéro Wine School
A trained and certified expert to guide you
Trocadéro Wine School aspires to be the center for wine and spirits education in Arizona supporting the needs of consumers, restaurateurs and wine trade professionals.
Bill Dunphy is the director of Trocadéro Wine School. He holds the Level 3 Advanced Certification with Merit from London's Wine and Spirits Educational Trust (WSET®) and is a Diploma candidate, their highest certification. He's a Certified Wine Specialist from the Society of Wine Educators, member of the French Wine Society, Arizona Restaurant Association (ARA) and Arizona Wine Growers Association (AWGA).

description.text:
Feel more confident when choosing wine. 
The wonderful world of wine can be complex, even overwhelming, but after completing this class, you will feel much more knowledgeable and comfortable with this fascinating subject. So whether you're an absolute beginner or already into wine, this class will reveal something you didn't already know or will clarify things you weren't sure about.  
Through presentation, interactive discussions and a guided tasting, you will learn more about how grapes are grown and wine is produced, proper wine service, how to read wine labels, storing wine and fundamental wine styles. 
Includes wine-tasting session featuring eight classic wines. 
You'll have the opportunity to practice and improve your tasting skill and help you understand why you like certain wines. And you'll learn what to look for and have more confidence when buying wine in retail stores and restaurants. Naturally, delicious bread, cheese and fruit plates from Vincent will be served. 
Perfect for a "date night" or a group of friends to enjoy together.  
Join us for two and a half hours and have fun exploring and learning about wine. 
  
FAQs 
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to attend?  
Yes, you must be 21. Please bring an approved ID with you for check-in. 
What can/can't I bring to the event?   
Please do not wear perfume, colognes, or other fragrance, as it will detract from your and other participant's ability to smell the wines. Also, no pets are allowed. 
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
e-mail bill@trocaderowine.com with other questions 
Is my registration/ticket transferrable? 
If unable to attend the class, on approval, you may transfer your ticket to a friend, minimum age 21 for the same class. Please e-mail bill@trocaderowine.com to request a transfer and provide name and contact details for new attendee. 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
Yes, bring your printed eventbrite ticket with you. 
What is the cancellation/refund policy? 
Cancellations are accepted up to 24 hours before an event. There are no refunds for cancellations within 24 hours of an event or if you do not attend.

Learn how to reduce operational costs while improving your facilities! 
This workshop will help businesses, property owners, facility managers and contractors take advantage of the energy efficiency rebates offered by TEP and Tucson Water.  
Hear from a panel of entities, from businesses to property managers, that have already realized the benefits of becoming more energy efficient. 
Both TEP and Tucson Water will be onsite to assist interested parties to start the process. 
Mayor Rothschild and TEP's Timothy Davis will offer remarks. 
John "Skip" Laitner, resource economist, will provide the keynote address. 
The event will include a light breakfast.

description.text:
Mark Kirstein is the CEO and owner of Sandler Training Phoenix Scottsdale.  Mark possesses a unique combination of corporate and entrepreneurial experience, across sales and management roles. For the nearly 20 years, he has led consulting and analyst organizations that advise and help clients optimize market development. 

After initiating his career in engineering, Mark shifted to a business focus as a market analyst advising global technology and media companies.  Mark moved up quickly to become General Manager of In-Stat, a Scottsdale-based market research firm and a division of multinational publisher, Reed Elsevier.  In this role, he led a global team of sales, marketing and research professionals.  Subsequently he was founder and CEO of three research companies, with hands-on sales responsibilities.  After selling his research company to The NPD Group, Mark led a business unit for one of the largest research firms in the US until he separated to start his Sandler Training business. 
Mark holds a degree in Electrical Engineering from California Polytechnic University, and an MBA from Arizona State University.

description.text:
More info at www.hackster.io/hardwareweekend 
  
  
The 2015 Hackster Hardware Weekend Roadshow is coming. 
The Hackster Hardware Weekend is a celebration of makers, open source hardware and the Hackster community across America. From Seattle to NYC and everything in between, we are hitting the road driving an original DeLorean DMC 12 to run the coolest Hackathon & Meetup series of the year, with loads of hardware kits, amazing speakers, software freebies and great people. 
Best yet, you also get to hack our Time Machine. Update our DeLorean with the latest sensors, electronics, radios and data service. Make Doc Emmet Brown proud and hack to the future! 
  
We bring our 2-day hackathon to Phoenix on March 28th and 29th. We'll provide food, tools, soldering stations, and hardware kits from Intel and other companies for your team to hack with. You're also encouraged to bring any hardware you might need. Each event will kick off with workshops where you'll get to know each other and the hardware. Then you can hack your way to glory!  
All ages and skill levels are welcome. Children under 16 should be accompanied by an adult.  
  
  
Roadshow Partners 
  
 
  
Phoenix Partners 
 
  
Phoenix Hardware 
Check out the hardware on the website here: www.hackster.io/hackathons/hardware-weekend/phoenix/pages/hardware-kits 
 Phoenix Mentors and speakers 
 Check back soon! 
  
 Phoenix Prizes 
$1000: Best use of Microsoft Azure 
Wunderbar by Relayer 
Udoo Board by Udoo 
Metawear boards by Mbient Labs 
$150 Amazon gift cards for best Edison hack 
  
Schedule 
See Phoenix hackathon page on Hackster.io.

description.text:
CXO Collective is global entrepreneurial organization that leverages the collective human and financial capital to grow, buy, build and sell companies for fun AND profit.  
CXO Collective holds meetings in major cities across the U.S. and in other countries to introduce business owners, consultants and investors to our unique platform. The meetings allow prospective members/partners to get access to our group and its dealflow (for investment or consulting or referrals).
description.html:
CXO Collective is global entrepreneurial organization that leverages the collective human and financial capital to grow, buy, build and sell companies for fun AND profit. 

CXO Collective holds meetings in major cities across the U.S. and in other countries to introduce business owners, consultants and investors to our unique platform. The meetings allow prospective members/partners to get access to our group and its dealflow (for investment or consulting or referrals).

description.text:
Calling all Entrepreneurs,Investors, and Consultants and anyone else with an interest in entrepreneurship.  We are a group of like-minded business owners, entrepreneurs, and other champions that are looking to grow their businesses and learn how to gain the competitive edge in their markets.  
  
 Please pass this along to your friends and colleagues, please ask them to join separately. 
  
 We invite you to learn more about local Business Masterminds, entrepreneurs, investors and service providers, by joining us at our next networking event. 
 Guests are always welcome and RSVP'ing is highly encouraged. 
You Can Get Involved With Us... 
If you are interested in learning how you can get involved with us and start receiving benefits from the collective groups we are building all over the US, simply reserve your seat above right now to attend this private event. 

 Watch this video to learn more... 

 
Join us as we network, mix, mingle and get to know: 
  
1. Talent looking for paid opportunities to help Businesses grow 
  
2. Businesses looking for Talent to help them grow 
  
3. Investors looking to deploy capital in companies that have secured the bench talent to execute their business plans. 
  
This meeting will focus on CXO and how you can get involved and begin receiving benefits for your contribution to the collective group. 
  
FAQs: 
Who is Invited? 
C-Level,  Entrepreneurs, Investors and Consultants to Entreprenuers 
  
What is CXO Collective? 
 We are a firm dedicated to connecting C-Level Operational support to growing businesses. Support includes the resources of:  talent, capital and exits.  
  
Why is CXO holding this event? 
This event is to connect leaders. Some attendees will be perfect talent to profit from our various portfolio opportunities as consultants while others may represent potential capital for deals.  Still others may be looking for assitance to execute an exit strategy.  
  
Are there other CXO Events? 
CXO conducts monthly meetings in various cities throughout the U.S. 
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
Click above to contact organizer.

As recently seen on the Real Housewives of Beverly Hills, the Steve Harvey Show and Under Cover Boss; featured in the Wall Street Journal and the New York Times, this hyper growth company is enabling a new kind of success for busy women with a professional, flexible, profitable social-selling business. description.text:
OVERVIEW 
Mental Health First Aid is a public education program that introduces participants to risk factors and warning signs of mental illnesses, builds understanding of their impact, and overviews common supports. This 8-hour course uses role-playing and simulations to demonstrate how to offer initial help in a mental health crisis and connect persons to the appropriate professional, peer, social, and self-help care. The program also teaches the common risk factors and warning signs of specific types of illnesses, like anxiety, depression, substance use, bipolar disorder, eating disorders, and schizophrenia. 
  
Mental Health First Aid is included on the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration’s National Registry of Evidence-based Programs and Practices (NREPP). 
  
COURSE DETAILS 
Mental Health First Aid teaches participants a five-step action plan, ALGEE, to support someone developing signs and symptoms of a mental illness or in an emotional crisis: 

Assess for risk of suicide or harm
Listen nonjudgmentally
Give reassurance and information
Encourage appropriate professional help
Encourage self-help and other support strategies

  
Like CPR, Mental Health First Aid prepares participants to interact with a person in crisis and connect the person with help. First Aiders do not take on the role of professionals — they do not diagnose or provide any counseling or therapy. Instead, the program offers concrete tools and answers key questions, like “what do I do?” and “where can someone find help?” Certified Mental Health First Aid instructors provide a list of community healthcare providers and national resources, support groups, and online tools for mental health and addictions treatment and support. All trainees receive a program manual to compliment the course material. 
  
Register today! 
  
Side note: Lunch will be on your own for this training. You can either bring your own lunch or go out for lunch, you will be given an hour for lunch. 
  
This course is brought to you by Cenpatico of Arizona and the Gila County Division of Community Services.

description.text:
SCHOOL TOURS FOR THE 2014-15 SCHOOL YEAR 
Thank you for visiting our website.  We are pleased to offer tours for those interested in joining the Glendale Preparatory Academy community.  Tours will be led by our Headmaster, Mr. Crowe and will last approximately 30 minutes (including Q & A). 
These tours are designed to answer any and all questions regarding Glendale Preparatory Academy and will include an opportunity to view classrooms (while in instruction), learn more about our curriculum and will end with a question and answer session.   
The tours are designed for adults.  Please make arrangements for your young children.  Thank you. 
  
IF NO DATES APPEAR IN THE DROP DOWN MENU, THAT MEANS ALL TOURS ARE FULL.  PLEASE CHECK BACK PERIODICALLY FOR NEWLY POSTED TOURS.  PLEASE NOTE THAT IF NO TOURS ARE AVAILABLE PRIOR TO OPEN ENROLLMENT, YOU MAY APPLY FIRST AND THEN ATTEND A TOUR AFTER ENROLLING.

description.text:
E-filing with AZTurboCourt 
 The AZTurboCourt e-filing application is available for use in Pima County for Civil initiating (complaint) and subsequent filings. This is an ONLINE training and provides an overview presentation and demonstration for users who have already registered in AZTurboCourt and those new to AZTurboCourt. The first 30 minutes of the training will cover registration and payments.  Even though you may have filed in Maricopa County Superior Court using AZTurboCourt, it is highly recommended that you attend training as this version of the software has differences unique to Pima County Superior Court.  Learn How To: 

File a new Civil case and retrieve your issued Summonses
Correctly attach documents for Pima County filings 
Attach multiple document in one submission
Efficiently set-up & utilize AZTurboCourt in your office
E-file and pay filing and user fees on-line 
Reduce data entry for multiple filings

  
 To attend, please follow these steps:  
Step 1:  OBTAIN WEBEX/CONFERENCE CALL INFORMATION  

Read the “WEBEX INFORMATION” section below to find out more about Cisco WebEx, system requirements, and additional information.  
Make note of the information in the “CONFERENCE CALL NUMBER” and “WEBEX LINKS” sections below for your training date. This information is required to attend your chosen session.  

Step 2:  ATTEND YOUR SELECTED SESSION 
 On the date/time of your session:  

Click on the WebEx link of your training date.  
Follow the instructions for using the WebEx applications on the screen.  
Dial the conference line and enter the meeting ID number.

  
WEBEX INFORMATION 
The Cisco WebEx Meeting Center application will guide you through the process of running the WebEx application up to 15 minutes before your scheduled session. 
For more predictable results, we recommend that you use Internet Explorer 10 or above to access the application, but the latest version of the FireFox and Chrome browser can be used if necessary. The application may request a Java update, however the WebEx application should guide you through this process. 
Though it is not required, we recommend you use the following link to set up the WebEx Meeting Center in advance of your designated session:  WebEx Meeting Center Set Up.   
If you have any questions, please contact the Arizona Supreme Court IT Support Services at (602) 452-3900.  
  
CONFERENCE CALL NUMBER All sessions have the same dial-in telephone number and meeting ID. Dial in: 602-452-3288   **or**   520-388-4330 Meeting ID: 6000

description.text: The ASU Sun Devil Family Association (SDFA) represents a nationwide parent network of members and volunteers dedicated to sustaining parental involvement in their students' education and supporting programs and services that will enrich the ASU experience.
description.html: The ASU Sun Devil Family Association (SDFA) represents a nationwide parent network of members and volunteers dedicated to sustaining parental involvement in their students' education and supporting programs and services that will enrich the ASU experience.

description.text:
SDFA to Celebrate 30th Anniversary in Flagstaff, AZ 
Enjoy an evening of great food and conversation with other Northern AZ Sun Devil families, friends and fans. While the SDFA is hosting their 30th anniversary event in Tempe, we will be concurrently sharing in the celebration right here in Flagstaff. Help us commemorate an organization that reaches far and wide to keep Sun Devil families connected and informed.  
  
Tickets to the Flagstaff event will not be sold. Instead, you will pay individually for your own meal and drink. However, we ask that you make a donation to the Sun Devil Family Association Fund, which provides undergraduate students who are experiencing hardship with scholarships and supports all ASU students with free tutoring. Suggested donation amounts:  $50/individual, $100/couple, $150/family and gifts can be made at the event on March 31st with your credit card or with a check made out to ASU Foundation. Receipts for your generous donations will be mailed to you within 14 business days. All participants will receive an ASU Sun Devil Family Association 30th anniversary commemorative pin. 
  
Let’s get together as one big Sun Devil Family and show our maroon and gold pride in the wonderful city of Flagstaff! We want our SDFA region to challenge other regions and states to beat our attendance number! 
Please be sure to use the REGISTER button on this site to RSVP no later than Tuesday, March 24, 2015 to ensure a spot at a table. Seating is limited. For questions please contact  SDFA Regional Council member Chris Kalinich at cmkalinich@gmail.com .

description.text:
SpoFit Recreation Day 
Saturday, March 28, 2015 
10:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m. 
Disability Empowerment Center Campus  
What/Why: In celebration of the 25th Anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), the Sports & Fitness Center (Spofit) a program of Arizona Bridge to Independent Living (ABIL) is opening its doors for a Free DAY to participate and enjoy the facilities. 
During the day your Banner Wheelchair Suns basketball team will be participating, however, more importantly you will have the opportunity to participate no strings attached therefore even those without disabilities are encouraged to participate to test their skills sitting down. In addition, there will be a power soccer demonstration, tours, as well as the opportunity use the fitness center, participate in yoga classes and swim in a pool that is accessible! 
For a complete schedule of activities please see schedule below. 
This event will showcase the intervention, creativity and ingenuity involved in becoming a site accessible for all levels of ability. 
What is SpoFit: SpoFit’s mission is to provide exceptional adaptive sports, recreation, aquatic and fitness programs that promote the independence, health and overall wellbeing of people with disabilities and their family members. 
When: Saturday, March 28, 2015 
Where: 
Disability Empowerment Center Campus (SpoFit) 
5025 East Washington St. 
Phoenix, AZ 85034 
Time: 10 AM - 2 PM 
Cost: FREE of charge for everyone including nonmembers! 
To RSVP: Go to http://spofit.eventbrite.com and/or contact David Carey at 602-443-0723 
Registration Deadline: Thursday, March 26, 2015 
  
Agenda Schedule: 
  
Pools and will be open to attendee’s for the entire event 
  
10 AM - 11 AM - Participate in Spin Program in the Atrium 
  
10 AM - 11 AM - 2nd Floor Fitness Center tours 
  
10:30 AM - 11 AM - Wheelchair Basketball Demo 
  
11 AM - 11:30 AM - Open wheelchair basketball – Attendees encourage to participate!  
  
11:30 AM - 12 PM - Yoga or some fitness class 
  
12 PM - 12:30 PM - Power Soccer Demo 
Questions: Contact David Carey at 602-443-0723  



Accommodations: No fragrances please. To accommodate those with allergies, breathing conditions or multiple chemical sensitivities please do not smoke or wear scented products when attending ABIL events.   ABIL's events are accessible in compliance with ADA guidelines.  For accommodations and/or to participate via teleconference please complete registration.  For assistance please contact Anay Bickham at 602-443-0738. 
Sponsored by:

description.text: CO+HOOTS is the only shared downtown Phoenix office location that promotes collaboration and provides a professional, inspirational and self-sustaining space to grow and nurture entrepreneurialism. Creatives, entrepreneurs and small business of all areas flock here to become a part of the growing vibrancy of downtown Phoenix. As a community of local-minded and business-focused people, we are able to collaborate on projects, share resources and generate more success to support our livelihoods. CO+HOOTS is designed to help your business thrive.

description.text: This Midweek Mindtweak is about:  Local company O'Niel Printing's clients' marketing and communication needs continue to evolve, and so have its conversations to bring value to the relationship. O'Neil Printing have moved from what was the Traditional approach, asking clients what they have to print, to now facilitating a strategic conversation presenting relevant products, services, and partnerships that help its clients accomplish their marketing and business goals.  Don't forget to grab lunch at the day's food truck at CO+HOOTS -- Taco Toppers -- BEFORE heading into the talk!   About Speaker:Tony has a combined work experience of 35 years in publishing, print manufacturing and client services. He has overall responsibility for the vision of O’Neil Printing and directs the Sales and Marketing of the company. As a member of O’Neil’s senior management, Tony is available to facilitate the needs of clients.“What I love most about O’Neil is our people and how they adapt to change, support each other and make a difference in our client relationships,” Tony says. His passion for charitable works has taken him to Africa three times, where his son, Justin, adopted his grandson, Trevor.
description.html:
This Midweek Mindtweak is about:

Local company O'Niel Printing's clients' marketing and communication needs continue to evolve, and so have its conversations to bring value to the relationship. O'Neil Printing have moved from what was the Traditional approach, asking clients what they have to print, to now facilitating a strategic conversation presenting relevant products, services, and partnerships that help its clients accomplish their marketing and business goals.

Don't forget to grab lunch at the day's food truck at CO+HOOTS -- Taco Toppers -- BEFORE heading into the talk! 

About Speaker:Tony has a combined work experience of 35 years in publishing, print manufacturing and client services. He has overall responsibility for the vision of O’Neil Printing and directs the Sales and Marketing of the company. As a member of O’Neil’s senior management, Tony is available to facilitate the needs of clients.“What I love most about O’Neil is our people and how they adapt to change, support each other and make a difference in our client relationships,” Tony says. His passion for charitable works has taken him to Africa three times, where his son, Justin, adopted his grandson, Trevor.

organizer.name: Javoski Griffith - Band of Real Estate Investors

description.text:
Want to work smarter for yourself? 
Want to be financially free?  
Today I would like to invite you to our 2-hr real estate investing orientation where you will meet with our local real estate investment team and learn more about what we do as real estate investors & business ownership. Bring something to take notes with and come sit back and listen to why real estate investing is meant for everyone. Whether you like real estate or not, you might not realize yet that you already are an investor. You most likely pay for where you live now and you invest in someone's dreams! We all either pay a rent/mortgage or we get paid rent/mortgage. 
Would you rather pay someone for where you live, or would you like to get paid? 
How would you like to get FREE education, maybe a FREE car every couple years? 
We will show you how SMART investors are doing exactly that. 
At our 2-hr real estate investing orientation, we intend to show why that possibility has slipped past the 99% and what we are doing with real estate TODAY! We will 
• show you the ONLY curriculum based, ongoing, and scalable education platform in the industry. 
• show you a plan that has assisted students, in our community, to a net worth over a million dollars in controlled assets. 
• show you how you can be involved in the properties that we are involved in. 
• show you to a working business model that you could have walk down the hall to your home office instead of fighting traffic. 
• show you the ways to make money, and how to be wealthy with a variety of strategies. 
• show you how you could be done interviewing for jobs for the rest of your life and comprehensively teach your children how to BE the same! 
WE ARE LOOKING FOR PEOPLE WHO WANT TO MAKE MONEY:   
In Real Estate Investing: We are looking for those who want to learn how to be an investor and those who want to build wealth through investments in Real Estate. Not only do we invest locally, but we also invest nationwide. Our investment associates earn anywhere from $5000-$100,000 per real estate transaction depending on the type of real estate transaction. A real estate license or experience is not necessary, but if you have either, great. Either way, we are here to show you how to be a real estate investor, where to invest, and our ways to make money. We work with everybody in our real estate investor training programs and here to help you build your own real estate investment portfolio. and/or 
In Sales/Marketing: If you enjoy getting out and being around people, attending our wealth building workshops and real estate seminars, this can help you to network and get to help other people interested in real estate investing get started with their home based business. You can do most all your work from home! Once certified, our sales agents are paid to enroll new real estate investing training associates. We get paid on Tuesday's & Friday's (8X a month). Our home based business is yours to control as long as you are willing to network and help provide customer service to the people you get enrolled. That's it! 
We create successful real estate investors and we have the results to prove that our system works. You must be coachable, willing to work very hard, dedicated, and most importantly passionate about the field of REAL E$TATE. We are very selective of whom we work with, and timing is everything. NOW IS THE TIME to make YOUR move towards building wealth. Register for a real estate seminar and come learn how you can build that massive and passive income working with us. We have offices local and we work with our associates making sure they are successful. CHANGE YOUR FINANCIAL FUTURE, Register Above! 
Learn Different Financing Strategies with or without your money through Self Directed IRA's, HSA's, Private Funding, Hard Money Lenders, Short Sales, Foreclosures & REO's, Fix & Flips, Rehabbing, Tax Liens, Wholesaling, Buy & Hold, Rent or Least Options, No Money, No Credit Acquisition, Subject To Investing, Multi Units or Apartment Complexes, Seller Financed Notes, Commercial Investments, and much more!

description.text:
Welcome singles, couples, parents with children, families, even co-workers!  Come enjoy this interactive talk about the impact that self-care has on a relationship. Attendees will learn what self care is, how to impliment a self-care plan, and how it may benefit platonic, romantic and even relationships with self.  
Refreshments will be served. 
"Caring for myself is not self-indulgence, it is an act of self-preservation." 
--Audre Lorde  
For more information see the Accelerated JoyWorks website. 
 www.acceleratedjoyworks.com

description.text:
Learn HTML & CSS 
Design Your Website 
  
TWO DAY EVENT -- MARCH 24 AND 25 -- 5 PM - 9 PM 
8 HOURS OF TRAINING 
  
HOSTED BY BRANDEE OGUNJOBI and SEAN ALLEN 
HTML is the programming language that powers the web. And like any language, once you master it, you can begin to create your own content, whether that's simple websites or complex web applications. This course provides an in-depth look at the essentials: the syntax of HTML and best practices for writing and editing your code.  Topics include: 

Why is HTML important?
Exploring an HTML document
Formatting content
Displaying images
Using nav, article, and div elements
Linking to pages and downloadable content
Creating lists
Controlling styling (fonts, colors, and more)
Writing basic scripts
description.html:
Learn HTML & CSS

Design Your Website

 

TWO DAY EVENT -- MARCH 24 AND 25 -- 5 PM - 9 PM

8 HOURS OF TRAINING

 

HOSTED BY BRANDEE OGUNJOBI and SEAN ALLEN

HTML is the programming language that powers the web. And like any language, once you master it, you can begin to create your own content, whether that's simple websites or complex web applications. This course provides an in-depth look at the essentials: the syntax of HTML and best practices for writing and editing your code.

Topics include:

  • Why is HTML important?
  • Exploring an HTML document
  • Formatting content
  • Displaying images
  • Using nav, article, and div elements
  • Linking to pages and downloadable content
  • Creating lists
  • Controlling styling (fonts, colors, and more)
  • Writing basic scripts

My philosophy on education is to create a culture of respect and improvement.  It is my desire to instill into students the drive and will to want to be better tomorrow than they are today, regardless of obstacles.  I strive to assist students in finding passion in a field of their choice while making strides towards success.   I feel that character defines an individual.  Given this attitude, we help students achieve in an atmosphere that does not condone excuses or failure.  I believe we can all have a positive impact in this world.
Jonathan Gentile, M.Ed.
Sequoia Pathway Academy Principal, 7-12

description.text:
Glendale Elementary School Dist #40 is the educational home for over 13,000 students from preschool to eighth grade. GESD is an elementary school district comprised of many diverse cultures; which result in over 2,000 English Language Learners. Additionally, 7% of our student population is comprised of gifted students. 
Our Mission
Our highly trained and caring staff, in partnership with our families and community, ensures each student will achieve the academic excellence and confidence to embrace a future of higher education leading to a productive and fulfilling life.
 
Our Core Values
Academic Excellence for Each Student - We believe that every student has an endless capacity to learn and achieve both academically and personally.
 
Integrity - As individuals and as an organization, we are committed to a culture of honesty, trust, respect and fairness with each other and the diverse communities we serve.
 
Diversity - We recognize and value the diversity of our students and community.
 
Partnerships - We are committed to working with parents, families, community and each other to ensure student success.
 
Safe, Orderly, and Welcoming Environment - We are committed to welcoming all individuals to our safe, secure and well-maintained schools and facilities.
 
Stewardship of Resources - We are dedicated to responsibly using all resources to best serve our students.
 
Employee Excellence - We believe in professional and personal excellence and in each employee’s responsibility to positively impact student learning and success.

description.text:
This new program is in collaboration with 4EEE, Juan Villarreal founder of Sacred Wind Earth Teachings, The Path, founded by Flordemayo, and The Children of the Earth Foundation, founded by Tom Brown, Jr., at Apache Springs, south of Tucson Arizona. We are very excited to run a family course in this part of the country, a sacred place that is steeped in history of Grandfather Stalking Wolf’s people.    We are grateful that Juan Villarreal and the new owners of Apache Springs Ranch have given this opportunity to hold courses at this site. Juan, Tom, Flordemayo, and I are very excited that this type of collaboration with other organizations is coming together. This is one way to show to children that we can work together and this is part of the evolving consciousness in how we educate our youth. 
Description:   A week long immersion in the sacred Apache Springs southwest mountains. This gathering will include hands on Earth Skills activities through the arts of nature awareness, tracking, wilderness living skills, earth philosophy, games, care taker attitude, and the spontaneous flow of where the wind guides us to listen and learn.  

Debris hut shelter
Bow-drill fire making
Cordage making 
Throwing stick
Cutting edge stone tool
Rock boiling
Fox walking, wide angle vision
Awareness games and activities
Tracking basics and concentric ring studies.
Lost proofing basics
Camp fire stories and night games
Attitude and philosophy of a Child of the Earth.  

With this collaboration there will be an opportunity for cross cultural teachings, learning  first hand through a Native perspective an unwritten history.           "We are here because of a vision; the ancestors, the spirit of the Grandmothers, have told us to teach all of the children of the world all that we know, for generations to come." – Flordemayo  For Parents and adults there will be discussions on teaching philosophy, skills geared for adults, as well as time to relax and have solo time in nature or time to have deeper discussions with the "Elders" around the fire and meals. Grandmother Flordeymayo will be present throughout the week and there will be opportunities to connect with her as there will also be with Juan and special visit from Grandmother Mona. It will be a unique week that has been anticipated for many years as now we are beginning to bring Grandfather’s message combined with the Grandmother’s message to create a powerful experience in a sacred place.

description.text: Explore the possibilities of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM), with LEGO Technic parts and motors!  Add mechanical power to your creations. Try building gravity powered zip line vehicles, engine driven forklifts, and even rubber band race cars; all powered by various motors, gears and axels from the LEGO Technic building system.  Engage your child’s inner engineer and inspire their creativity in this project based course.  - This class is open to students 2nd grade and above, and is enforced.  - Successful participants have basic experience with LEGO.  - This class features exclusive use of the LEGO Technic system of elements, which are very different from basic LEGO parts.  - All LEGO projects and other class materials remain property of Bonanza Educational: there are no take-home projects.

description.text:
Want to work smarter for yourself? Want to be financially free? Today I would like to invite you to our 2-hr real estate investing orientation where you will meet with our local real estate investment team and learn more about what we do as real estate investors & business ownership. Bring something to take notes with and come sit back and listen to why real estate investing is meant for everyone. Whether you like real estate or not, you might not realize yet that you already are an investor. You most likely pay for where you live now and you invest in someone's dreams! We all either pay a rent/mortgage or we get paid rent/mortgage. Would you rather pay someone for where you live, or would you like to get paid? How would you like to get FREE education, maybe a FREE car every couple years? How would you like to take control of your retirement. We will show you how SMART investors are doing exactly that. 
At our 2-hr real estate investing orientation, we intend to show why that possibility has slipped past the 99% and what we are doing with real estate TODAY! We will • show you the ONLY curriculum based, ongoing, and scalable education platform in the industry. • show you a plan that has assisted students, in our community, to a net worth over a million dollars in controlled assets. • show you how you can be involved in the properties that we are involved in. • show you to a working business model that you could have walk down the hall to your home office instead of fighting traffic. • show you the ways to make money, and how to be wealthy with a variety of strategies. • show you how you could be done interviewing for jobs for the rest of your life and comprehensively teach your children how to BE the same! 
WE ARE LOOKING FOR PEOPLE WHO WANT TO MAKE MONEY:   
In Real Estate Investing: We are looking for those who want to learn how to be an investor and those who want to build wealth through investments in Real Estate. Not only do we invest locally, but we also invest nationwide. Our investment associates earn anywhere from $5000-$100,000 per real estate transaction depending on the type of real estate transaction. A real estate license or experience is not necessary, but if you have either, great. Either way, we are here to show you how to be a real estate investor, where to invest, and our ways to make money. We work with everybody in our real estate investor training programs and here to help you build your own real estate investment portfolio. and/or 
In Sales/Marketing: If you enjoy getting out and being around people, attending our wealth building workshops and real estate seminars, this can help you to network and get to help other people interested in real estate investing get started with their home based business. You can do most all your work from home! Once certified, our sales agents are paid to enroll new real estate investing training associates. We get paid on Tuesday's & Friday's (8X a month). Our home based business is yours to control as long as you are willing to network and help provide customer service to the people you get enrolled. That's it! 
We create successful real estate investors and we have the results to prove that our system works. You must be coachable, willing to work very hard, dedicated, and most importantly passionate about the field of REAL E$TATE. We are very selective of whom we work with, and timing is everything. NOW IS THE TIME to make YOUR move towards building wealth. Register for a real estate seminar and come learn how you can build that massive and passive income working with us. We have offices local and we work with our associates making sure they are successful. CHANGE YOUR FINANCIAL FUTURE, Register Above! 
Learn Different Financing Strategies with or without your money through Self Directed IRA's, HSA's, Private Funding, Hard Money Lenders, Short Sales, Foreclosures & REO's, Fix & Flips, Rehabbing, Tax Liens, Wholesaling, Buy & Hold, Rent or Least Options, No Money, No Credit Acquisition, Subject To Investing, Multi Units or Apartment Complexes, Seller Financed Notes, Commercial Investments, and much more!

description.text:
The Arizona National Scenic Trail is a continuous, 800+ mile diverse and scenic trail across Arizona from Mexico to Utah. It links deserts, mountains, canyons, communities and people.
The Arizona Trail Association protects and maintains the 800-mile Arizona National Scenic Trail so that hikers, bikers and equestrians can experience the diverse and spectacular landscape and friendly communities across Arizona.
description.html:
The Arizona National Scenic Trail is a continuous, 800+ mile diverse and scenic trail across Arizona from Mexico to Utah. It links deserts, mountains, canyons, communities and people.

The Arizona Trail Association protects and maintains the 800-mile Arizona National Scenic Trail so that hikers, bikers and equestrians can experience the diverse and spectacular landscape and friendly communities across Arizona.

description.text:
Join Sonoran Desert Mountain Bicyclists for a ride on the Arizona Trail.  Meet at Posta Quemada Ranch at the expo area at 8:30.  We will be feet in pedals at 9:00 AM, and will ride for up to 3 hours.  The ride will head North from Posta Quemada, and can go as far as Hope Camp or Camino Loma Alta if time allows..  This will be a social-pace ride, and no one will be dropped.  There may be the option to split into a faster and a slower group, depending on interest.  
  
For those who haven’t ridden the this section of the AZT, it’s rolling singletrack with occasional rocky sections.  It’s fast, flowy, and fun.  There is a decent amount of climbing, but nothing too steep.  Since it’s an out-and-back ride, folks can turn around at any time.  Common turnaround points would be: 

Pistol Hill Road: 11.4 miles round trip
Rincon Creek: 18.4 miles round trip
Hope Camp: 20.2 miles round trip
Camino Loma Alta (Saguaro National Park): 24.8 miles round trip

  
While this is a social, no-drop ride, riders should have some experience mountain biking, a functional and well-maintained mountain bike, a helmet, and water, snacks, and appropriate tubes/tools. 
  
For any questions, email trailsteward@sdmb.org.

Find out the secret to the age old strap-on question “Which one pleasures me while I pleasure my partner”? So if you’re shying away from the leap or continually disappointed YOU need this class. Providing you with tips, tricks & trade secrets while leaving you with the facts will be Sex Educator, Kink Instructor and Queer Lifestyle enthusiast Goddess Sadie Hawkins. We don’t want your strap-on having a slip up before the climax….

Join us for fun filled dancing social event. 
  
This event has line dancing for all dance levels.  We have a spacious dance studio for all types of urban line dancing from beginner to intermediate. Whether you call them hustles, slides or line dance there will be something for all.

Solstice Management Group has expanded the distinct city presence on the Washington Street block through the investment and development of Monarch Theatre & Bar Smith venues. Renovations to the main room dance floor, concert stage, and imported Canadian PK sound system, the unique location exponentially accents the Phoenix downtown nightlife with its culturally well-rounded events and high-energy shows. With 2 venues, 4 stages including the open rooftop dance floor & bar at Bar Smith, Solstice Management Group prioritizes good music with a core of great people and positive energy.
 Our aim is to provide the valley with jivey break beats, classic hip hop, live acts, fashion events, traveling festivals, and more.

Monarch Fridays is downtown Phoenix's largest Friday night club event with 900+ on 2 floors at Monarch Theatre. HipHop/Latin + Live Banda.  
**$150 Bottles + tip ALL NIGHT**    Voted Best 'Latin Night Phoenix 2014 - Fridays at Monarch Theatre' - Phoenix New Times 
<< This GuestList Is Invalid if MonarchFridays has a special guest or event >> 
  
FAQs 
 Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
21+ Only - Legal ID (updated Arizona license or passport) is required. You will be unable to enter without ID.  
Is my registration/ticket transferrable? 
Your registration is exclusively for you. 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
Your name will be added to a list or you may show it on your phone.  
The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? 
Your ticket must match your ID 
What happens if I come after 1030pm?  
You must be online by 1030pm latest for your ticket to be valid. Security will be watching the line to confirm you came on time.

description.text:
We need your help! this adorable little girl, about 2-3 yeras old and only 7 pounds, was left for on our shelter doorstep on March 10.  The elderly woman who left her called us to make sure we found her (realizing what she did was not the right way to get her to us). She found the dog 2 months ago and was trying to find her family, but then her landlord found out about the dog and made her get rid of the dog. This sweet dog is now with us, and safe in a foster home. We immediately took her to our vet because she looked injured - her front leg is fractured and there's a plate in there, so she's had surgery for the injury recently. From the x-rays, you can see the plate and also see where the bone has not healed, so she will need an additional surgery to fix it.  We are asking for your help with her medical bills - she'll need to see a specialist to help fix her leg.  Right now she has an appointment for March 26, but we are hoping for a cancellation to get her in earlier.  She's a sweetheart, and we'd love to know if someone is still looking for her.   The first picture below is little Mimi (as we have named her), on her way to a foster home.  The second picture is little Mimi, resting comfortably next to the dogs who will be her best friends in her foster home.  The last image is the xray showing the plate, and the bone behind it that has not fully healed. 
No donation is too great or too small.  Our goal is $2,000 and we'll refine that number once we have more of an idea from the speicalist what is needed for her.  Mimi says thank you!

description.text:
The Desert Southwest Chapter of the Alzheimer's Association is a charitable organization incorporated in the State of Arizona and governed by a local board of directors.  While we are an affiliate of the National Alzheimer's Association based in Chicago, all our work is devoted to providing service and support to Alzheimer's patients, family members and caregivers throughout Arizona and Southern Nevada.


Our Mission To eliminate Alzheimer's disease through the advancement of research; to provide and enhance care and support for all affected; and to reduce the risk of dementia through the promotion of brain health.


Our Vision A world without Alzheimer's disease.


Our Purpose To empower and support individuals, families, care partners and communities affected by dementia in Arizona and southern Nevada.

Join us for the 4th Annual Central Arizona Wine to Remember! This year we will meet at The Irish Cultural Center for an afternoon filled with Irish beers, fine wines, and delicious hors d'oeuvres. 
Set among the walls of an Irish castle, this relaxing afternoon reception will feature silent and live auctions, live music, and entertainment, making it a wonderful opportunity to support the Desert Southwest Chapter.  
Tickets are $50 each, or two for $80.  
If you have any questions, please contact Jamie at 602.528.0545 or jrogers@alz.org.

description.text:
TEACH is a rare glimpse inside four public-school classrooms filmed over an entire school year through the eyes, hearts, and minds of four inspirational teachers. Academy Award winning documentarian Davis Guggenheim invites us to follow the struggles and triumphs of America's education system.   
For the viewer, TEACH is a chance to rethink and explore exactly what it means to be a teacher, to look at the tough and complicated job of teaching as a profession, examining in real time what it takes to reach thier students.  
"IT'S NOT A JOB. IT'S A MISSION." 
Davis Guggenheim shares with viewers, "I hope this film inspires people to realize this is a tough, demanding, deeply meaningful job where the stakes are extremely high and the rewards are infinitely rich,"  
http://www.takepart.com/teach/film

description.text: At Heitek Automation, we provide pneumatic, motion control and automation solutions to customers across a wide range of industries. We provide a consultative approach to supplying customers with solutions that improve the efficiency, productivity and profitability of their automated processes in manufacturing, assembly, or distribution. We believe in providing excellent customer service and deliver superior value through all phases of our value chain.We deliver value to our customers through a partnership of consulting, design, fulfillment and support.Our core competencies include pneumatic and electric automation controls, control panels, machine guarding & safety, motion, vision and vacuum systems, plus custom solutions.

description.text: We at Sun Valley Animal Shelter are hosting our 2nd Annual Pet Expo to promote adoptions and bring awareness to the communities of the Westside of Phoenix on Sunday, March 22nd, 2015 from 10:00am-4:00pm.  There will be over 70 pet related business or rescues that will be available to visit with, ask questions or purchase all of their necessities or even some bling for your cat or dog that you could ever imagine!  There will be an onsite professional photographer available to have your picture taken with your favorite pet for a small donation.  Vaccinations are required of your pet while visiting the festivities that day.  Vaccinations can be obtained at a low cost from the Sun Valley Hope Animal Hospital onsite.  Please plan on attending (or pass along all this information to all of your friends) and support all these awesome vendors as donations, in general, are always welcome.  Any questions can be directed to us at 623-872-7941. We hope to see everyone there this day!

description.text:
Presented by Speakman Coaching
Mike Speakman, LISAC

Mike is a licensed substance abuse counselor and Family Education Life Coach. In his private practice, as director of Speakman Coaching, he coaches families on the best methods for helping an addicted loved one. Mike developed his passion for educating families while working at in-patient treatment centers since 1988. In 2006, Mike founded PAL (Parents of Addicted Loved-ones, www.PalGroup.org) a free, peer-facilitated, educational self-help group for parents and spouses struggling with addiction problems in their family. 

There are now 17 PAL meetings in the Phoenix Metro Area, one in Tucson and three in other States. Mike's book "The Four Seasons of Recovery for Parents of Alcoholics and Addicts" is a handbook that provides a clear understanding of the steps a parent can take to regain control of a frustrating situation that at times can feel hopeless. it is available at SpeakmanCoaching.com.

Kim Humphrey
Kim is the principle of Accelerate Consulting LLC. Kim is a graduate of A.S.U and instructs as adjunct faculty for Arizona State University’s Bob Ramsey Executive Education school as well as Northern Arizona University in their public administration and justice studies programs.  Kim and his wife Michelle have been married for 32 years and have two adult sons. Kim’s passion for the past few years has been serving with Michelle as PAL facilitator’s in Glendale Arizona.

description.text:
This four-hour workshop will help create healthier relationships between parents and their children of any age, as well as strengthen any intimate relationships where a lack of healthy boundaries has created conflict, hurt and disappointments.  
Facilitated by leading family educator and licensed substance abuse counselor Mike Speakman and PAL facilitator Kim Humphrey, this workshop will teach you when and how to set boundaries with hands-on tools to create calm, centeredness and focus in your life. The goals of this workshop are to restore respect for your loved ones and increase your own personal self-regard. This workshop is especially helpful for those who are experiencing a loved one struggling with addiction or in the early stages of recovery.  
Why are healthy boundaries important?  

We have a right, and a duty, to take responsibility for how we allow others to treat us.
Demonstrating healthy boundaries with children is important to good parenting.
Boundaries protect us from the unhealthy behaviors of others.
Boundaries help us tell others when they are acting in unacceptable ways.
Setting boundaries is necessary for building healthy and mature relationships.
Our culture does not teach this skill.

   What will you learn in this workshop? 

How to set boundaries with anyone.
Knowing when to set a boundary.
How to use written agreements and contracts with loved ones.
How to choose the best consequence when a boundary is broken.
How to enforce a painful consequence

Admission is $80 at the door. This workshop will fill up fast; book now!   
                     $70 If Pre-Registered March 21st Thru 28th 
                         $60 If Early Pre-Registered March 3rd Thru March 20th 
       Mike's new book, The Four Seasons of Recovery         for Parents of Alcoholics and Addicts         will be available at a special price during the workshop.

description.text:
The purpose of the Green Valley Camera Club is to promote and develop skills in photography for its members, to foster an appreciation and understanding of photography and digital imaging as art and as a medium of communication, and to provide equipment, assistance and training, and to maintain facilities for the common good of its members.
In order to participate in classes, workshops and special interest groups (SIGs), you must be a member of the Green Valley Camera Club and GVR.

description.text:
This membership will expire on 12/31/2015. Renew your membership now! 
Please select just ONE of the ticket types for your household, as appropriate. 
We hope you will join us as members of The Green Valley Camera Club! With your membership, you will get to participate in classes, field trips and the use of the Digital Darkroom in our Club facility. 
Membership includes access to Club activities, classes, workshops and equipment. However, there are additional costs for supplies and special activities such as our multi-week Digital Photo Class and some field trips. 
For the most complete and current schedule of Club activities and links to many photo resources visit our website www.gvcameraclub.org. 
  
You must be a member of Green Valley Recreation (GVR) to join this club. 
If you have any comments, please send them to gvcameraclass@mail.com. 
Thanks for joining!

description.text:
INTRO TO SOUL SEX - Tucson AZ 
  
*** EARLY BIRD $85 PER PERSON *** 
Early Bird until MAR 23, $85 per person. After MAR 23, $95 per person. 
 Questions: jenny@jennyferry.com or 503.902.1197  
  
This workshop is open to singles and partners. LGBTQI-friendly.  
This is advanced human development training; there is NO nudity, sexual demonstration or activity at this event. 
Note of love + generosity: No one will be turned away for lack of funds. Please contact me directly with your financial truth + to be considered for a partial or full gift registration: jenny@jennyferry.com 
THIS IS A 3-HOUR WORKSHOP 
*** 
Someone once said, how you show up in bed is how you show up in your life. What if you could make small changes to your sex life and have the results affect your life as a whole? 
WHAT IS SOUL SEX? 
First of all, it’s not what you think. It’s not about having some pie-in-the-sky spiritual experience. It’s about being embodied + fully alive from the bottom up. (Pun intended!) 
Soul Sex is about bringing mindfulness into every aspect of our daily lives; about living a life that’s in alignment with what we really want, a life that’s connected to our body. Grounded, real + in the present moment. And fully embodied as a sexual being. 
AND, did you know you have an organic sexual response? How do you interact with sexual energy in a healthy + generative way? How do you express your sexuality consciously? 
INTRO TO SOUL SEX is about learning to skillfully recognize + navigate how you respond to sexual energy. You’ll gain deep insight into the three ways you respond, akin to the primal defense responses of fight, flight or freeze. You’ll learn to identify how you show up + how your partner shows up in intimate discussion + interaction. And you’ll learn the precise antidote for restoring flow to yourself + within your relationship. 
Soul Sex is about cultivating conscious relationship + intimacy at the speed of connection and in the fertile soil of trust. All while holding yourself + your partner within the context of curiosity, compassion + playfulness.  
At INTRO TO SOUL SEX you'll learn to incorporate these guiding principles in all areas of your life. Ultimately, you’ll: 


LEARN to skillfully and competently manage your sexual beingness and energy.
IMPROVE how you communicate and engage, increase your capacity for sensation.
TRANSFORM how you show up in the bedroom + in the world for the better


 
And it starts with your sexuality as the doorway to creating sustainable changes and thriving your life. 
At INTRO TO SOUL SEX, through simple instruction, lively discussion and PG-rated interaction you will drop into your body, challenge your mind, and live just a little farther outside your box than usual. 
This workshop is CO-ED and LGBTQI-friendly. OPEN to singles and partners. This is advanced human development training; there is NO nudity, sexual demonstration or activity at this event. 
Come spend 3 hours gently pushing your edges with other fun, adventurous people in a beautiful, safe, judgment-free space. 
***** “Revolutionary and paradigm shifting! Jenny has a gift of both directly and gently inviting people to look at their assumptions and understanding of sex. She offers a refreshing micro (individual) and macro (societal) perspective on owning our sex in a way that’s nourishing.” ~Kelly L., Boulder, CO 
“This was a self-healing, eye-opening experience in a big way. Some very powerful stuff was ignited for me tonight.” ~Patricia K., Victoria, BC, Canada  “Jenny’s workshop gave me the courage to desire really owning my sensuality and creativity, my unique flavour of who I am and what I feel. I feel that with Jenny my fear and my pain are as valid, honoured and acknowledged as my power and my sex.” ~Maartje G., Victoria, BC, Canada  *****  JENNY FERRY is an emerging leader in the field of conscious sexuality, creator of the ground-breaking Intro to Soul Sex workshop, and author of the forthcoming book, Soul Sex: A Field Guide to Redeeming Our Primal Desire to Connect. 
A visionary and dynamic teacher, Jenny is based out of the Pacific Northwest and leads workshops throughout the U.S. and Canada. She is highly regarded for her down-to-earth, compassionate training, speaking, and leadership. Learn more about Jenny at: http://jennyferry.com 
"After a series of deeply connected + successful visits of sell-out workshops from LA to Vancouver, I am excited to return to Tucson and meet people who are vitally interested in raising awareness, engaging in honest + respectful discourse + approaching their sexuality with consciousness."   QUESTIONS? FEEL FREE TO REACH OUT:  jenny@jennyferry.com / 503.902.1197

description.text:
Judge Learning, a division of The Judge Group, has over 10 years of healthcare learning and talent experience. We have a particular interest in helping organizations deploy effective change management and software learning solutions to improve patient safety and care coordination. Cerner is one of the applications that we are experts in and have a wide network of over 2,000 EHR professionals.
The Judge Group started as a professional service staffing firm in 1970 and in 1987 Judge Learning Solutions leveraged their relationship with over 12,000 training professionals to deliver training, implementation and custom e-learning services to the market.
Our website:  www.judge.com

description.text:
AZ Women in Media present members and non-members alike with the opportunity to get professional headshots taken by an award-winning photographer at a reduced rate. Join us  Thursday, March 26  5:30 p.m.  Civic Space Park 
Award-winning photojournalist Deanna Dent will be our guest photographer. Photos are $30 per person (plus Eventbrite fee) and will be emailed to you following the event. 
We only have 10 spots, so register now! When you see your hip headshot, you'll be happy you did! Freshen up your lipstick and join us after work for a quick get-together in the park! 
For more about photographer Deanna Dent, check out her website: http://deannadent.com/

description.text:
PROUDLY SPONSORED BY XEROX LITIGATION SERVICES -------------------   
Nurturing and Healing 
the Legal Profession 
 A New Paradigm for Promoting Health and Managing Stress in Legal Practice _________   A BOLD PROMISE: The information you gain at this unique event will be life-changing. 
  
Join us for lunch Friday, March 27, 2015, in Tucson to learn how the latest developments in medical science have led to an evolution in the practice of medicine that better addresses the healthcare needs of the 21st century; namely, Functional Medicine. 
Founded in 1990, the Institute of Functional Medicine is now retraining thousands of physicians and other healthcare practitioners here in the U.S. and worldwide in this new model of clinical practice. An advanced training program for doctors is being held in Tucson during the week of March 23 – and we’ve arranged a special presentation and Q&A discussion to be led by Dr. Sachin Patel, founder of the Cincinnati and Toronto-based Living Proof Institute. 
►   Anxiety, Burnout, Depression, Substance Abuse, Divorce and Suicide 
Unfortunately, these illnesses and life-damaging behaviors take their toll on far too many members of the legal profession and their support staffs. It’s well recognized that the practice of law triggers high levels of stress; and chronic stress can devastate our personal health and destroy cherished relations with loved ones, families and friends. Until now, prescription drugs and counseling therapy have been the primary tools to help legal professionals cope with the consequences of living under continual pressure to perform well and meet pending deadlines.  
►     Today, There are Much Better Tools for Promoting Health and Managing Stress  
At this luncheon, Dr. Patel will --  
►    Explain the marked differences between Functional Medicine and today’s conventional        healthcare 
►    Discuss how focusing on the individual and root causes of illness result in far better  health outcomes 
►    Reveal the true underlying causes of chronic anxiety, depression and fatigue and how to  manage them 
►    Offer a special report: “ADDRESSING AUTOIMMUNITY: America’s $100 Billion Ticking  Time Bomb,” and 
►    Show you how you can partner with your healthcare provider to reset your personal  health trajectory   
 ►     This Unique Program Offers 1-Hour of Professional Responsibility CLE Credit  
But, more importantly, if you have not heard about Functional Medicine before, you will gain truly eye-opening and life-changing information that can put you and people you care about on a path to vibrant health and well-being. We promise. Please encourage legal colleagues to attend and register early, as seating is limited. 
 ►     Date and Event Location  




Friday, March 27, 2015 – Hotel Congress, Copper Hall (private dining), 311 E. Congress Street, Tucson, Arizona, from 11:45 am to 1:15 pm, including lunch, Dr. Patel’s presentation, Q&A session and networking.  




   
 TO REGISTER CLICK "ORDER NOW" ABOVE   
Registration Deadline 12:00 noon, March 25 – Registration Fee - $30.00 
Seating is limited. Please register only if you are confident you will attend. 
FOR MORE INFORMATION Contact Anna Paige at (520) 427-8727 or email innersimplicity@gmail.com.

description.text:
This Week: Wednesday March 25th | 8-9am 
Chronos Productions: Wyatt Earp Saga - An Augmented Reality Tombstone Experience What if you could be a fly on the wall for a famous historical event?  What if you could walk the streets of Tombstone and watch the entire Wyatt Earp saga unfold. What if you could "be there" to see everything from the early conflicts with Sheriff Behan and the Cowboys through the O.K. Corral shootout and the ambushes that launched the Earp revenge ride? What if you could stand in the middle of history almost as if you were there as it happened? 
At Chronos we're doing the next best thing. We're bringing the film and VFX quality of Hollywood-level productions to historically accurate stories, with historians narrating and advising to keep the historical accuracy in-line with what actually happened. 
We've already started our proof-of-concept with the "The Killing of Frank Stilwell" a 4-scene test shoot at the world famous Old Tucson Studios that will be QR code embedded at eye witness positions at the very train depot where the killing happened in Tucson, AZ. Visitors will be able to see what happened from about where it happened, even when the eye witness accounts don't agree. Think of it like "CSI Earp". 
What is 1Million Cups?  
1 Million Cups (1MC) is a simple way to engage entrepreneurs in communities around the world. Each week, the 1MC program offers a local entrepreneurs an opportunity to present their startups to a diverse audience of mentors, advisors, and entrepreneurs. Presenters prepare a 6 minute educational presentation and engage in 20 minutes of feedback and questioning after they present. Entrepreneurs gain insight into possible ways they can improve their businesses, gather realtime feedback, connect with a community that truly cares about their progress, and walk away feeling like they have advanced their business. The audience also learns a great deal from the presentations. Whether this is through passively listening or deeply engaging with the entrepreneurs, there is much to learn every week from these dynamic and diverse communities

description.text: I'm Tabitha Dumas, Image & Influence Strategist, on a mission to help small business owners and entrepreneurs in the east Phoenix valley create whole-istic lives and businesses and SHINE the way they were meant to.
description.html: I'm Tabitha Dumas, Image & Influence Strategist, on a mission to help small business owners and entrepreneurs in the east Phoenix valley create whole-istic lives and businesses and SHINE the way they were meant to.

description.text:
Time to SHINE 2015 March event!!  
The third in our Time to Shine 2015 series!  
Sponsored by me, Tabitha Dumas, Image & Influence Strategist and my amazing and talented friend Andrea Boring of Shine Avenue Creative.  
Workshops designed to help you Elevate Your Image and Expand Your Influence, online, in real life and anywhere you're ready to start showing UP.  
We'll be meeting at the same time and place on the fourth Wednesday of every month of 2015 at the Gilbert Historical Museum in the Neely Community room.  
March's topic is ..."Growing your email list and email marketing tips!"  
Whatever your business, email is absolutely one of the most effective and affordable ways to reach out to your customers and prospects. Find out the types of lists, receive tips for engagement, learn how to grow your list and hear the nitty gritty of email marketing (like what time to schedule your email newsletters to go out).  
As always, there will be hands-on activities, brainstorming and an action plan along with great people and networking.  
A light lunch plus water and dessert are included in your admission.* 
CONTACT US for "pay at the door" options or paying cash or with a check.  
WE NEED SPONSORS! If you'd like to sponsor lunch or desserts and drinks, you can have a "showcase business" table at the event! Contact us for more information.  
Contact us about advertising your business on our resource table or providing materials with your company logo. We love promoting other businesses!  
*Tickets are non-refundable but ARE transferrable if you would like to send someone in your place.

description.text: AIGA, the professional association for design, stimulates thinking about design, demonstrates the value of design and empowers the success of designers at each stage of their careers. AIGA’s mission is to advance designing as a professional craft, strategic tool and vital cultural force. Founded in 1914, AIGA remains the oldest and largest professional membership organization for design, and is a nonprofit, 501(c)(3) educational institution.

description.text:
As part of our Mentorship Program, AIGA Arizona is excited to host a series of intimate dinners with local designers. The objective of each Dinner with a Designer is to bring together a small group of established professionals, designers with fewer than 10 years of experience, students, and educators to discuss the evolving state of our profession, lend advice, and share meaningful experiences. 
Each dinner represents an opportunity for designers, old and new, to celebrate the past, present and future of design. Through these organized dinners, we hope to provide our community an opportunity to better understand our roots as designers and plan for the success of tomorrow's design leaders. 
Dinner invitations are extended first to those who have expressed an interest in the Mentorship Program through AIGA Arizona. Any open seats at the table are will then be available to the entire Phoenix design community. 
  
Special Guests 
Don Newlen and Jami Pomponi Alire of Fervor Creative 
  
The cost to attend this special dinner is $15.00. 
Interested in sponsoring Dinner with a Designer? Please contact us.

description.text:
You are invited to join us for a special talk on the Transcendental Meditation (TM) technique. Space is limited so we suggest you reserve your seat now. Admission is free. 
The TM® Technique has been learned by over 6 million people, and over 350 published studies have found it effective for relieving stress, anxiety, improving health and wellness, and more.  
What you'll learn: 

Why TM is so effective for stress and anxiety
How TM promotes health and wellness
What happens during TM
Why anyone can practice TM
Why TM works from the start
How to learn TM in Tucson

And of course we'll allow ample time for your questions.

description.text:
Ableton is proud to partner with University of Arizona for the Ableton Experience, a day and evening of student workshops and public presentations held at the University of Arizona campus in Phoenix, AZ. Students are invited to join Ableton representatives and Certified Trainers for an afternoon of break-out sessions exploring composition, sound design, production techniques and performance utilizing Ableton Live, Max for Live and Push. Day time activities will be followed by a free evening presentation open to the public, featuring performances, tips and tricks and unique approaches for music-making from artists and Ableton experts. Special guests for the University of Arizona event include Ken Porter/Ableton Certified Trainer) and Huston Singletary (Ableton). 
  
Event guests: 
  
Ken Porter is an Ableton Certified Trainer, musician, host, and educator from Phoenix, AZ. A remixer, mastering engineer and musician Ken Porter has drawn on his international performing experience and his mastery of the latest software and hardware tools to stay on the cutting edge of electronic and pop music for over fifteen years. 
Ken specializes in advanced production techniques, finding unique ways to produce creatively in all situations, including pop, rock, dance, and spoken word. Ken personally landed a US and European record contract with his own band, succeeded in placing on the Deutsche Alternative charts, and has toured Europe and the US using Ableton Live as his primary performance tool. He has licensed his original music to video games and movies and has extensive experience in remixes and production, with several international releases under his belt. Ken has used Live since version 2.0 
  
About Ableton: 
  
Ableton makes Live - a unique music creation and performance software - and Push, a hardware instrument for playing and composing with Live. Ableton was founded in 1999 and released the first version of Live in 2001. Since then, the company has received outstanding press, numerous awards and attracted a worldwide community of dedicated musicians, composers and DJs. The company headquarters are in Berlin, with an additional office in Los Angeles. Ableton is run by its original founders and currently has about 160 employees. 
  
When: Thursday, April 25, 2014  
  
11:30-1:00pm: Presentation for Faculty & Lunch 
2:00-5:00pm: 
University of Arizona student break-out sessions with Huston Singletary (Ableton) 
(Students and invitees only) 
6:30-8.30pm: 
Artist performance and presentation feat. Ken Porter and Ableton's Huston Singletary 
(Free and open to the public) 
  
Where: University of Arizona 
Green Room / Room 146 
Fred Fox School of Music 
1017 N. Olive Rd 
Tucson, AZ 85721

A remixer, mastering engineer and musician Ken Porter has drawn on his international performing experience and his mastery of the latest software and hardware tools to stay on the cutting edge of electronic and pop music for over fifteen years.

Ken specializes in advanced production techniques, finding unique ways to produce creatively in all situations, including pop, rock, dance, and spoken word. Ken personally landed a US and European record contract with his own band, succeeded in placing on the Deutsche Alternative charts, and has toured Europe and the US using Ableton Live as his primary performance tool. He has licensed his original music to video games and movies and has extensive experience in remixes and production, with several international releases under his belt. Ken has used Live since version 2.0

 

About Ableton:

 

Ableton makes Live - a unique music creation and performance software - and Push, a hardware instrument for playing and composing with Live. Ableton was founded in 1999 and released the first version of Live in 2001. Since then, the company has received outstanding press, numerous awards and attracted a worldwide community of dedicated musicians, composers and DJs. The company headquarters are in Berlin, with an additional office in Los Angeles. Ableton is run by its original founders and currently has about 160 employees.

 

When: Thursday, April 25, 2014 

 

11:30-1:00pm: Presentation for Faculty & Lunch

2:00-5:00pm:

University of Arizona student break-out sessions with Huston Singletary (Ableton)

(Students and invitees only)

6:30-8.30pm:

Artist performance and presentation feat. Ken Porter and Ableton's Huston Singletary

(Free and open to the public)

 

Where: University of Arizona

Green Room / Room 146

Fred Fox School of Music

1017 N. Olive Rd

Tucson, AZ 85721

Do U want to experience more prosperity and balance in your life?
Would U like to eliminate fear, doubt and worry and move towards your goals with confidence?
Do U struggle with keeping inspired and motivated?
Is the success U desire eluding U?

During this dynamic and fun training U will have an opportunity to design your dream, define your goals and receive the blueprint for how to turn your greatest possibility into your reality.
