description.text:
If we know it takes a village, then we need to think about WHO in the village should participate and HOW do we engage them? In this session we explore collaboration vs. cooperation, human-centered design, and other strategic approaches for adaptable solutions in the new economy. 
  
During this 2-hour "lunch & learn" you will have the chance to participate in an interactive exploration of these questions. 
  
Just bring your lunch and your brain, and we will do the learning together. 
  
Angie Donelson is a specialist in regional development with 18 years of professional experience in research and planning, financing, implementing and evaluating community and economic development programs. LeadLocal is a think, learn, and do tank that empowers people to learn, grow, innovate and lead as local and global citizens. 
 Monday, March 23 11:30 pm - 1:30 pm Joel D. Valdez Main Library Idea+Space, 2nd floor

description.text:
Less than 98% of us have written, clear, vision statements for our lives and our business.  How can we create success or lead others without first knowing where we are going so people can follow and succeed, too?  JOIN US FOR THIS ONE DAY  'VISION IS EVERYTHING' WORKSHOP Thursday, March 26th 9:00 - 4:00  
The Seguara Hotel in Scottsdale 
4000 N. Drinkwater Blvd, Scottsdale 


 This interactive event will be lead by Carey Conley, Co-Creator of Infin8Nation, Vision & Goal Setting Coach in which you will cover:  *  Reconnecting to and clarifying the vision for your life and/or business that is uniquely yours *  Developing awareness and learning tools to help you, and your teams, get unstuck *  Identifying necessary time shifts in order to make better decisions with regards to money, activities, and relationships for more positive personal and professional growth *  Creating measurable and achievable goals for long term and short term success!    You will leave this day having a plan, knowing your plan, and being able to EXCUTE YOUR VISION!

description.text:
A Full 48 Hour Digital Detox 
We want to help people with social networking, not online but in the real world. To help create connections that go beyond just liking a photo or retweeting a peer. #Detox will take place on the 27th of Feb- 1st of March that will help you personally, with work and that hopefully last a lifetime. We have a few rules that will help the process: 
  


No devices whatsoever (we'll be checking) 


We'll allow you make one phone call a day to loved ones from our "bat phone" 


Come with an open mind 


Leave work behind you in every sense of the word 


 
Food For The Brain & Movement For The Body 
  
What we often forget to do is eat well and look after our bodies when we get busy. We'll have a private chef cooking us the very finest food to help get the body back track. We'll also be doing some activities (you don't need to be in amazing condition) over the course of the two days as well as having some professionals offering you a massage at the end of a long day. We'll keep most things a surprise but expect the body to be active and to eat wonderful wholesome food. 
  
We'll only be taking 20 people with us and they will be carefully selected. The ticket price includes the following: 


Pick-up and drop-off from Dublin 


All food and soft drinks for the 48 hour period 


Accommodation 


Entertainment and activities 


All networking sessions

description.text:
Hello! I'm Dayna Mathews, Career Coach at Dayna Marie Coaching. It's my sole mission help people create successful, fulfilling careers and lives; careers that fit the personalities, goals, needs, and desires of my clients. I help them accomplish this through progressive personal coaching strategies, effective personal branding across LinkedIn, resumes, cover letters, and other social media platforms, and teaching the ins and outs of how to find what they're looking for and get what they want. 
My vision is to create a brighter, happier, more fulfilled professional-level workforce one client at a time!
Want to learn more? Find me on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/daynamathews
Can't wait to meet you!

description.text:
NOTE: This event is posted and hosted through Networking Phoenix. If you are a Networking Passport member, this event is free to attend.  
So, you have a LinkedIn profile. Great! Do you exhaustively understand how to use the platform to help you get what you want? Maybe. Have you gotten results using LinkedIn yet? Possibly.  
This workshop is NOT meant for people who don't yet have a profile (sorry, guys, I'll get you next time).  
I've created this one for the folks who have a profile, but haven't completely figured out what to do with it and how, yet. 
They haven't optimized their profile to make sure that people actually notice and want to talk with them.  
It's for the people who say, "Yeah, I have a LinkedIn, but I'm not sure what to do with it" or "I just don't get how this can actually work!" or "I haven't gotten any results from it yet, so why bother?"  
Lastly, it's for the people who want to create a massively successful personal brand using this amazing (free) platform.  
I'm going to teach you how, and we'll have some fun along the way too.  
What you will learn:  
1. The top 5 mistakes professionals make on LinkedIn and how to avoid them. 
2. How to exponentially increase your network with people you actually know.  
3. How to approach important people in a way that gets you more results. 
4. The lesser known features that allow you to quickly expand your network & get results. 
5. How to make your profile stand out amongst the sea of other professionals in your field.  
And MORE! You don't wanna miss this. OH! And bring your computers with you so you can play! 
PS - anyone who attends gets 25% off my LinkedIn Profile services!

description.text:
Phoenix Doctoral Reception 
Celebrate your accomplishment with fellow doctoral graduates, faculty and special guests at an exclusive reception to be held immediately following the Phoenix Campus 10am Commencement Ceremony. This event is exclusively for the Ceremony Doctoral Graduates and their guests, family, friends.  
Light hors d' oeuvres and beverages will be served so please arrange lunch on your own after the reception.  
*Bring this registration ticket with you to the University of Phoenix Stadium for entrance into the Doctoral Reception. You will also receive a reception RSVP when checking in the day of the ceremony. Staff will be available to help guide you to the reception area.  
After the ceremony, you will meet your guests on the Lobby Level then proceed to the Club Level (level 2) to the Birds Nest/Squash Court room. You can access this level by the ramp or elevators. 
Special Guests include:  
Dr. Hinrich Eylers, Executive Dean, School of Advanced Studies 
Dr. Dallas Taylor, Director of Academic Affairs, Phoenix Campus 
Also, School of Advanced Studies and Phoenix Campus deans, chairs 
  
Don't miss this opportunity to celebrate your accomplishments with your peers! 
  
We ask that you limit your guests.  
Please RSVP by 4/17/15.

*Bring this registration ticket with you to the University of Phoenix Stadium for entrance into the Doctoral Reception. You will also receive a reception RSVP when checking in the day of the ceremony. Staff will be available to help guide you to the reception area. 

After the ceremony, you will meet your guests on the Lobby Level then proceed to the Club Level (level 2) to the Birds Nest/Squash Court room. You can access this level by the ramp or elevators.

Special Guests include: 

Dr. Hinrich Eylers, Executive Dean, School of Advanced Studies

Dr. Dallas Taylor, Director of Academic Affairs, Phoenix Campus

Also, School of Advanced Studies and Phoenix Campus deans, chairs

 

Don't miss this opportunity to celebrate your accomplishments with your peers!


We ask that you limit your guests. 

Please RSVP by 4/17/15.

Focused on hands-on leadership, a clear vision, building longstanding relationships, and thinking outside the box for benefit solutions. She is experienced in strategic benefit implementation assisting HR managers and business owners in finding the right path for their specific needs.

Our mission is to build long lasting relationships through hard work, honesty, and trust. With a focus on having a fun while working with clients. It's where our passion for helping people meets our strengths in creativity, straightforward talk and organization.
Working together with professionals in the Gilbert area has allowed us to help businesses and individuals all over the East Valley, and Valley Wide. 
We look forward to seeing you at the workshops!

This month's workshop is pulling together three phenomenal experts to talk about different employee aspects of your business. We will have: 

Failure to communicate? Get Specific: Andy Shirk -  Founder, True Roots Development. Andy will facilitate an active conversation where you will get to practice valuable communication techniques guaranteed to improve employee performance.
How your employees finances impact your business: JW Rayhons - President, Rayhons Financial. JW will be speaking about the impact your employees finances can have on your business, ways to help manage the hard times, and employee performance through those situations.
Protecting your business with an employee handbook: Mai-Lin Garcia - President, Synergy HR Solutions. Mai-Lin will be speaking on the risks of not having policies and proceedures in place through your employee handbook and tips on what should be included. 

Come with your questions and be prepared to learn a lot of information in a short time. We are excited to host this great event in the Pisa room at Villa Siena. Lunch will be provided.

description.text:
The Arizona National Scenic Trail is a continuous, 800+ mile diverse and scenic trail across Arizona from Mexico to Utah. It links deserts, mountains, canyons, communities and people.
The Arizona Trail Association protects and maintains the 800-mile Arizona National Scenic Trail so that hikers, bikers and equestrians can experience the diverse and spectacular landscape and friendly communities across Arizona.

description.text:
Equestrian Ride at Colossal Cave/Posta Quemada  
 
Ride will depart  promptlyat 9 a.m./Gates to the park open at 8 a.m. 
Ride is 3 to 4 hours and medium difficulty with some riding along sheer drops through rocky ledges.
Helmets for humans and shod horses recommended
 
Bring your equine for 3 1/2 hours of enjoyment along that Arizona Trail. We'll loop around on the high side of the AZT looking over Posta Quemada ranch, then around through La Sevilla up around near Pistol Hill then loop back in time for lunch around noon at Posta Quemada (Either bring your own, or lunch will be available for a small cost). There will be washes, canyons, tall trees and plenty of gorgeous views of Posta Quemada Canyon and the entire Tucson Valley.
 
When arriving go through Posta Quemada and up past the railroad car to the open lot on your left near Bandit Outfitters. Plenty of easy parking. We ask for a $5 donation per rider to benefit the Arizona Trail. Admission to the park will be free, just let them know at the gate that you're here for Arizona Trail Day.
 
The fun will continue into the evening at the Colossal Campout at La Sevilla Campground with tasty food from It's Greek to Me, live music with Eb Eberlein and Arizona Trail Ale around the campfire.  Visit http://www.aztrail.org/trail_day/ccmp.html for more details and to register for camping and meals. 
 
Questions? Please contact Mark Flint markflint@dakotacom.net
 
This ride is not affiliated with any club, and riders will be required to sign a release form to participate.

description.text:
Class cost is $85 per person (Scouters)
 
$10 add-on CPR and AED training.
 
Mon 3/23, Tues 3/24, 8am to 4:30pm. 

 
16 hour Wilderness First Aid training
 
(BSA and GSA approved).
 
(Adults and kids over 12 welcome.)
 
 
 

Wilderness First Aid 
Wilderness first aid is needed for activities in remote areas such as hiking, climbing, camping, sailing, hunting, birding or snowmobiling. Anyone living, working, traveling, or just enjoying the wilderness should be prepared to manage medical emergencies. A definition of "wilderness" is a location that is 1 or more hours away from definitive medical care. Included would be remote communities, developing countries and urban areas after a disaster. Also included would be remote areas where outdoor occupations are conducted (farming, mining, commercial fishing, forestry and some construction sites). 
Wilderness first aid is the immediate care given to an injured or suddenly ill person. It does not take the place of definitive medical care. It consists only of giving assistance until a more advanced level of medical care is obtained or until the chance for recovery without medical care is apparent. 
Wilderness first aid has a distinct focus because: 
·         Injuries and illnesses occur outdoors, often in adverse conditions that affect both victims and rescuers. 
·         Definitive medical care may be delayed for hours or days by a difficult location, bad weather, and lack of transportation or communications. 
  

·         Certain injuries and illnesses are more common in remote areas. 
·         Medical care beyond urban first aid may be needed. 
·         First Aid supplies and equipment are limited. 
·         Difficult decisions must be made. 
Designed for those who work or travel in remote locations, this comprehensive program will teach you what to look for and what to do in the event of an emergency, and direct you to the most appropriate type of care.  At the end of each course students will have to pass a written test and upon successful completion the student will receive a three (3) year certification card. This program meets the American Camp Association (ACA) guidelines.

description.text:
Owner of Arizona Energy Wellness LLC - Beth Cornell
 
I work directly with people to design specific experiences that provide ways to tap into deep inner resources of creativity for health, wellness, creative problem solving, and restoration. It is possible to become aware of and work with your own subtle energy field through our sessions, classes, and programs.
Energy medicine is proactive and preventative. All information presented on this website is supplied in the spirit of research to inform consumers of alternative treatment methods available. The copy for this website is written and published by Beth Cornell - copy/information provided by way of external links within this website remain the property of those who authored and published them.
Thank you for your time.
 
Beth's Credentials:
 

Allegra - Certificate in Meditation for Healthcare Professionals (Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction MBSR)
Listed with Donna Eden’s Energy Medicine Institute as a practitioner.
Listed with Chios Healing as a Master Teacher.
Reiki Master Teacher certified.
Upledger Institute - CranioSacral Therapy 1
Hannelore M. Stumpf, Ed.D., Ph.d. - private meditation teacher, Beth studied under Dr. Stumpf's direction for 10 years.
Creative and Expressive Arts

2012 Recipient of West Valley Arts Council's Individual Artist Grant (Art Therapy).
18 year career as a self-taught intuitive artist using color and process.
Regional manager for after-school arts program (drawing).
2 year term serving as Secretary for AFCA (community art initiative).


Occupational Therapy Assisting, OTA (64 credit hours/4.0 GPA; transcripts upon request)
Arizona State Background Clearance Card (upon request)
Owner of Be Nice Design LLC 1999 - 2009 Web and Graphic Design.

 
 
http://www.arizonaenergywellness.com
beth@arizonaenergywellness.com
602-309-1915

description.text:
MADE Hitting Training Camp 
Every Saturday @ "The Moon" 

Ages: 8-15 yrs
When: Every Saturday
Time: 12pm - 1:50pm(arrive by 11:50am)
Where: Moon Valley High School (Varsity Baseball Field)
No more than 25 hitters per camp
Up to 5 MADE instructors at camp(ratio never more than 6 players: 1 coach)
#MADECampMVP of each week wins brand new Zinger Bat!
Wear/bring full baseball gear - pants, spikes, glove, bat, and also turf/running shoes for the cage if you prefer
BRING YOUR OWN WATER

  
*If your player is younger than 8 years old, please give us a call at (602)688-4759 to set up a private baseball lesson with your player. We will evaluate the player from there, and if we feel that he is ready, he will be able to sign up for a future camp(s)! 
 
 
***All payments must be made on-line***
 
 
Every week we train hitters on the following hitting concepts and practices:  

How to be more self-sufficient when it comes to improving their game
Swing Mechanics
Bat Speed
Mental Approach
Situational Hitting
Hitting to all parts of the Field
Core hitting strength
Hitting homework and easy to implement drills
and much more

 Camp Expectations, Details, and FAQ's 
  
  

  
 
  
 
  
Four Things hitters can expect from MADE Hitting Campsp: 

1. Work at a high intensity and push yourself to get better 2. Learn proper hitting techniques 3. Receive hitting drill homework to work on your own at home 4. Have a lot of fun...and maybe be the winner of a brand new Zinger Bat! 

 


MADE offers weekly Hitting and Pitching Camps, Small Group Lessons,  and Individual lessons!  
MADE Baseball 
ABOUT MADE 
MADE INSTRUCTORS 
PRIVATE BASEBALL LESSONS 
BASEBALL CAMPS IN PHOENIX 
MADE BLOG

Every Saturday @ "The Moon" 

Ages: 8-15 yrs
When: Every Saturday
Time: 2pm - 3:45pm(arrive by 1:50pm)
Where: Moon Valley High School (Varsity Baseball Field)
No more than 25 pitchers per camp
Up to 4 MADE instructors at camp(ratio never more than 6 players: 1 coach)
Wear/bring full baseball gear - pants, spikes, glove, bat, and also turf/running shoes for the cage if you prefer
BRING YOUR OWN WATER

 
***All payments must be made on-line***
 

Every week we train pitchers on the following pitching concepts and practices:  

How to become more self-sufficient when it comes to improving their game
BCD's - Brain Conditioning Drills, MADE's proprietary pitching mechanics program
Pitching Mechanics
Different pitches and pitch grips
Proper pitching training techniques
Mental Approach to pitching
Situational Pitching - When to throw what pitch and why?
Pitching to both sides of the plate
PFPs - Pitcher's Fielding Practice
Pick off moves
Arm Care program(resistance bands, jobes, isometric exercises, and more)
Pitching homework and easy to implement drills
and much more

Receive pitching drill homework to work on your own at home 4. Have a lot of fun, learn how to pitch, and look forward to making hitters look foolish. 

 


MADE offers weekly Hitting and Pitching Camps, Small Group Lessons,  and Individual lessons!

description.text:
"VOYAGER Tom Moore" uses sound and silence to create meditative music that helps you shift your attention from external stimuli to the more subtle place of "feeling and Being." 
The evening's music and sounds will help relax your body and calm your mind as you go on a journey through unfolding sonic dimensions of "inner space" and experience the stillness within. 
Tom's music is heard on Sirius Satellite Radio's "ZEN" and "New Age" stations, the syndicated "music from the Hearts of Space," and it was also included in the award winning "Illumination" video production. 
  
FAQs 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
No small children allowed in order for the evening to quiet and peaceful 
  
  
FAQs 
  
What can/can't I bring to the event? 
Wear comfortable clothing and bring something to drink such as water.  Although blankets and yoga mats are provided, you may may want to bring your own.

description.text:
Mix Things Up With Robert Porter at Mixology School at The Second Story Liquor Bar Starting Sunday, March 1st at 1 p.m. 
Learn About the History of Showcased Cocktails with Interactive and Hands-on Classes 
(SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.) – Shake, pour, stir and garnish your Sundays away starting March 1st at Mixology School by Robert Porter at The Second Story Liquor Bar. 
Located just above the Gelato Spot on Scottsdale Road and 3rd Avenue, The Second Story Liquor Bar opened to rave reviews last spring and is quickly getting known as the hot spot for crafty cocktails  
For just only $50 per person, this is opportunity no cocktail lover would want to miss.  
Learn first-hand from resident mixologist, Robert Porter, one of the trendiest mixologist in the Valley. With over a decade spent perfecting his skills, Porter is admired and respected by all that get the opportunity to try his handcrafted creations. Guest will have the opportunity to learn from the master himself, as he teaches the class the core ideas behind creating an awesome drink.  
Whether you’re in it for the drinks, experience, or both, Second Story Liquor Bar has created the perfect program that allows its guests to learn the basic skills to understand and create some of the most popular drinks. Each class will feature comprehension on history, ingredients and proper preparation techniques of the prevalent drinks. Enjoy an afternoon with great company in an amazing atmosphere.  
At the end of the class, guests will have a greater understanding on industry tips and feel a sense of accomplishment and increased knowledge.    
“We’re excited to offer a fun class that explains everything mixology. Guests will learn everything from the history of cocktails, to how to physically shake and pour the drink,” said Tommy Plato, owner of Second Story Liquor Bar. “Robert Porter whose background includes the Jade Bar is a true artist, and I am thrilled to have him leading the class.” 
Most classes will have a capacity of 7 guests, but private events for larger parties can be accommodated with advance notice. There will be two classes available every Sunday; at 1 p.m. and 3 p.m. With themes changing every week, guests can be sure that every class is a unique experience every single time. Enjoy from a wide variety of classic and modern cocktails, including Hollywood, Pacific Rim, Asian Inspiration and several others.  
Appetizers could also be included for an additional cost. Flavor profiles will compliment featured cocktail themes. Guests will be able to enjoy up to 7 drinks for a diverse and unforgettable experience.  
Classes will be offered every Sunday starting March 1st. 
To make a reservation buy a ticket on eventbrite.  
About The Second Story Liquor Bar:  Experience a world-class restaurant driven by passion and storytelling. Revealing fresh ingredients and fine spirits, making this the backbone of Second Story Liquor Bar’s flavor profiles. Allow us to guide you through a thoughtful look inside the Art of Savory, Modern American Cuisine and perfectly crafted cocktails. 
###

description.text:
E-filing with AZTurboCourt 
  
The AZTurboCourt e-filing application is available for use NOW in Pima County Superior Court for Civil initiating (complaint) and subsequent filings.  
This training provides an overview presentation and live demonstration for users who have already registered in AZTurboCourt.  
Even though you may have filed in Maricopa County Superior Court using AZTurboCourt, it is highly recommended that you attend training as this version of the software has differences unique to Pima County Superior Court. 
  
  
Learn How To:  
  
ü  File a new Civil case and retrieve your issued Summonses 
ü  Correctly attach documents for Pima County filings  
ü  Attach multiple document in one submission 
ü  Efficiently set-up & utilize AZTurboCourt in your office 
ü  E-file and pay filing and user fees on-line  
ü  Reduce data entry for multiple filings 
  
  
  
All trainings are located at Arizona State Courts building 
1501 W Jefferson, Phoenix, AZ 
Parking is FREE on the Jefferson Street side of the building OR in the Wesley Bolin Memorial Plaza just West of the building

description.text:
UTO Training provides a variety of free, in-person and online workshops.
We offer training on Blackboard, Adobe products, Microsoft Office, video editing and more!
Don't see the class you're looking for? Would you like a specific class for your department? Email us at utotraining@asu.edu.
 
Most of our workshops are held in ECB 103, which can be difficult to find. If your workshop is being held in this room, here is a map to help you locate it.

description.text:
This workshop is reserved for ASU faculty, staff and TAs.  Tips, tricks, and best practices to get started with Blackboard’s Tests.  Blackboard’s Tests tool is a rich and powerful tool that enables you to administer tests electronically in place of paper and pencil exams. This workshop will teach you how to: 

effectively build and use Blackboard tests your iCourse, hybrid and face-to-face courses 
create test pools (question repositories) 
build and deploy tests with various settings 
review and grade submission

This is a hands-on workshop designed for instructors and TAs already familiar with the Blackboard course management system. Blackboard Introduction is recommended as a prerequisite. You can participate in the self-paced workshop by accessing this link: http://links.asu.edu/blackboard_introduction. 
 This workshop is conducted in a computer lab where each participant has a workstation and works through examples in a practice Blackboard course.  WHILE WE RECOMMEND THAT YOU ATTEND IN PERSON, YOU CAN ATTEND REMOTELY.  To attend remotely, visit http://connect.asu.edu/utotraining/. Click the radial button next to Enter as a Student or Guest, type your first and last name in the Name box, and click ENTER ROOM. A chat tool is also available.  To hear what’s happening in the room, dial 1-877-820-7831 and at the prompt enter the conference ID 395689. We recommend a hands-free phone so you can participate in the hands-on activities.  
 This workshop is subject to cancellation up to 24 hours prior to its scheduled time if there are less than 4 registered attendees.  If you have questions about this class, please email UTOtraining@asu.edu.   NOTE: Pursuant to the Americans with Disabilities Act, if you require specific aids or services, please contact Carlos.Sanchez@asu.edu. ADA REQUESTS MUST BE MADE AT LEAST 2 WEEKS BEFORE THE CLASS BEGINS TO ENSURE TIMELY RECEIPT.

description.text:
Laurie Handlers invites you to the Enchantment Ceremony: an exquisite White Tantra ritual awakening your inner wisdom while honoring the Divine in us all. 
Professional sacred sex educator Monique Darling combines her years of devoted practice and teachings in acceptance, adoration, unconditional love (first of yourself, which then showers on all in your field), and embodiment (giving yourself full permission of Heaven on earth in THIS moment and in THIS body). She has facilitated many such rituals as the Enchantment Ceremony. 
Step into a world of acceptance and sensation where all of you is welcome. Each person is invited into magical connections to expand your experience of giving and receiving. The ritual begins the moment you enter as you are celebrated, seen and adored for ALL you are. 
Be completely held in your deepest humanity and greatest Divinity as you dance into sweet union. The greatest gift from the Enchantment Ceremony is the beauty of surrender and the willingness to offer all of yourself in this unforgettable evening. 
In this profound experience you are invited to show your adoration with rituals such as washing and adorning the feet, offering elements of silence, chocolate, witnessing tears, or showering roses. 
We welcome you to reclaim your space and powerful place in the world as we unveil your deepest core. You will leave enchanted having fallen more deeply in love with YOU. 
Come dressed in your fanciest dress, ready to be adored. With open hearts and deep connection you will be "rebirthed" from a place of complete vulnerability and fullness as you choose to wake up to YOU! 
This is a non-sexual experience and welcomes people of all types and is LGBTQ friendly. 
What others have said about The Enchantment Ceremony: 
"Heart opening, will make you cry, have your energy flow through every pore, try it on" 
"Not knowing what to expect upon entering this illuminated room, I found myself being honored and revered in the most sacred way. I left feeling most loved. Thank you for the gift of myself" 
"A very supportive group to encourage claiming our full freedom and outrageous loveliness" 
"Don't ask, just go!! Serenity, grace, and fullness await" 
"I saw myself as a person capable of loving someone and being loved, realized my mom and dad ARE proud of me, I see in me the person I was always meant to be" 
Thank you for the gift of The Enchantment Ceremony. You know, we all live in a world in which we are over worked and often under-appreciated. This White Tantra ritual was an opportunity to have one's heart filled up with unconditional love. It was a transformative event, and I highly recommend it to everyone, whether you are woo-woo like me or not. Together we practiced giving and receiving non-sensual adoration. For example, we bathed each other's feet, fed each other chocolate, and showered words of affirmation on each other. We also opened up our hearts to speak vulnerable truths. At one point, we were invited to let go of something we no longer needed. I lit a small candle, and into it I whispered the words, "I let go of the need to be right." And then with one breath, I blew out the flame and let it go! ~ Gayle Roberts, San Francisco 
"Wow, the Enchantment Ceremony was so much more powerful than I imagined. I arrived nervous, shy, and unsure of what might happen, and I emerged filled with gratitude, radiance, joy, and many new friends. Thank you Monique, for this incredible gift" 
"Monique's Enchantment Ceremony was an experience to remember. Allowing Sacred Space for all to express themselves in whatever ways they needed to heal and come into their own sacred divinity." 
"The Enchantment Ceremony created a nurturing environment that invited so much release. I feel like parts of my soul have been born again" 
"what is so beautiful about your Enchantment Ceremony is how in the NOW -- 2014 -- it is. I saw how each of us were able to connect authentically. Freed of 'traditional' we crafted our own ways of greeting one another... and saying thank you. Each pairing brought forth uniqueness." 
Love Exchange: $40 a person/$60 per couple in advance  $50 per person on the door if tickets are still available 
Purchase your ticket today on Eventbrite to secure your spot for this incredible evening: 
Join us for all our yummy Arizona events: 
Monday, March 30, 2015 at 7:00pm - 10:00pm : Your Emotions Make Me Hard Part 3 : https://www.facebook.com/events/313010755574495/ 
Tuesday, March 31, 2015 at 7:00pm - 10:00pm : Enchantment Ceremony with Monique Darling : https://www.facebook.com/events/276820735774973/ 
Wednesday, April 1, 2015 at 7:00pm - 10:30pm : Fearless Relating Panel, Speed Flirting, and Vulnerability Circle : https://www.facebook.com/events/1560183870866497/ 
Thursday, April 2, 2015 at 7:00pm - 10:00pm : Navigating Successful Threeways with a live laboratory: AKA Phoenix's first threeway puja : https://www.facebook.com/events/1525744561008612/ 
Friday, April 3, 2015 at 6:00pm to Apr 5, 2015 at 5:00pm : Fearless Relating Weekend Intensive With Reid Mihalko & Monique Darling : https://www.facebook.com/events/1525109261101616/ 
Monique is the founder of Juicy Enlightenment which provides workshops and experiential play-shops in the art of Tantra and conscious loving. She has studied and taught with renowned Tantra teachers and extraordinary workshop facilitators since 1990 and is a certified Cuddle Party Facilitator. She has been featured on TLC and The Dr’s and has been interviewed by magazines across the USA. Monique is dedicated to empowering others utilizing her vast repertoire of cutting-edge teachings. She specializes in helping others reclaim their power and natural sensuality by transmuting fear and repression into courage, self-love and freedom. She guides from a place of understanding and her natural exuberance is infectious! She is available for private sessions, experiential workshops and Cuddle Parties. www.juicyenlightenment.com

description.text:
The Phoenix Squaw Peak Rotary Club was chartered December 12, 1986.  It was formed by a number of energetic men from all walks of life.  There were a number of people that came from other local Rotary clubs in an effort to build an active and committed club in the Squaw Peak area of Phoenix.
When the California Supreme Court ruled that women were to be included in possible Rotary membership, Squaw Peak took on the challenge with its normal gusto, admitting our first woman member in 1992. During that time of upheaval (not everyone in the Rotary organization was excited about this court decision), our club was tagged with the acronym RINO.  This usually derogative term was embraced and recreated to mean:

description.text: Join us for the Skeeter Mcfee tournament that benefits the many initiatives of the Phoenix Squaw Peak Rotary and with your help we can bring hope to local charities here in Phoenix. Most recently we have worked with Hacienda Health Care , a local charity that provides health services to  developmentally  disabled children and adults, and we have brought a wheel chair accessible swing and garden.

EZcertifications would like to present to you our upcoming 4 day PMP Boot Camp in: 
Location:  Phoenix, AZ 
Date: 30th Mar to 02sd Apr 2015  
This is an Instructor-led Classroom Training which will help you to prepare for the PMP examination conducted by PMI, USA.For your convenience, we conduct PMP Classroom Training every month!  If you can’t make this one, join us next month! 
Click here for our calendar of upcoming PMP Training Sessions 
About PMP: 
Project Management Institute’s (PMI)Management Professional (PMP) ®credential is one of the most important industry recognized certifications for Project Managers. Globally recognized and greatly in demand, having PMP® Certification demonstrates that you have experience, education and the competency to lead and direct complex projects at any level.This recognition is also seen through increased marketability to employers and higher salary levels. 
About EZcertifications: 
EZcertifications is a Global Education Provider in the area of professional certification courses. It provides high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission-critical areas of Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysis &Agile/Scrum. 
Enroll Now  Take advantage of our Classroom Training & world class e-learning content. 
Training Benefits provide by EZcertifications: 

4 Days of intense classroom training by an Experienced Certified Faculty Member
35 contact hours certificate satisfying a key prerequisite for the PMP® exam
 Hardcopy of PMP® – Handbook 
Hardcopy of PMBOK 5th Edition – An Exam Prep Study Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge, Fifth Edition, Project Management Institute, (2013)
Simulation Test (given on the last day)
90 days online access to our e-learning content - Approved by PMI, USA
Free access to Webinar classes conducted by seasoned Faculty Members
3 PMP Simulation Tests (600 PMP Questions)
PMP Exam Application Form assistance
Get Vital Support - through e-mail, online chat, telephone and webinars. 

We are a Global Registered Education Provider (Global REP) of PMI®in the area of professional certification courses.  We provide high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission critical areas of Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysisand Agile/Scrum. 
Enroll Today!  We Make It EZ For You!    Click Here for more information on our unique training programs.    For further queries please contact us Toll Free at 1-866-438-0220 
Kind Regards,  Kris Mohan, Training Manager,   Kris.mohan@ezcertifications.com   www.ezcertifications.com

Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM)®, is a certification provided by PMI, canad for the people who are new to the project management domain or having lesser years of experience in projects.  Whether you are new to project management, or already serving as a subject matter expert on project teams, the CAPM can get your career on the right path or take it to the next level.

Date: 30th Mar to 02sd Apr 2015

This is an Instructor-led Classroom Training which will help you to prepare for the PMP examination conducted by PMI, USA. For your convenience, we conduct PMP Classroom Training every month!  If you can’t make this one, join us next month!

Click here for our calendar of upcoming PMP Training Sessions

About PMP:

Project Management Institute’s (PMI)Management Professional (PMP) ®credential is one of the most important industry recognized certifications for Project Managers. Globally recognized and greatly in demand, having PMP® Certification demonstrates that you have experience, education and the competency to lead and direct complex projects at any level.This recognition is also seen through increased marketability to employers and higher salary levels.

About EZcertifications:

EZcertifications is a Global Education Provider in the area of professional certification courses. It provides high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission-critical areas of Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysis &Agile/Scrum.

Enroll Now  Take advantage of our Classroom Training & world class e-learning content.

Training Benefits provide by EZcertifications:

  • 4 Days of intense classroom training by an Experienced Certified Faculty Member
  • 35 contact hours certificate satisfying a key prerequisite for the PMP® exam
  •  Hardcopy of PMP® – Handbook
  • Hardcopy of PMBOK 5th Edition – An Exam Prep Study Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge, Fifth Edition, Project Management Institute, (2013)
  • Simulation Test (given on the last day)
  • 90 days online access to our e-learning content - Approved by PMI, USA
  • Free access to Webinar classes conducted by seasoned Faculty Members
  • 3 PMP Simulation Tests (600 PMP Questions)
  • PMP Exam Application Form assistance
  • Get Vital Support - through e-mail, online chat, telephone and webinars.

We are a Global Registered Education Provider (Global REP) of PMI®in the area of professional certification courses.  We provide high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission critical areas of Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysisand Agile/Scrum.

description.text:
EZcertifications would like to present to you our upcoming ITIL Certification Prep Training Workshop  
Location: Phoenix, AZ 
Date:Mar 30th -Apr 2nd- 2015 
This is an Instructor-led Classroom Training which will help you to prepare for the ITIL Foundation examination conducted by PMI, USA.  For your convenience, we conduct ITILFoundation Classroom Training every month!  If you can’t make it to this one, join us next month! 
Click here for our calendar of upcoming ITIL Foundation Training Sessions 
About ITIL Foundation Training: 
ITIL Foundation is one of the most widely adopted approaches, used globally by IT Service Management. It provides a practical, no-nonsense framework for identifying, planning, delivering and supporting IT services to any business.  Recognition of this credential also increases your professional marketability to employers and higher salary levels. 
The benefits of having ITIL Certification are: 
ü  Improves IT Services    
ü  Reduces Costs 
ü  Improves Customer Satisfaction           
ü  Improves Productivity. 
About EZcertifications: 
EZcertifications is a Global Education Provider in the area of Professional Certification Courses. We provide high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission-critical areas of Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysis & Agile/Scrum. 
Enroll Now Take advantage of our Classroom Training and World class e-learning content. 
Benefits of ITIL Foundation Training through EZCertifications: 
ü  High pass/success rate with Money-back Guarantee 
ü  2 days of Instructor-led classroom training 
ü  Examination on the 2nd day 
ü  APMG& CSME accredited Training Content 
ü  3 Months online access to our e-learning content 
ü  2 full length simulation tests 
ü  Earn 24 PDUs for PMP CCR 
Enroll Today!  We Make it EZ for You! 
Kind Regards,  Kris Mohan, Training Manager  Contact Us Toll Free:1- 866- 438-0220  Email: kris.mohan@ezcertifications.com  Website: www.ezcertifications.com.

description.text:
We understand and have personally experienced the challenges faced by business owners in the ever-changing marketplace. As a team we have over 90 years of combined experience in …Business Owners Experience Challenges in this Ever-changing Business Climate
- Starting, building, owning, optimizing and transitioning businesses across a broad array of industries.
- We have personally started our own businesses, held Board of Director positions, and have built small and large business units within international businesses in the U.S. and abroad.
With our diverse background, no business is too small or too large!
Honesty, integrity, fair play and commitment are at the core of how we do business. We are passionate about transforming the lives of our clients through transforming their businesses. We give back and contribute to our communities. By engaging the ActionCOACH Arizona Team, you will have access to the wisdom and real world experience of the entire team of seasoned business professionals so that you can achieve your business and personal goals and dreams. The ActionCOACH Arizona Team is committed to building the Arizona business community…We are Arizona Proud!
ActionCOACH is the world’s largest business coaching organization with more than 1200 coaches in over  50 countries. Through this relationship, we are now able to offer a full suite of business coaching and business consulting services to help companies grow both top and bottom line results.

We look forward to seeing you and guiding you towards greater success in business!

- Your ActionCOACH Team

description.text:
6 Steps to a Winning Business in 2015! Making Your Good Business... GREAT! 
  
Are you Ready for... 



- More Money
- Better Teams
- Increased Sales


- Improved Profits
- More Time
- Financial Freedom


- Boost in Revenue
- Successful Marketing
- Higher Returns


- Better Lifestyle
- Better Business
- More... Everything!



  
  
  
  
  
  
  

  This seminar will provide you with proven tools and systems that will IMMEDIATELY improve your business... day-one!  What You’ll Learn at during this seminar... 

How to work ON your business instead of IN your business
How to take immediate control of the time you spend at your business
How to turn your advertising and marketing into an investment instead of an expense
How to get back thousands of dollars in lost profits
How to recruit, motivate, educate, and retain exceptional employees
How to leverage your time to maximize efficiency and profits
How to systematize your business to provide consistent, exceptional customer service
How to get the quality of life that you started your business for in the first  place!

  
Come to the seminar and learn “6 Steps to a Winning and More Profitable Business.” 
You owe it to yourself to invest some of your time learning how your business can  reach its full potential.   
A light meal will be served. 
  
(Every 2nd & 4th Wednesday of the Month)

Energy, vision and focus for the next 90 days in your business

Powerful confidence, leadership and decision making skills
Ability take you and your business even further

description.text:
EZCertifications would like to present to you our upcoming 3 daysPMI-ACP (Agile Certified Practitioner) training in: 
Location:Phoenix, AZ 
Date: 30th Mar – 1st Apr 2015  
This is an Instructor-led Classroom Training which will help you to prepare for the PMI-ACP examination conducted by PMI, USA. For your convenience, we conduct PMI-ACP Classroom Training every month! If you can’t make this one, join us next month! 
Click here for our calendar of upcoming PMI-ACP Training Sessions 
About PMI-ACP: 
Agile methodology is a general approach to project management and product development, which has mainly been utilized in software development. Today, more and more organizations and companies are adopting the Agile Approach over the traditional Waterfall Methodology and many more are progressively making this essential transition.It is increasingly important that Project Management professionals demonstrate true leadership in today's software projects.In response to the growing relevance of Agile methodology for all Project Managers, the Project Management Institute (PMI®) has begun offering the Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP®) certification exam. This certification may be right for you if: 

You already use agile practices in your projects
Your organization is planning to adopt an agile approach 
You wish to become a more versatile project manager
You need to adapt more quickly to basic business needs
You would like to take a more value- and people-driven approach to projects
You want to advance your career as a project manager

About ezCertifications: 
ezCertifications is a Global Education Provider in the area of professional certification courses. About PMI-ACP:

Agile methodology is a general approach to project management and product development, which has mainly been utilized in software development. Today, more and more organizations and companies are adopting the Agile Approach over the traditional Waterfall Methodology and many more are progressively making this essential transition.It is increasingly important that Project Management professionals demonstrate true leadership in today's software projects.In response to the growing relevance of Agile methodology for all Project Managers, the Project Management Institute (PMI®) has begun offering the Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP®) certification exam. This certification may be right for you if:

  • You already use agile practices in your projects
  • Your organization is planning to adopt an agile approach
  • You wish to become a more versatile project manager
  • You need to adapt more quickly to basic business needs
  • You would like to take a more value- and people-driven approach to projects
  • You want to advance your career as a project manager

description.text:
Come run for fun! Strengthen public education in Flagstaff! BASIS Flagstaff will be hosting a 5K race in the foothils of the beautiful San Francico Peaks. Our course will mix forest paths and rural roads, on gently hilly terrain. At 7,000 feet, Flagstaff is a mecca for runners nation wide, who come to enjoy the mountain landscape, cool temperatures and thin air. There will be prizes, refreshments, games for the kids and more! For new and little runners, there will be a free, one mile pup-run. 
Money raised goes to support quality public education!

EZcertifications is a Global Education Provider in the area of professional certification courses. It provides high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission-critical areas of Big Data, Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysis & Agile/Scrum.

Enrol Now Take advantage of our Classroom Training & world class e-learning content.

Big Data &Hadoop Certification Course fromEZcertifications will help you to:

• Get certified on “Big Data and Hadoop”
• Master the concepts of Hadoop framework and its deployment in a cluster environment
• Process around 3.5 Billion Data points spanning across 8 Data sets with a high level of efficiency
• Understand Hadoop Architecture by understanding Hadoop Distribution File System operations principles (vHDFS 1.0 &vHDFS 2.0)
• Understand advance concepts of parallel processing in MapReduce1.0 (or MRv1) & MapReduce2.0 (or MRv2)
• Learn to write complex MapReduce programs in both MRv1 & MRv2 (Yarn)
• Learn high-level scripting frameworks Pig & Hive and perform data analytics using high level scripting language under Pig & Hive
• Have a good understanding of Ecosystem and its advance components like Flume, Apache Oozie workflow scheduler etc.
• Understand advance concepts Hadoop 2.0 : Hbase, Zookeeper and Sqoop
• Get hands-on experience in different configurations of Hadoop cluster, its optimization & troubleshooting
• Get a chance to work on 2 Real time Industry based Projects

description.text:
Should the church be involved in mercy ministry? 
  
Join us as we look at the foundations of gospel-centered mercy ministry. Our goal is helping you as a part of the local church to understand why we must be involved in mercy ministry and to rethink how it should look from a biblical standpoint. 
  
COST: $10 for lunch and training materials 
  
Each person in your group should pre-register on EventBrite  and bring the following: 

A Bible
Time dedicated for studying God's Word
$10 for lunch and training materials (if not prepaid through the EventBrite form)

  
CHF will provide: 

Snacks and lunch
Training booklet and materials
A planning template for establishing or enhancing the mercy ministry in your local church context

  
Check-in begins at 8:00 AM, with equipping sessions beginning promptly at 8:30 AM. For ministries interested in participating in the Food Pak ministry, we require participation at this training from the pastoral/elder leadership at the church.

description.text: The Trans-Sierra Club operates the Trans-Sierra Xtreme (TSX) Challenge, an annual series of guided 75 mile backpacking treks across Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks. The inspirational journey traverses some of the most remote regions of the Sierra Nevada before culminating with an ascent on Mt. Whitney (elev. 14,505 feet), the highest point in the lower 48 states.
description.html: The Trans-Sierra Club operates the Trans-Sierra Xtreme (TSX) Challenge, an annual series of guided 75 mile backpacking treks across Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks. The inspirational journey traverses some of the most remote regions of the Sierra Nevada before culminating with an ascent on Mt. Whitney (elev. 14,505 feet), the highest point in the lower 48 states.

description.text: Co-founders of the Trans-Sierra Xtreme Challenge Chris Casado and Mike Murphy are passionate about exploring the Sierra backcountry. They've spent countless summers camping in secluded lake basins, crossing high alpine passes, following rushing rivers and clibming majestic peaks.  Join chris for a digital presentation of their favorite trans-Sierra adventure, a week-long 75 mile journey across remote sections of Sequoia and Kings Canyon national parks to the summit of Mt. Whitney (14,505 ft).  Learn the nuts and bolts of preparing for a multiday backcontry trek including gear, permits, weather and safety considerations. Since 1983 this trek has inspired 100's throughout California. Find out how motivated individuals of all ages can safely and confidently venture into the rugged beauty and tranquility of the Sierra.

About PMI-ACP:

Agile methodology is a general approach to project management and product development, which has mainly been utilized in software development. Today, more and more organizations and companies are adopting the Agile Approach over the traditional Waterfall Methodology and many more are progressively making this essential transition.It is increasingly important that Project Management professionals demonstrate true leadership in today's software projects.In response to the growing relevance of Agile methodology for all Project Managers, the Project Management Institute (PMI®) has begun offering the Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP®) certification exam. This certification may be right for you if:

  • You already use agile practices in your projects
  • Your organization is planning to adopt an agile approach
  • You wish to become a more versatile project manager
  • You need to adapt more quickly to basic business needs
  • You would like to take a more value- and people-driven approach to projects
  • You want to advance your career as a project manager

About ezCertifications:

ezCertifications is a Global Education Provider in the area of professional certification courses. It provides high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission-critical areas of Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysis & Agile/Scrum.

Enroll Now Take advantage of our Classroom Training & world class e-learning content.

Training Benefits provide by ezCertifications:

ð  3 Days of classroom training with highly experienced Agile Coach

ð  PMI-ACP Handbook for exam preparation

ð  2 Mock PMI-ACP Simulation tests and review session

ð  Earn 21 PMI PDUs/Contact Hour certificate

ð  Identification of exam significance for each Agile topic and focus on real-world Agile project issues

ð  E-Learning access and offline reference material

ð  End-to-End support.

Learning Strategies and Post-Class Benefits:

Our unique, efficient and progressive certification training methodology allows PMI-ACP exam candidates to prepare and succeed in their first attempt. It comprises:

  • Complete knowledge transfer by highly experienced faculty through presentation, intermediate quizzes and Rapid-fire round on PMI-ACP Q/A.
  • Learning the entire Agile Lifecycle with real-world practical techniques!
  • Key PMI Learning Objectives needed to pass the PMI-ACP certification exam.
  • Designed to walk you through the Agile Lifecycle activities end to end.
  • Uses a Real World end to end example Software and Non Software project to maximum learning!
  • You walk away with valuable course material, handouts and cheat sheets to support you on your projects.

We are a Global Registered Education Provider (Global REP) of PMI®in the area of professional certification courses. We provide high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission critical areas of Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysisand Agile/Scrum.

Enroll Today! We Make It EZ For You!

Click Here for more Are information on our unique training programs.

For further queries please contact us Toll Free at 1-866-438-0220

Kind Regards,
Kris Mohan,
Training Manager,
Kris.mohan@ezcertifications.com

description.text:
TLS Weight Loss Solution Day 1 & 2 with Susan Pasqual, MSN, RN, CNSc, TLS Director of Field Development & Sales, Certified TLS Coach & Trainer, 2010 TLS Coach of the Year, 2012 NE Regional Top Coach, 2013 TLS Trainer of the Year, 2013 NE Region Coach of the Year. 
What is TLS Day 1 & Day 2 Training?  
Day 1:  $50 (guests and Clients are permitted and Welcomed!!) 
 Day 1 is all about weight loss. The only way to be a great coach- is to experience the system as your client would. The best way to start your TLS journey is to see the Big Picture of the whole system! $50 for a WHOLE day of Empowerment is an Awesome investment in your Quality of Life!!  We will take you through the Fact Factors and step by step. Step 1 Dieter Profile. Step 2 understanding Low GI and the TLS Guide. Step 3 navigating your weight loss support tool tlsSlim.com. Step 4 understanding TLS supplements to accelerate and maximize results. Step 5 exercise with tlsSlim.com tool Step 6 next steps and point of focus for the week. 
 Day 2: $50 (Unfranchise Owners Only)  Day 2 is ALL business!! Get ready to be Empowered AND Inspired to help people change their lives Physically AND Financially!!!  We will help you identify your TLS business goal, setting your plan and marketing.  * Understanding business model * Goals and Action Plan * 6 Steps to marketing TLS and common mistakes * TLS Business Tools * How to conduct initial consultation and FYF events * Understanding TLS labels and are you comparing apples to apples * Building your network through TLS * Coaches Next Steps... (New Hassle Free Coaching) 
  
Day 1:  
 Who is it for? 

Anyone that wants to learn more about the new TLS® program and anyone who is interested in losing weight
Guests welcome to attend (Everyone MUST register)
Cost is $50 per person

 Day 1 Agenda Overview  

Why we struggle with weight
Why the TLS® Weight Loss Solution is better
Weight Loss Profile (online/paper)
Menu options
Why TLS® Supplements work
Choosing the right TLS® Supplements
TLS® Weight Loss Guide
Setting health goals and starting Detox

 Navigating TLS® site for weight loss success  

Dashboard
Meal Planner
Exercise
Alerts, mobile apps and more resources!

 12 weeks of lifestyle tips 
Question & Answers 
 Summary of Day 1  
Day 2: (Day 2 is revamped from August 2014) 
Who is it for?  

Anyone that wants to learn how to be effective with sales
Those who want to be able to effectively discuss TLS and the competition
Those who would like to be able to effectively expand their team utilizing TLS™ system
Guests are NOT permitted to attend (you must be a distributor)
Cost is $50 per-person (MUST attend Day 1 first)

Day 2 Agenda Overview: 

Identifying Market Base and Business Structures
Knowing the TLS® materials
Approaches
Presentation
Close
Invitation Card (healthy night out events)
Supplement Details (highlighting TLS® products as compard to the competition)
Marketing Fundamentals
Social Media Basics
Marketing Do’s and Don’ts (legal)

12 week program syllabus  

Coaching Tips and Coach’s Dashboard

Introducing Additional Products to Support Your Clients 

Optimal Health (Omega III, B Complex, Greens, NutriClean, Digestive Enzymes, etc)

90 Day Action Plan  

Creating Fitness Goals
Creating Business Goals and Action Plan
Building an organization
Coaches Start Up Guide

Questions & Answers  
Summary of Day 2 
Next steps for TLS Professionals   
Day 1 & 2 training will be done by conducted Susan Pasqual  
 This Day 1 & Day 2 TLS® training is the first step in becoming a Certified TLS coach. For more information on benefits and requirements to become a CERTIFIED coach please check details on www.marketamericaevents.com. Day 1 & 2 tickets are non-refundable.  You may transfer a ticket after contacting your TLS trainer.

description.text:
FALA's first playwright-in-Residence, Dr. Kathleen B Jones, has constructed a compelling, vivid work loosely based on her work of nonfiction: Living Between Danger and Love. The Origin Of the Seasons focuses on a young woman student who is murdered by her boyfriend. This murder provokes a profesor to confront her own guilt about a traumatic loss in her past. Demeter and Persephone; Mother and Dauther; Connection and Loss: a story that shows how any woman can become victim to domestic violence. The performances feature a trio of muscians performing an original score. 
Join Kathleen, the cast, and Northland Family Help Center for panel discussions after both performances 
Contians mature language and situations.

description.text:
Kelly Vizzini is an energy healer and author of the newly released autobiography/self-help book called Are You Picking Up Your Messages. She is a Reiki Master, class instructor, nature photographer and does hand reflexology. In 2009, she began an exciting quest in learning about her self and a spiritual discovery. 
Kelly began working with Reiki in 2011 to see what effect it had on the essential tremor she had developed over twenty-one years previously. During her sessions with a practitioner, Kelly has noticed that the tremor has significantly decreased over time and became a Reiki Master in order to continue working on herself outside the sessions. In November 2013, she started her own energy healing practice with the focus of empowering others to find the courage to take control of their health and begin their own journeys with understanding the messages.  
To learn more about Kelly, click www.kellyvizzini.com

description.text:
Paradise Valley United Methodist Church (PVUMC) is pleased to announce the next concert in its Community Concert 2014-15 season. We invite you to join us for Bob Chilcott's Requiem, an ecumenical concert featuring the adult choirs of PVUMC and La Casa de Cristo Lutheran, on Friday, March 27 at 7 pm in the PVUMC Sanctuary.  
Come hear powerful music set to texts that have inspired composers for centuries. This modern-day requiem, first performed in 2010, has since been performed around the globe. Bob Chilcott was a member of the King Singers for 12 years, but is now primarily known for his musical compositions. The choirs will be accompanied by some of Phoenix's finest instrumentalists.  
Mark your calendar to come back on Friday, April 17 at 7 pm for Jazz at the Perk. Held outside (if the weather cooperates) on our beautiful and well-appointed patio outside the Paradise Perk, the church's own coffee shop, this is an evening that pairs great jazz with great coffee. We will feature some of Phoenix's top jazz musicians in a stunning setting. Come enjoy an Arizona sunset with jazz, coffee and friends. A movie for children will be playing inside the Fellowship Center, and we'll offer childcare for those who need it, with a 48-hour reservation.  
Our events are for all ages, and we welcome families. If you need childcare while attending the concert, we have free, on-site certified care in our Childcare Center for a limited number of children and infants. You must reserve childcare at least 48 hours in advance by calling 602-840-8360, ext 134. If you need to cancel your childcare reservation, even at the last minute, please call the number again. 
As with all our community concerts, there are no tickets or fees. We will take a free-will offering at the events in support of the concert series.  
Light snacks are available for purchase at the jazz concert, along with coffee, tea and smoothies at the Perk. We'll have a complementary dessert buffet after the Requiem. PVUMC is an acohol-free and smoke-free campus. 
Find out more about our church at http://pvumc.org/.

description.text:
My name is Joe Ramirez I am a marketing and events consultant and the owner of Contagious Social LLC. I live in Tucson, AZ and I would love to help you make MONEY!!
► Enroll in one of my courses today to save hundreds of hours learning the hard way like I did! ◄
What qualifies me to share my experience with you?
For four years, I have been an entrepreneur online working mostly with social and content marketing. I started with no experience, no clients, no networking, and no idea of what value I could give to the world.In these four years, I have managed thousands of ads on Facebook, found hundreds of clients in nearly every US state, Canadian province, and more than twenty countries. You can count on me to honestly share with you the best of what I have learned that works to build a company online especially with Facebook and Instagram!!In 2014, I have committed to learning to be one of the most influential internet marketers in the world on social media because I want you to have the same opportunities I have had to be successful and because you keep telling me that I should keep creating more for you! I have found a system that works exceptionally well to build Twitter followers which combined with my Facebook and Instagram experience gives me a klout score of 65 which is at minor celebrity level and on par with the most influential social media marketing and digital marketing professionals in the world. I also have learned how to drive huge amounts of organic Google and YouTube traffic to my websites every month. I teach these courses with the best of what I have learned that already works for me for you to use for yourself.What experience prepared me to be successful online?
I Studied Business Management at the University of ArizonaI Studied Strategic Marketing at Ryerson UniversityI have a Social Media Strategist Certification from Delaware Technical & Community CollegeI am an Army Veteran with experience in leading men and women in combat.And Lastly I have 3 kids and one being 14 years old :)➲ How can I best serve your success online? Try one of my courses today to find out or learn more about what I have online!
♦ 50+ videos on my YouTube channel share inspiration and information you can use to get great results with Facebook ads, YouTube channels, and inbound marketing.♦ 100+ blog posts on my website give detailed instructions on how to use Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest, and your website to make money online.
♦ 25+ podcasts episodes on iTunes will speed up you're learning while you are on the go.

In 2014, I have committed to learning to be one of the most influential internet marketers in the world on social media because I want you to have the same opportunities I have had to be successful and because you keep telling me that I should keep creating more for you! I have found a system that works exceptionally well to build Twitter followers which combined with my Facebook and Instagram experience gives me a klout score of 65 which is at minor celebrity level and on par with the most influential social media marketing and digital marketing professionals in the world. I also have learned how to drive huge amounts of organic Google and YouTube traffic to my websites every month. I teach these courses with the best of what I have learned that already works for me for you to use for yourself.
What experience prepared me to be successful online?

I Studied Business Management at the University of Arizona
I Studied Strategic Marketing at Ryerson University
I have a Social Media Strategist Certification from Delaware Technical & Community College
I am an Army Veteran with experience in leading men and women in combat.
And Lastly I have 3 kids and one being 14 years old :)
➲ How can I best serve your success online? Try one of my courses today to find out or learn more about what I have online!

♦ 50+ videos on my YouTube channel share inspiration and information you can use to get great results with Facebook ads, YouTube channels, and inbound marketing.
♦ 100+ blog posts on my website give detailed instructions on how to use Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest, and your website to make money online.

♦ 25+ podcasts episodes on iTunes will speed up you're learning while you are on the go.

description.text:
We are swiftly becoming an overly visual society. The old saying “A picture is worth 1000 words,” will need to be adjusted to today’s social media world. “A picture is worth 1000 words, 1000 likes and 1000 comments.” The visual side of social media really exploded when people used rotten e-cards and funny pics on Facebook. From there we got used to taking pictures of what we see, posting it along with our input. This is the norm in today’s social media but just 13 months ago it was not.   If you know people enjoy looking at photos enough for Facebook to pay $1.8Billion for Instagram and you know there are over 200 million users on Instagram, its time you put your listings on there. Its simple to put a home for sell on Instagram. You take the photos you have, upload them to Instagram on your phone, and in the photo description describe the home and leave a link to the website they can find out more info about the home. 
What will you learn from this course-  
How to sell Real Estate on Instagram is a must attend for any realtor looking to expand their network and sell more properties. This course provides detailed knowledge about how to attract clients and grow your network through Instagram to sell more properties and gain new leads and customers.    
Through hands on step-by-step instructions and real-life examples, you will learn how to use and master the Instagram mobile app, create content that your audience will love, attract and maintain a strong Instagram following, and how to track your progress.  
If you want to learn how to take amazing photos and videos of your real estate properties and harness the power of Instagram then this is course is for you. 
  
There is only 15 seats available book yours now.  
  
Cannot make the training then click here to take the course online :) 
  
I look forward to meeting you, 
Joe Ramirez 
520-406-2201 
CEO Contagious Social LLC

description.text:
(Peter) Moshe Loth is a holocaust survivor who was born in Stutthof Concentration Camp to his imprisoned Jewish Mother. Having lived through great tribulation, pain, and brokenness, Mr. Loth is able to communicate an outlook on life that is inspiring and life-changing. Regardless of religion, race, or creed; whether one is rich or poor, educated or not, his story has the ability to break even the hardest of hearts. 
For other CAC Events, visit the CAC Calendar. 
For On-Campus directions Click Here!!!! 
Make CAC your destination for the evening! Enjoy dinner in our Dining Hall’s All-You-Can-Eat Buffet. Show your ticket for a 20% discount. Dining Hall hours are M-Th from 4:45 p.m.to 7:00 p.m., and F, S from 4:45 p.m. to 6:15 p.m. Discount valid for same day as your Show Ticket.

description.text:
We are excited to have a Birthday Bash to celebrate 20 years of Sun Valley Animal Shelter on Sunday, March 22nd, 2015 with our 2nd Annual Sun Valley Animal Shelter Pet Expo. 
  
We have over 50 booths. Rescues of almost every kind, from big dogs to little dogs, cats, hamsters, birds and even sugar gliders will be there. Make sure to visit the MCSO Mash unit. Adopt a new friend, whether it is a dog, a cat, a hamster, a bird or whatever you love, at our event. 
  
Admission and parking are free. We do encourage you to bring a monetary donation to give to the rescue or charity of your choice. Help support our local rescues and charities and all of the good work they do to help those that need it most. 
  
Sun Valley Animal Shelter, the West Valley’s premier non-profit animal shelter, provides leadership and education to the community on animal welfare issues. SVAS is committed to cooperating with other area organizations dedicated to the rescue and care of homeless animals and to achieving humane solutions to the problem of pet overpopulation. SVAS is determined to reduce euthanasia rates by increasing pet adoptions, foster respect for animals and the responsibility of pet guardianship, and provide community awareness of the need to eliminate animal suffering due to abuse, neglect and ignorance.

description.text:
Pima Community College-East Campus invites you to a special presentation by José Galvez . Galvez is a Pulitzer prize winning photo journalist who documented César Chavez during the farmworker movement.  Over many years Galvez has delighted audiences with his stories of struggle and triumph. His photographic/lecture presentations combine history, culture, and image. "Shine" looks back at José's  beginnings as a shoeshine boy who wandered into the newsroom. 
When: Thursday March 26, 2015  2:00pm Where: Pima Community College-East Campus    Community room              8181 E Irvington Rd, Tucson AZ This event is free and open to the public. 
Light refreshments provided. 
Questions?  Email us at EC-studentlife@pima.edu

If you LOVE to travel, then you just might LOVE being an insider and travel the world like a rock star as a travel professional. Contact us today to find out how.

description.text: "There's always pressure, from other people and yourself. If you're happy with the looks you're born with, then what are you going to do your whole life? We keep thinking up new things and finding better ways of doing things because we're not happy with what we're given." -- Natalie Portman  "There's one advantage to being 102. There's no peer pressure." -- Dennis Wolfberg  There are two ways to participate in this all-ages event:  1) Watch people tell true stories 2) Sign-up and tell your own story.  Every Wednesday, 8pm, Lawn Gnome Publishing invites storytellers to prepare a 5 to 8 minute, first-person story on the theme, addressing it literally or metaphorically in the tradition of The Moth or stories that could be heard on NPR's This American Life.  Our storyteller's mic is graciously hosted by Dan Hull, a long time Phoenix comic who developed a love for New York's storytelling scene, and dreamed of seeing a Phoenix with a story to tell.  This event is $5, all-ages, and uncensored. Adult language and themes may be present.
description.html:
"There's always pressure, from other people and yourself. If you're happy with the looks you're born with, then what are you going to do your whole life? We keep thinking up new things and finding better ways of doing things because we're not happy with what we're given."
-- Natalie Portman

"There's one advantage to being 102. There's no peer pressure." -- Dennis Wolfberg

There are two ways to participate in this all-ages event:

1) Watch people tell true stories 2) Sign-up and tell your own story.

Every Wednesday, 8pm, Lawn Gnome Publishing invites storytellers to prepare a 5 to 8 minute, first-person story on the theme, addressing it literally or metaphorically in the tradition of The Moth or stories that could be heard on NPR's This American Life.

Our storyteller's mic is graciously hosted by Dan Hull, a long time Phoenix comic who developed a love for New York's storytelling scene, and dreamed of seeing a Phoenix with a story to tell.

This event is $5, all-ages, and uncensored. Adult language and themes may be present.

Five Dollars.   Kid Dynamite Band 9:00 - 955  Hailing from Boomtown, Arizona, former member and leader of the great “Toomstoners” , Scary Gary Ammann, teamed up with former member of “The Four Jays”, Jarrod Compton (Kid Dynamite) to create a vintage, but somehow fresh interpretation of the rock n’ roll genre. Forming in October of 2012, Scary Gary and the Kid faced a continuous search for a reliable bass player. Then falling into the palm of their hands was the very close high school friend of the Kid, Jeff Davis (Detonator). His bass playing brought a different sound to the material that they started writing together. Today, “Kid Dynamite and The Blast” are in production of their first coming release ‘The Inferno Sessions’. This EP will include the popular singles ‘Too Little Too Late’ as well as ‘Funk You!’  The EP has no said release date at this time.  www.youtube.com/kdandblast   Audious 7:50 - 8:50 https://www.facebook.com/audiousband/app_178091127385  Blithed 7:15 - 7:45 https://www.facebook.com/Blithed

Section 3 - Dealing with the Stress During Divorce           by Gabrielle Loomis, Certified Clinical Trauma Professional

description.text:
A two-part seminar on developing confidence and style for your business blog.  Business owners know the importance of blogging, but too many of us are reluctant to create and maintain a business blog. People often draw a complete blank when they think about writing a blog post. While the most common reason given is “I just don’t have the time,” in fact behind this excuse are real reasons that keep us from expressing ourselves with confidence.  This two-part seminar will teach you to overcome your reluctance by helping you to define your own style and voice when representing your business. What do you need to know to blog with confidence? 
We'll cover: 

Composition
Where to get ideas
Proofreading
Storytelling

Presented by Josephine Levy 
Josephine's work involves researching, communicating, and crafting media content to consistently connect individuals and businesses to their social media communities. Her MA in English provides the foundation to see the big picture in developing the genuine online narratives that tell the stories that need to be told. Her background includes teaching both literature and composition.

description.text:
Are you brand new to essential oils and wanting to learn more about how to incorporate them into your family's life?   
Do you have some essential oils but have no idea what to do with them? 
Did you sign up for a Premium Starter Kit but are still unsure?  
This class is for you! We will cover the basics of how to use your oils safely. How to diffuse, what the oils are for and so much more! 
Essential Oils can be used for immune boosting, sick care, emotional support, focus, sleeping, first aid...you name it! You will leave this class feeling much more confident with your oils. Or if you are brand new, you will leave feeling ready to start your oily journey!! 
This event is ONLINE!  Simply click the youtube link to join the class! 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pjn6zsICCxA

description.text:
Unplugged Wine Bar will kick off its new & exclusive wine tasting series "Meet The Importer" and have the opportunity to buy the wine below retail price. Yes, for the first time ever Unplugged Wine Bar brings in its most important importer of French wines… If you share the philosophy of supporting small producers and would like to get a wonderful insight into what makes them so special, please swing by in-between 6pm and 8pm on Monday, March 23rd 2015.  
For $5 plus an online fee or for $10 at the door, you will taste five amazing French wines accompanied by Unplugged's signature appetizer platter. And to top it off; all wines in tasting will be available way below retail pricing!  
 Click here to see wine description and pricing.
