description.text:
The glow of first love is magnificent, and something to celebrate fully. But over time, our own personal issues again rise to the surface, and start to breakdown the closeness of our connections. One of the main reasons this happens is our inability to self process, and help our loved ones do the same. We become consumed with our own triggers, and eventually, we may start to blame our partners for the pain we are feeling. 
But there is a cure! We can first learn to self soothe, and then be present to soothe others. As we get more skilled, amazingly, we can take it a step further, and actually get turned on by the emotions, or disturbances of our lovers. We can get to the point that every tension, every conflict, every misunderstanding, could end in hot sex! Wow! 
Join Seva Khalsa, and Monique Darling for a special afternoon, filled with our favorite black belt tricks and tips for self acceptance AND the acceptance of others. Throughout the evening you will see demonstrations of techniques, then get to practice them on one another with delicious exercises. You will gain new reference points for just how good you can feel in your body, in a "safe" container, where ALL of you is welcome, and nothing is expected or required. You will leave with a genuine boost of empathy, a radical relating strategy, increased self understanding, and a juicy connectedness that you can gift to everyone else in your life!! 
Great question that came up from the last class: What do you do if you are so triggered that you leave your body! We will welcome all such questions, and look forward to your unique interests and needs. 
Love exchange $25 single $40 per pair Please Reserve your spot https://www.facebook.com/events/313010755574495/ 
Join us for all our yummy Arizona events: 
Monday, March 30, 2015 at 7:00pm - 10:00pm : Your Emotions Make Me Hard Part 3 : https://www.facebook.com/events/313010755574495/ 
Tuesday, March 31, 2015 at 7:00pm - 10:00pm : Enchantment Ceremony with Monique Darling : https://www.facebook.com/events/276820735774973/ 
Wednesday, April 1, 2015 at 7:00pm - 10:30pm : Fearless Relating Panel, Speed Flirting, and Vulnerability Circle : https://www.facebook.com/events/1560183870866497/ 
Thursday, April 2, 2015 at 7:00pm - 10:00pm : Navigating Successful Threeways with a live laboratory: AKA Phoenix's first threeway puja : https://www.facebook.com/events/1525744561008612/ 
Friday, April 3, 2015 at 6:00pm to Apr 5, 2015 at 5:00pm : Fearless Relating Weekend Intensive With Reid Mihalko & Monique Darling : https://www.facebook.com/events/1525109261101616/ 
About your facilitators: 
Seva Khalsa, BS, CM 
Seva's work combines the transcendental nature of Yoga and Tantra, with the practical emotional movement of Counseling and Rebirthing. Seva was lucky enough to train in White Tantra for 20 years with Mahan Tantra Yogi Bhajan, when he still taught in person. Teaching Kundalini Yoga for 15 years has also given Seva a psychic energy awareness and presence that is both penetrating and healing. Intuitive Touch, Attention, and Unconditional Love, developed over 10 years of Counseling practice, NonViolent Communication, and Pelvic-Heart Integration, guide Seva to support the change, growth, transformation, and healing that clients need. Seva is particularly focused on issues relating to couples, such as Communication, Power Struggles, and Sexual Satisfaction. Total Acceptance allows female clients to feel comfortable enough to explore their deepest issues, with a male figure. Seva is dedicated to the Healing Arts and is the founder of Love and Sex Mastery, helping people live happier and more effective lives. Seva's name means selfless service. He looks forward to serving you! 
BS, Psychology Certified Meditator Kundalini Yoga Teacher, 15+ years Ashtanga Yoga Teacher, 2+ years White Tantra practitioner, 20+ years Over ten years of practice and trainings in Co-Counseling, Nonviolent Communication, Rebirthing, Holotropic Breathwork, Tantra, and Pelvic-Heart Integration (Postural Integration) 3000+ Counseling sessions, both peer and professional Thai Massage, Level 1 Certified Certified Daka, ISTA, International School of Temple Arts 600+ Sex Coaching and Sexual Healing sessions 
Relationship History: One 14 year monogamous marriage with two children One 7 year nonmonogamous relationship One 5 year nonmonogamous relationship Current: 6 years into best-ever polyamorous relationship with primary partner 
Seva's website: http://www.loveandsexmastery.com/ 
Monique Darling, San Diego, CA, Authenticity and Vulnerability Coach, is the founder of Juicy Enlightenment which provides workshops and experiential play-shops in the art of Tantra, Compassionate communication, and conscious loving. She has studied and taught with renowned Tantra teachers and extraordinary workshop facilitators since 1990 and is a certified Cuddly Party Facilitator. She has been featured on TLC and The Dr’s and has been interviewed by magazines across the USA. Monique is dedicated to empowering others utilizing her vast repertoire of cutting-edge teachings. She specializes is helping others reclaim their power and natural sensuality by transmuting fear and repression into courage, self-love and freedom. She guides from a place of understanding and her natural exuberance is infectious! She is available for private sessions, experiential workshops and Cuddle Parties. Learn more about Monique by going to www.juicyenlightenment.com

description.text:
This is the ultimate 101 class if you've wanted to learn HOW to actually use DoTERRA Essential Oils! Yolanda will be walking us through each individual oil included in the Family Physician Kit & how you can implement them in your home.  
Learn about Essential Oils and how to effectively incorporate them into your daily life. They are not just for aromatherapy - Be amazed how simple it is to use oils and be your own healer. 
Have you ever wanted to try an alternative to medications and to avoid their adverse side effects? Are you looking for natural solutions for your children? Are you interested in holistic medicine for your health care but don't know what to do or where to start? Join us and learn more about what essential oils are best for your body and how you can use them to improve your whole health, body, mind and spirit. Learn about how essential oils can help with issues such as migraines, pain and inflammation, stress, weight, digestive issues, sleep problems and so much more! 
The Family Physician kit is available for pre-order & will be at the class for you to pick up! Included in this ticket price will be a FREE 5 ml. Wild Orange as well as your doTERRA wholesale membership good for the entire year! That's 12 oils for one low price, just by pre-ordering + attending the class!  
  
Bonus...Bring a firend and recieve a free gift.

description.text: Formerly the Feminine Project music showcase, now Az Soul Sessions, we are an upcoming exclusive music showcase highlighting soul, R&B, jazz, and alternative artists. The focus is talent local to Glendale ,Arizona but will be opening it's doors to touring artists wishing to thrive on the developing music scene. Glendale (home to R&B star, Cece Peniston) has not always been known for soul music however is experiencing a rise of interest with the Az Jazz Festival bringing jazz and neo-soul stars every quarter to nearby Litchfield Park,Az and Phoenix. Az Soul Sessions (currently held at Sevens Lounge in Glendale) has a house band, great ambiance, two full rooms and two stages, as well as a green room for artists to relax before hitting the stage.

description.text:
Interested in a career at the hottest startup in the tech industry? If so, keep reading…  Zenefits is hosting a hiring event for its inaugural Associate Benefits Advisor (ABA) team in downtown Scottsdale. We are in hyper growth - now at 800 employees, up from just 20 in January 2014 - and we're looking for hungry, driven people to lead our next phase of growth. Join us for an opportunity to meet senior members and see if Zenefits is a great fit for your future career!  Our ABAs will be part of our first ever Broker University in Scottsdale for one month before diving into a client facing role starting this June. In Broker University, we will teach how to master all things insurance and benefits-related including (but certainly not limited to) how to manage new accounts, assist with renewals and open enrollments, and advise clients. Zenefits will also pay for insurance licensing fees so you can become a licensed agent! This is a fantastic opportunity for a new college grad to gain unparalleled hands-on, client experience and launch a career at the fastest growing SaaS startup ever. 
But what’s Zenefits? We are a tech company, but what we do ultimately affects people's health, not to mention their wallets. We need someone who cares about the problems and concerns of each and every one of our clients' employees. We also seek someone who is excited to innovate an archaic industry, while thoroughly enjoying happy hours, office pets, and witty banter.  
Awesome; what are the next steps?? Check out the job posting below and submit an application in addition to RSVPing (there are limited spots!) We will reach out ASAP if this is a great fit. 
http://bit.ly/ABA-spring2015 
In the meantime, check out the links below to see why Zenefits is so awesome: 
1. http://www.forbes.com/sites/briansolomon/2014/12/17/how-zenefits-beat-out-uber-airbnb-to-become-2014s-hottest-startup/  
2. http://www.bizjournals.com/phoenix/blog/techflash/2014/11/exclusive-zenefits-expands-to-scottsdale-plans-to.html

We are in hyper growth - now at 800 employees, up from just 20 in January 2014 - and we're looking for hungry, driven people to lead our next phase of growth. Join us for an opportunity to meet senior members and see if Zenefits is a great fit for your future career!

Our ABAs will be part of our first ever Broker University in Scottsdale for one month before diving into a client facing role starting this June. In Broker University, we will teach how to master all things insurance and benefits-related including (but certainly not limited to) how to manage new accounts, assist with renewals and open enrollments, and advise clients. Zenefits will also pay for insurance licensing fees so you can become a licensed agent! This is a fantastic opportunity for a new college grad to gain unparalleled hands-on, client experience and launch a career at the fastest growing SaaS startup ever.

But what’s Zenefits? We are a tech company, but what we do ultimately affects people's health, not to mention their wallets. We need someone who cares about the problems and concerns of each and every one of our clients' employees. We also seek someone who is excited to innovate an archaic industry, while thoroughly enjoying happy hours, office pets, and witty banter. 

Awesome; what are the next steps?? Check out the job posting below and submit an application in addition to RSVPing (there are limited spots!) We will reach out ASAP if this is a great fit.

http://bit.ly/ABA-spring2015

In the meantime, check out the links below to see why Zenefits is so awesome:

1. http://www.forbes.com/sites/briansolomon/2014/12/17/how-zenefits-beat-out-uber-airbnb-to-become-2014s-hottest-startup/ 

2. http://www.bizjournals.com/phoenix/blog/techflash/2014/11/exclusive-zenefits-expands-to-scottsdale-plans-to.html

description.text:
(This is not a bicycle maintenance class.  Also, there will be no bicycle riding in this class.)
Learn how to bicycle safely and legally in traffic. 
This fast-paced hybrid class features: 

rules of the road
campus and community cycling resources
bicycle and helmet safety checks -but you don't need equipment to attend
2 hours of meeting in class and 3 hours of online instruction

  
Must complete the 3 hours of online instruction by Friday, March 20th.  
We will be indoors for most of class, but please be prepared to be outside for roughly 30 minutes as we assess everyone's gear.  (If you do not have any bicycle equipment yet and are curious about bicycling and what gear is right for you, then please still come!  We are here to help.) 
It is highly recommended students bring their (good riding condition) bicycle to class.  Helmets will be provided if needed.  We will not ride bicycles in this class, but it is recommended students bring gear as though we were going to.  
This class has a minimum of 6 students.  If 6 students haven't signed up by the end of the day on Friday ,March 20th then the class will be canceled.  On-line test scores will be honored for future classes. 
Traffic Skills 101 is a bicycle education class created by the League of American Bicyclists.  It is a prerequisite to taking the LCI (League Certified Instructor) Seminar.  ASU has divided the class into 4 parts.  Each part must be passed to sequentially move onto the next one.  However, the parts can each be signed up for at any time and no student must take all 4 (unless, of course, they would like to successfully complete Traffic Skills 101).

description.text: Founded in 2001 via a grant from the U.S. Department of Education, The American Board is a 501(c)3 nonpartisan, nonprofit organization that addresses the need for knowledgeable and dedicated teachers in every classroom. Through an innovative and affordable certification program, The American Board provides a pathway to educator licensure in twelve states and a local solution for schools seeking to recruit highly qualified teachers from within the community. Career-changers that hold a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution are pre-qualified to start the American Board program, which provides the essential classroom management and subject-area training for teachers to be successful.

description.text:
Join The Arizona Teaching Prep and learn more about how you can change careers and become a certified teacher in Arizona. 
Are you unemployed, or unhappy with your current job? Are you seeking an opportunity to build a rewarding career? If you want to use your skills and expertise to make a difference in your community, AND build a fulfilling, lasting career, then you should consider becoming a teacher 
Approved by the AZ State Department of Education, the American Board is a nonprofit organization that helps qualified professionals become certified to teach. The American Board program provides an affordable and accessible route to teacher certification for career changers, working professionals, veterans, college graduates, and other qualified individuals. Through the American Board, you can become certified to teach in any of the following subjects: Mathematics, Biology, Chemistry, General Science, Physics, and English Language Arts. 
The Arizona Teaching Prep program is self-paced, and offered online, so you can work on the program on your own time, at your own pace. 
Come to a local event to learn more about the opportunity to teach with an Arizona Teaching Prep certification. A representative will be holding information sessions in your community to discuss ID teacher certification and to help you get started with your career in the classroom. 
 
Attendees will have the opportunity to: 

Meet with an Idaho Teacher Certification Specialist
Explore exam preparation materials
Enroll in the American Board program
Receive exclusive savings on the American Board program

Sessions are FREE and open to the public. 
Dates and Times are subject to change. For up to date information Call 1-877-669-2228 (Option 1) or email contact@abcte.org.

description.text:
Muchas gracias por desear participar en la conferencia ONE. Estamos muy contentos por nuestro conferencista y los talleres que podemos ofrecer para la gloria de Dios y el fortalecimiento de su iglesia. Nuestra conferencia principal y la sesión de preguntas y respuestas será en vivo en Temecula, y transmitida simultáneamente en Ripon, CA y Glendale, AZ. 
La matrícula individual cuesta $49. Si otros miembros de su congregación están participando en la conferencia, recibirán un descuento y la matrícula es de $39. Para recibir el descuento, por favor ingrese arriba el código de promoción “ONECHURCH”. 
A través de registrarme para esta conferencia, autorizo a los ministerios de Asuntos de Discapacidad de la Iglesia Cristiana Reformada y la Iglesia Reformada en América a grabar mi nombre, imagen y voz en esta conferencia. Autorizo también al ministerio de Asuntos de Discapacidad a utilizar la grabación, video y audio, película y fotografía o cualquier parte de la misma a usar mi nombre, imagen y voz para la publicidad o promoción sin obtenerr pago o compensación por este uso.

description.text:
Do you want to play CASHFLOW 101 live with a group? 
  We're a local team of Real Estate Investors that host CASHFLOW to raise financial intelligence in our communities. 
  The board game is a simulation of real life. It teaches you: 
•How to Manage your money •How Financial Statements work •Why CASHFLOW is the single most important word in business 
Do You Want an Unfair Advantage? 
By playing the board game more than once, you will: 
•Understand the true difference between an Asset and a Liability •Understand financial jargon used by Financial Advisors •Know how to ask the right questions •Know the difference between good financial advice and bad financial advice •Understand how to control taxes, debt, inflation and retirement 
We're looking forward to helping you get out the rat race! 
#cashflow101 #robertkiyosaki #getouttheratrace #financialfreedom #fasttrack #realestate

https://sit.etrade.com/e/t/jumppage/viewjumppage?PageName=Retirement_Day

EZcertifications: 
EZcertifications is a Global Education Provider in the area of professional certification courses. It provides high quality and cost-effective training solutions to meet individual and organizational training requirements in mission-critical areas of Big Data, Project Management, IT Service Management, Information Security, Enterprise Architecture, Business Analysis & Agile/Scrum. 
Enrol Now Take advantage of our Classroom Training & world class e-learning content.    Big Data &Hadoop Certification Course fromEZcertifications will help you to:    • Get certified on “Big Data and Hadoop”  • Master the concepts of Hadoop framework and its deployment in a cluster environment  • Process around 3.5 Billion Data points spanning across 8 Data sets with a high level of efficiency  • Understand Hadoop Architecture by understanding Hadoop Distribution File System operations principles (vHDFS 1.0 &vHDFS 2.0)  • Understand advance concepts of parallel processing in MapReduce1.0 (or MRv1) & MapReduce2.0 (or MRv2)  • Learn to write complex MapReduce programs in both MRv1 & MRv2 (Yarn)  • Learn high-level scripting frameworks Pig & Hive and perform data analytics using high level scripting language under Pig & Hive  • Have a good understanding of Ecosystem and its advance components like Flume, Apache Oozie workflow scheduler etc.  • Understand advance concepts Hadoop 2.0 : Hbase, Zookeeper and Sqoop  • Get hands-on experience in different configurations of Hadoop cluster, its optimization & troubleshooting  • Get a chance to work on 2 Real time Industry based Projects    Enrol Today! • Have a good understanding of Ecosystem and its advance components like Flume, Apache Oozie workflow scheduler etc.
• Understand advance concepts Hadoop 2.0 : Hbase, Zookeeper and Sqoop
• Get hands-on experience in different configurations of Hadoop cluster, its optimization & troubleshooting
• Get a chance to work on 2 Real time Industry based Projects

Register Now for this exclusive Real Estate Event and see if Investing in Real Esate is really for you, attend a free 2hr real estate investing orientation and learn how you can achieve success trough Real Estate, working side by side with our national network of investors.   
Also, Learn about the dual-income opportunity available through our marketing and educational systems.  

You can join our national network of real estate investors, get trained at local events and workshops sponsored by leaders and community members so you can invest in real estate yourself or with us.

Investing Real Estate is a Team Sport and We Believe that to be successfull on your investments you have to Educate yourself first in order to achieve Success. 
When YOU have an Educated and Structured team to work within your local area, then you can accomplish so Much More as a team.   
Whether you like real estate or not, and you might not realize that you already are a real estate investor.  Our Local Events across the country give you the opportunity to network with like-minded entrepreneurs looking to maximize their earning potential. At this orientation, we will show you 

How our Real Estate Education program is unmatched in the industry.
A plan that has assisted our associates in over a million dollars in controlled assets.
Our INTERSHIP PROGRAM Earn While Learn and be involved in our Projects
A working business model where you can work side by side with Local Investors
How you could be done interviewing for jobs for the rest of your life and comprehensively teach your children how to BE the same!

No Muscle or Experience Needed! 
Get Motivated, Get Educated, and Get Compensated!! 
CHANGE YOUR FINANCIAL FUTURE, Register Above!

We are serious about what we do, who we work with, and we want to make sure you are serious too. If you need immediate assistance, please use the contact link above.

description.text: ATTN: ALL Roller Skaters Both New And Old School:      Remember Roller Skating? Do you like retro 80's Music? Love to skate and meet new people? Tired of overcrowded public skating sessions geared for kids?      Then Our Weekly Adults Only Private Skate Session is for YOU!! RSVP for the Advanced Rhythm Skate every Tuesday starting on July 8th, 2014! Adults Only 18+ Private Party!      The Advanced Rhythm Skate is for adults only 18+, and features retro 80's to present skating songs that are played by professional DJ's... With 4 Hours of continuous awesome skating music, and adults only... this private session is sure to please intermediate to advanced skaters!      By attending this weekly private event, you could even win $700 Riedell skates and awesome prizes monthly ....       Over 50 intermediate to advanced rhythm skaters confirmed in the first 48 hours that they're coming to this private Tuesday night event....        When: July 8th 2014, from 8PM to 12AM    Where? Great Skate 10054 N 43rd Ave Glendale AZ     Cost: $10        Why is this session different? This is your chance to interact with adults only skaters... Get back in shape or even just make new friends.... while skating to the best retro 80's music in town...       Plus by attending the grand opening rhythm skate session, you can also become a VIP with even more prizes. Simply be one of the 1st 12 PEOPLE to show up for the first 3 groundbreaking sessions!! and get a free advanced rhythm skate t-shirt (limited supply) ...       Are you coming? if you are great... To RSVP get on the VIP list by taking a short skate survey....       Here's how long the survey takes... Average Survey Time Results From Survey Monkey: Avg. Time Spent: 00:04:28 (approx. 4 Minutes!)      https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/PDJ293C      Of course, the survey is (optional)... but by giving your feedback and attending the opening night, you could win $700 Riedell skates at our drawing held sometime in Oct-December 2014!      Next, simply "Complete Your RSVP"... by clicking the "JOIN" link here:       https://www.facebook.com/events/596119140507004/?context=create&ref_dashboard_filter=calendar&source=49

ATTN: ALL Roller Skaters Both New And Old School:


Remember Roller Skating? Do you like retro 80's Music? Love to skate and meet new people? Tired of overcrowded public skating sessions geared for kids?


Then Our Weekly Adults Only Private Skate Session is for YOU!! RSVP for the Advanced Rhythm Skate every Tuesday starting on July 8th, 2014! Adults Only 18+ Private Party!


The Advanced Rhythm Skate is for adults only 18+, and features retro 80's to present skating songs that are played by professional DJ's... With 4 Hours of continuous awesome skating music, and adults only... this private session is sure to please intermediate to advanced skaters!


By attending this weekly private event, you could even win $700 Riedell skates and awesome prizes monthly ....


Over 50 intermediate to advanced rhythm skaters confirmed in the first 48 hours that they're coming to this private Tuesday night event....



When: July 8th 2014, from 8PM to 12AM

Where? Great Skate 10054 N 43rd Ave Glendale AZ

Cost: $10



Why is this session different? This is your chance to interact with adults only skaters... Get back in shape or even just make new friends.... while skating to the best retro 80's music in town...


Plus by attending the grand opening rhythm skate session, you can also become a VIP with even more prizes. Simply be one of the 1st 12 PEOPLE to show up for the first 3 groundbreaking sessions!! and get a free advanced rhythm skate t-shirt (limited supply) ...


Are you coming? if you are great... To RSVP get on the VIP list by taking a short skate survey....


Here's how long the survey takes... Average Survey Time Results From Survey Monkey: Avg. Time Spent: 00:04:28 (approx. 4 Minutes!)


https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/PDJ293C


Of course, the survey is (optional)... but by giving your feedback and attending the opening night, you could win $700 Riedell skates at our drawing held sometime in Oct-December 2014!


Next, simply "Complete Your RSVP"... by clicking the "JOIN" link here:


https://www.facebook.com/events/596119140507004/?context=create&ref_dashboard_filter=calendar&source=49

description.text:
BUSINESS COACHING | CONVERSE-OVER-COFFEE 
  
Starting and running a small business can be challenging for the novice.  Has your start-up journey been encumbered by difficult roadblocks that are hindering your business growth?  Do you need advice on how to overcome those business challenges?  Do you need help bringing your ideas, goals and talents together or coming up with new strategies?  Well, let me help you break down those barriers.  Get you moving in the right direction...What if I let you "PICK MY BRAIN?" 
Investing in YOURSELF is investing in your BUSINESS.  Talking through the decisions that you have to make with someone who has figured out the simplest and least expensive way to unlock new opportunities and explore new possibilities that allows you to get the maximum results from your efforts quickly! 
I have successfully accumulated over 16 years of experience working with entrepreneurs. Let's talk about your business ideas, your challenges and develop a new strategic plan.  I'm here to help you follow your heart.  I'm here to help you succeed and make an impact.  
  
For Additional Meetup Times and Information:  
Please visit www.sabrinaward.com/Converse_Over_Coffee.html 
or 
email Sabrina at sabrina@sabrinaward.com to discuss a time to converse. 
  
* Join Sabrina's electronic mailing list to stay informed about future workshops and updates: Sign-up at mailinglist@sabrinaward.com. Please note, I do not sell, rent or trade any names on my emailing list. Your information will only be used to send messages from www.sabrinaward.com.

description.text: Turn Tucson into a giant game board with this fun scavenger hunt adventure. Combine the excitement of the Amazing Race with a three-hour city tour. Guided from any smart phone, teams make their way among well-known and overlooked gems of the city, solving clues and completing challenges while learning local history. Start when you want and play at your pace.  Price is per team, not per person. Find details and Redeem your ticket as a Prepaid Code online at www.UrbanAdventureQuest.com.

organizer.name: Botanica at the Farm at South Mountain

description.text:
Join us for Yoga in the Grove!   
  
Check-in at Botanica before class begins, and then meet us on the north west side of the grove.  You will need to bring a yoga mat.   


  


Take your weekend to a new level of relaxation and well being!  There is no better combination than yoga and nature and The Farm at South Mountain is just the place.  Join us for an All-levels yoga practice, led by Deborah Goff.  Beginners and experienced students will enjoy a class that incorporates pranayama (breathing techniques), meditation, and asana (postures) designed to build balance, strength, flexibility and unify mind, body and spirit.  Modifications will be given to allow this class to benefit every person.   


  


We look forward to seeing old friends and making new ones this season!

description.text:
Small Group Lessons  
@ "The Moon" 
  

Do you want to get the attention of private instruction at a fraction of the cost? Ask up to 4 of your teammates to go in on a group lesson! 
  
 *Important Information* 
  

Although lessons are generally done on the weekends, the event dates listed above are not 100% accurate, they are simply a listing. 
If you would like to schedule a lesson call (602)688-4759 or email us at madebaseball@gmail.com
DO NOT MAKE A PAYMENT ONLINE(payment is made via cash or check directly to MADE in person)
Lessons can possibly be scheduled for weekdays as per availability of our MADE instructors and the player/family (we will always try to be as flexible as possible in order to make it work)


When: By Appointment (usually weekends, some weekday availability)
Where: Moon Valley High School (Varsity Baseball Field)
Wear/bring: full baseball gear - pants, spikes, glove, bat, and also turf/running shoes for the cage if you prefer
BRING YOUR OWN WATER

 

For Small Group Baseball Lessons in Arizona with MADE Baseball call Isaac at (602)688-4759 or email us at madebaseball@gmail.com to set up your first session today! Let us know that you heard about us on Eventbrite and receive $20 off your first lesson! 

 
Contact us to schedule a group lesson today! We can answer any other questions you may have.
 
*Up to 5 players per 1.5 hour lesson. Price is the same regardless of the number of players. It is the responsibility of the players/families to form the group and divide the cost.
 
 
 
One of our Professional MADE Baseball Instructors will train your small group of (up to 5)players on the one or more of the following aspects of the game(you can choose to work on up to 2 of the 3):  
  
Hitting 

How to be more self-sufficient when it comes to improving their game
Swing Mechanics
Bat Speed
Mental Approach
Situational Hitting
Hitting to all parts of the Field
Core hitting strength
Hitting homework and easy to implement drills
and much more

 
Pitching


How to become more self-sufficient when it comes to improving their game
BCD's - Brain Conditioning Drills, MADE's proprietary pitching mechanics program
Pitching Mechanics
Different pitches and pitch grips
Proper pitching training techniques
Mental Approach to pitching
Situational Pitching - When to throw what pitch and why?
Pitching to both sides of the plate
PFPs - Pitcher's Fielding Practice
Pick off moves
Arm Care program(resistance bands, jobes, isometric exercises, and more)
Pitching homework and easy to implement drills
and much more

 
Fielding


General fielding mechanics 
Proper infield positioning, angles and approaching the ball
IF throwing mechanics
Concept and philosophy
Communication and Leadership
Take home drills
and much more



  
Expectations, Details, and FAQ's 
  

  
Four Things players can expect from Small Group Lessons:: 

1. Work at a high intensity with Professional Instructor. 2. Learn proper baseball form and techniques. 3. Receive drill homework to work on your own at home. 4. Have a lot of fun! 

 


MADE Baseball 
ABOUT MADE 
MADE INSTRUCTORS 
PRIVATE BASEBALL LESSONS 
BASEBALL CAMPS IN PHOENIX 
MADE BLOG

description.text:
Friday Night Code-a-thons - Modding for Minecraft® 
  
  
Minecraft® Modding Class for Kids - A Night Out for Parents! 
CodaKid is a computer programming and game design studio for kids ages 7 - 14. CodaKid is located in Old Town Scottsdale, just a short walk from Fashion Square, restaurants, and the movie theater. We offer expert, small group instruction in Java while Modding the best selling game Minecraft®. 
  
What is a Code-a-Thon? 
A CodaKid code-a-thon is a regular Friday event from 6:30 to 8:30pm  in which our instructors prepare a fun coding challenge for participants. Students work for two hours to create a new Mod for Minecraft® while being mentored and given-hands on instruction by our coding instructors.  
  
Do I need to inform CodaKid that my child is attending a Friday event? 
Yes, please let us know so we can staff accordingly. 
  
What do kids learn? 
Kids learn Java while modifying (or “modding”) the best-selling game Minecraft®. Children will work with veteran game designers and coders, and walk away with knowledge of the foundations of computer programming. 
  
Is there an age limit to join the code-a-thon? 
We are currently accepting students between the ages of 6 - 14.  
  
What are my parking options getting to the event? 
There is public parking all around our building and a free parking garage two blocks away near Scottsdale Road and 4th Ave. 
  
How can I contact CodaKid with any questions? 
Our email is hello@codakid.com and our phone number is 480-405-2734. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No.  
  
What is the refund policy? 
If you are dissatisfied with your session, please let us know and we will issue a full refund.

description.text: I am a personal welness coach dedicated to helping others achieve their health and weight loss goals.
description.html: I am a personal welness coach dedicated to helping others achieve their health and weight loss goals.

description.text:
Ladies.. Let's start 2015 with Results, not Resolutions!!  This is a private community focused on health, fitness, nutrition and positivity.  It's a perfect opportunity for you to get in shape and meet new people.  We have created a judgement free zone, so no matter what your fitness level is or how many inches you want to lose, we are all here to support you!  Our FREE boot camp meets every Tuesday and Thursday at 6:30 PM in Avondale.  Please contact me for location details. 
Workouts are held outdoors so please dress weather appropriate.  Bring a towel or mat, water and your friends!!  You will get a full body workout and will learn about other participant's results, how they got them and how you can start your journey!

description.text: The resounding drumbeat of American Indian culture in the Southwest will grow louder January through April 2015 with the return of Native Trails, presented by the Fort McDowell Yavapai Nation and produced by the Scottsdale Center for the Performing Arts. For the first time in its 13-year history, this series of free lunchtime performances in Scottsdale Civic Center Park will focus on passing the tradition of singing and dancing from one generation to the next. Derrick Suwaima Davis (Hopi/Choctaw), artistic director for Native Trails and seven-time hoop dance world champion, and other performers from the Hopi, Diné (Navajo), Hualapai and San Carlos Apache tribes will take the outdoor stage from 12 to 1 p.m. most Thursdays and Saturdays Jan. 8 through April 4, 2015. On Saturdays, youth performers will join the festivities as the dancers demonstrate the Eagle Dance, the Southwest Horse Dance, and inter-tribal pow wow dances.

  • BCD's - Brain Conditioning Drills, MADE's proprietary pitching mechanics program
  • Pitching Mechanics
  • Different pitches and pitch grips
  • Proper pitching training techniques
  • Mental Approach to pitching
  • Situational Pitching - When to throw what pitch and why?
  • Pitching to both sides of the plate
  • PFPs - Pitcher's Fielding Practice
  • Pick off moves
  • Arm Care program(resistance bands, jobes, isometric exercises, and more)
  • Pitching homework and easy to implement drills
  • and much more

Fielding
  • General fielding mechanics
  • Proper infield positioning, angles and approaching the ball
  • IF throwing mechanics
  • Concept and philosophy
  • Communication and Leadership
  • Take home drills
  • and much more

 Expectations, Details, and FAQ's

 


Four Things players can expect from Private Lessons::

 

1. Work at a high intensity with a Professional instructor.
2. Learn proper baseball form and techniques.
3. Receive drill homework to work on your own at home.
4. Have a lot of fun!


 MADE Baseball

description.text:
Register Now for this exclusive Wealth Building Event. Come attend a free 2hr real estate investing orientation in Scottsdale and learn how you can achieve financial freedom working with our national community of investors. No experience necessary.  Learn about the dual-income opportunity available through our marketing and educational systems.  

You can join our national community of real estate investors, get trained online & live at local events and workshops sponsored by leaders and community members so you can invest in real estate yourself or with us to build wealth for your family.
You can also get paid to help our community grow, share this experience and the education with others, and you can get paid $1,000 to $6,850 per qualified sale, get paid twice a week with commission checks mailed directly to you.

Real Estate Investing is a Team Sport and We Have a Real Estate Investing Education Program for Everyone. When YOU have an Educated and Structured team to work within your local area, then you can accomplish so Much More as a team.  Whether you like real estate or not, and you might not realize that you already are a real estate investor.  Our Local Events across the country give you the opportunity to network with like-minded entrepreneurs looking to maximize their earning potential. At this orientation, we will show you 

How the Renatus Real Estate Investing Education program is unmatched in the industry.
A plan that has assisted associates in our community to a net worth over a million dollars in controlled assets.
How you can be involved in the properties that we are involved in.
A working business model where you can work from home or our local offices instead of fighting traffic!
How you could be done interviewing for jobs for the rest of your life and comprehensively teach your children how to BE the same!

We create successful real estate investors and we have the results to prove that our system works. You must be coachable, willing to work very hard, dedicated, and most importantly passionate about creating long lasting, secure wealth through business ownership and real estate working with our national community of real estate investors. Renatus Community members have a goal of creating an educated community of Real Estate Investors nationwide!! Register above and come meet with us so that you can learn how you can get paid while you build wealth. 
No Muscle or Experience Needed! 
Get Motivated, Get Educated, and Get Compensated!! 
CHANGE YOUR FINANCIAL FUTURE, Register Above! 
IMP: To save time at meetings and to keep track of who is serious. All our associates and guests must be pre-registered for each meeting. You must confirm your registration by phone or replying to our confirmation email. Once confirmed, we will send you the confirmation email with the exact location of the event. We are serious about what we do, who we work with, and we want to make sure you are serious too. If you need immediate assistance, please use the contact link above.

description.text:
Data
Doctors is a 22 year old chain of computer service centers in the
United States, with locations in 20+ metropolitan areas. Founded in
1988, we have pioneered the business of providing top tier computer and
technology services to residential and small business customers. Unique
among our peers, all of our service centers are conveniently located in
retail areas that are easily accessible to both residential and
business customers. Additionally, we are one of the few companies in
the United States that has the facilities and expertise to perform
sophisticated hardware data recovery when a customer experiences the
failure of a computer hard drive. Our founder and CEO, Ken Colburn, is
featured weekly on CNN.com and along with CTO Brandon Disney host the
award winning Computer Corner radio show.
description.html: Data Doctors is a 22 year old chain of computer service centers in the United States, with locations in 20+ metropolitan areas. description.text:
Team Baseball Yoga Classes 
   
  

WHY YOGA? 
Has your youth baseball player ever heard of yoga? How about ever actually tried it? Do you realize that many of the injuries that occur to young baseball players can be prevented by teaching them to understand how to listen to their bodies through the practice of yoga? Yoga is all encompassing, mind, body, and spirit. It is an amazing way for anyone to create a rock-solid foundation for mental clarity and acuity, as well as physical stamina and durability.  
  
INFINITE BENEFITS 
Not only does yoga help improve your flexibility and keep you injury resistent, it also helps you to develop a deeper respect for your body by learning to understand how it works, moves, and responds to the poses you put it in. By practicing yoga we learn how to breath more consciously and to find comfort in uncomfortable spaces. This practice translates into an ability to stay ever-present on the playing field.    
  
YOGA AMBASSADORS 
MADE Baseball and Isaac Hess are huge ambassadors of yoga for the game of baseball and its youth players and families. Isaac received a total hip replacement at the age of 19 and pitched his entire 7 year professional career with it, never once being put on the DL(disabled list). He greatly attributes his successes and ability to overcome adversity to his foundational yoga practice, and desires to be someone that integrates yoga into the fundamental practices for amatuer and professional players alike. We at MADE Baseball know that one day, yoga will be the norm amongst all big league teams and it will be a mandatory practice amongst the masses of professional athletes everywhere. 
  
 *Important Information* 
  

Although Team Baseball Yoga Classes are generally done on the weekends, the event dates listed above are not 100% accurate, they are simply a listing. 
If you would like to schedule a Team Baseball Yoga Class (602)688-4759 or email us at madebaseball@gmail.com
DO NOT MAKE A PAYMENT ONLINE(payment is made via cash or check directly to MADE in person)
Team Baseball Yoga Classes can possibly be scheduled for weekdays as per availability of our MADE instructors and the player/family (Isaac will try to be as flexible as possible in order to make it work)


When: By Appointment (usually weekends, some weekday availability) 
Where: Location is determined by coach of team
Wear/bring: compression shorts(recommended), comfortable clothing, dry-fit gear recommended, a yoga mat, and a towel.
BRING YOUR OWN WATER

  
For Team Baseball Yoga Classes with MADE Baseball call Isaac at (602)688-4759 or email us at madebaseball@gmail.com to set up your first session today! Let us know that you heard about us on Eventbrite and receive $20 off your first class! 
  

 FEE STRUCTURE 
  
*The entire fee for class is given directly to MADE Baseball by the coach and/or team administrator prior to class. It is up to the team administrator to divide the relative cost amongst players. 
*Standard rate per one hour yoga class for a team is $150. (this price includes up to 15 players, additional players over 15 will be a cost of $5 extra per player, ie: 16 players = $155, 17 players =$160, etc)  
*If you would like your entire little league or club to experience a yoga class, the fee is a minimum of $150 and a maximum of $300 for a one hour class. There can be up to 100 players or more in class. As many players that can fit on in the outfield are welcomed to participate.  
*Parents, coaches, and siblings are STRONGLY ENCOURAGED to participate and can take their first class for FREE. It is vital that everyone in the team unit participates in order to better understand the practice, to identify with the value it holds for their players and themselves, and to learn the foundations of yoga in order to implement them into future team practices, stretch routines, and at home EVEryday practice. 
   

  
Our professional MADE Baseball Yoga Instructor will train your players on the following aspects of yoga: 
  
  

Fundamental Yoga Poses
Breathing techniques to help players stay present
Learning to listen to your body and gain a profound respect for what it is capable of
Mental clarity
Mind, Body, Spirit connection that translates into being a champion on and off the field
Learn to let go of ego
"Find the balance between the bulldog and the swan, fierce and graceful." 
And much more

 
  
 Expectations, Details, and FAQ's 
  

  
Four Things players can expect from Team Baseball Yoga Classes:: 
  

1. Develop a fundamental yoga practice with a MADE Yoga Expert. 2. Learn to respect and listen to what your body is telling you. 3. Receive yoga homework in order to maintain an EVEryday practice. 4. Have a lot of fun and challenge yourself to do things you have never done before! 
  


 MADE Baseball 

ABOUT MADE 
MADE INSTRUCTORS 
PRIVATE BASEBALL LESSONS 
BASEBALL CAMPS IN PHOENIX 
MADE BLOG

The purpose of the Green Valley Camera Club is to promote and develop skills in photography for its members, to foster an appreciation and understanding of photography and digital imaging as art and as a medium of communication, and to provide equipment, assistance and training, and to maintain facilities for the common good of its members.
In order to participate in classes, workshops and special interest groups (SIGs), you must be a member of the Green Valley Camera Club and GVR.

The purpose of the Green Valley Camera Club is to promote and develop skills in photography for its members, to foster an appreciation and understanding of photography and digital imaging as art and as a medium of communication, and to provide equipment, assistance and training, and to maintain facilities for the common good of its members.
In order to participate in classes, workshops and special interest groups (SIGs), you must be a member of the Green Valley Camera Club and GVR.

description.text:
In this Elements workshop, participants bring two or three photographs that they want improved on a flashdrive .  Linda Gregory demonstrates various methods of enhancing the photographs using Elements.  The participants are encouraged to contribute to this workshop by making their own suggestions.  This workshop is for all levels of Elements users, from beginner through advanced.  
This event is held in the Kino Room. 
No need for a ticket, just come in and join us!  NOTE:  On the Thursdays when there is a member's meeting, no workshop is held.  
You must be a member in good standing of the Green Valley Camera Club to enroll in this class.

description.text:
Join American Emergency Responce for CPR, Basic First Aid for Children, Infant and Adults and AED training. It's an excellent choice for both the community and workplace setting. We offer a great course for individuals who require or desire CPR/First Aid knowledge and skills.  
For anyone with limited or no medical training who needs a course completion card to meet job or other requirements. This also includes  emergency response teams in business and industry, school bus drives, adult residential care personnel, child care workers, teachers, parents and babysitters. 

  

Friday's Times: 8:00 AM & 2:00 PM 
Saturday's Time: 8:00 AM & 12:00 PM 
Capacity: OPEN 
Cost: $45*,  Call for special group rate of 3 and more 

  

Course short decription: 
First Aid, CPR and AED is a classroom, video-based, instructor-led course that teaches critical skills needed to respond to and manage a First Aid, choking or sudden Cardiac Arrest Emergency in the first few minutes until Emergency Medical Services (EMS) arrives. 

  
NOTES: 

Participants must be at least eight (8) years old
All classes are subject to change based on enrollment; however enrollees will be notified of any changes or cancellations.
Must wear comfortable clothing for class participation.

description.text:
Career Innovations is a Referral based executive recruitment firm. Headquarter in Charlotte, NC Career Innovations was developed to offer companies recruitment and placement solutions. We know your company’s success is based on your talent. 
Your talent controls your company’s destiny.  We also provide effective strategies and training to acquire the best human capital possible. We will work closely with our client’s human resources division to identify and analyze their challenges through process improvement.
Career Innovations utilizes the recruitment life cycle including: identifying candidates, qualifying skill-sets, pre-interviewing, presentation for review, extending offers, negotiating salaries, and closing deals.
We also offer our clients creative marketing tools such as, resume and cover letter development. This gives our clients seeking new opportunities an advantage over the competition. We pride ourselves in making our clients more marketable, and giving them a touch of uniqueness and professionalism which is highly valued in today’s competitive workforce.

description.text:
The Genesis Creation Science Institute is a creation science organization in the heart of Grand Canyon country dedicated to teaching the truth of Biblical creation for the origin of our universe, our world, and life as we know it.
We provide educational courses, presentations, and studies, as well as creation-themed trips, field work, and events. This includes hands-on educational classes and tours in various fields of study that cover many topics in the areas of Astronomy, Biology, Geology, Paleontology, and more.
The GCSI runs CreationTrip.com, where we provide trips and tours to various amazing wonders of God's creation in Northern Arizona and the Flagstaff area.
description.html:
The Genesis Creation Science Institute is a creation science organization in the heart of Grand Canyon country dedicated to teaching the truth of Biblical creation for the origin of our universe, our world, and life as we know it.

We provide educational courses, presentations, and studies, as well as creation-themed trips, field work, and events. This includes hands-on educational classes and tours in various fields of study that cover many topics in the areas of Astronomy, Biology, Geology, Paleontology, and more.

The GCSI runs CreationTrip.com, where we provide trips and tours to various amazing wonders of God's creation in Northern Arizona and the Flagstaff area.

description.text:
• Tour runs from 12pm-4pm • Entry Fee Included • Transportation Included • Pick-up location is the lobby of the Little America Hotel in Flagstaff • Please eat before you come and bring a water bottle  Walking tour will cover the history of the Sinuagua people who lived in the area and created the cliff dwellings seen there, as well as the geological formations found in Walnut Canyon, including the Kaibab Limestone and crossbedding of the Coconino Sandstone. 
Tour will include stepped walking trail down and back up. Short, but somewhat steep climb with lots of benches and stops to rest on the way back up.
description.html:
• Tour runs from 12pm-4pm
• Entry Fee Included
• Transportation Included
• Pick-up location is the lobby of the Little America Hotel in Flagstaff
• Please eat before you come and bring a water bottle

Walking tour will cover the history of the Sinuagua people who lived in the area and created the cliff dwellings seen there, as well as the geological formations found in Walnut Canyon, including the Kaibab Limestone and crossbedding of the Coconino Sandstone.

Tour will include stepped walking trail down and back up. Short, but somewhat steep climb with lots of benches and stops to rest on the way back up.

description.text:
•Tour runs from 12pm-4pm • Entry Fee included •Transportation included • Pick-up location is in the lobby of the Little America Hotel in Flagstaff • Please eat before you come and bring a water bottle 
Come explore Flagstaff's most recently formed cinder cone volcano and lava field!  Our guided tour will include a stop at the visitor's center full of information and hands-on displays, a 1 mile loop an the Lava Flow Trail, and history of the eruption and how it affected the local Native American Indians who lived in the area.

description.text:
This workshop is about you ending your own suffering.  Getting clarity on what it is that actually caused the emotional pain and suffering in the first place.  You have all the power.  TheWork.com is the home for The Work of Byron Kaite online.  This class series is a support group for learning or deepening your practice of The Work.   
There will be 5 classes for $125 total held on Sundays from 4 pm to 6 pm.  There are weeks of break in between to do The Work on your own or with a partner.

With over 15 years' experience,  We strive to meet your expectations ; offering a variety of services  to choose from. We hope to be your healthcare partner.
 
Precious Hands Healthcare also provide free community workshop, please visit our calendar for more details. "Empowering the community empowers us all"

description.text: CPR and AED program designed specifically for laypeople. The program is an excellent choice for both the community and workplace setting, and is based upon the 2010 International Consensus on Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Emergency Cardiovascular Care (ECC) Science with Treatment Recommendations (CoSTR) and other evidence-based treatment recommendations. A great program for  individuals who do not work in the healthcare field but are occupationally required to, or desire to, have CPR knowledge and skills, such as emergency response teams in business and industry, school bus drivers, adult residential care personnel, child care workers, teachers, parents, and babysitters.

description.text: CodaKid offers dynamic computer programming and video game design to children ages 6 to 14 using cutting edge tools such as Minecraft® Forge, Eclipes and more. Our coding instructors know how to make coding entertaining, and our classes encourage discovery, creative expression, and presentation.

description.text:
Arizona’s #1 Tech Class for Kids 
 CodaKid’s mission is to teach kids computer programing and game design concepts in a fun and dynamic environment. Our programs are run by talented and engaging professional coders and game designers who work with students in small groups while utilizing cutting edge technology. 
  
 

 

What do kids learn? 
Kids learn Java while modifying (or “modding”) the best-selling game Minecraft®. Children will work with veteran game designers and coders, and walk away with knowledge of the foundations of computer programming. 
  
What are my parking options getting to the class? 
We have 6 spaces behind our building that customers may use if available. There is public parking all around our building and a free parking garage two blocks away near Scottsdale Road and 4th Ave. 
  
How can I contact CodaKid with any questions? 
Our email is hello@codakid.com and our phone number is 480-405-2734. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No.  
  
What is the refund policy? 
If you are dissatisfied with your session, please let us know and we will issue a full refund.

description.text:
Evening Boot Camp at Attitude First! 
At Elluminate Wellness, we accept people of all shapes and sizes and all levels of fitness. You won’t be forced to do any more than you are capable of accomplishing safely. No one will leave unchallenged. Every day is something a little different, but each day you can expect some circuit training, intervals, plyometrics, calistenics, and ab work. Tally Ho!

description.text:
Tiffany came to Power in Motion in September of this year. Since the beginning of 2014, she was training/apprenticing at a functional fitness facility. She recently attended her CrossFit Level 1 Course in Las Vegas at Crossfit Max Effort. In a few weeks she will be getting her CrossFit Kids Certification in Arizona.
Background:Tiffany has had a love for fitness since high school. She took weight-lifting classes all four years, and ran track for one year. Over the years she has tried different types of training and it wasn’t until she got into CrossFit and attended the CrossFit Games that she fell in love with the sport. She enjoys trail running and any sport that takes her outdoors.
Races:After joining the team at PIM, she completed her first Spartan Race in Temecula, CA…which happened to be a Spartan Beast! Recently she completed another Spartan Race and placed in the top ten in her age group. Back in 2010 she completed her first ½ Marathon in Washington, D.C. – The 1st Anniversary Woodrow Wilson ½ Marathon. Soon after that she completed The 100th Anniversary Cherry Blossom 10-miler in Washington, D.C.
Tiffany currently is coaching our Women’s program – PowHer Fit, managing the facility, running our retail area, planning events, social media, and will soon be helping to expand our kids program and birthday parties.
CERTIFICATIONS
CrossFit Level 1 Certified
Follow me on Instagram: @tmilliman13
tiffanypowerinmotion@gmail.com

description.text:
Class Times: Monday, Wednesday, and Friday @10am and 6pm. First three classes are free. 
Stepping into any type of gym for the first time can be a little intimidating and overwhelming. At Power in Motion we designed a program to fit the needs of women, by creating a comfortable “women’s only” environment that allows women to workout without feeling intimidated by the people around them. Workouts are designed for you to reach your highest level while maintaining good form and technique. All current fitness levels are welcome and every workout is customized to fit your needs. Our women have had amazing results and I am proud to say one of them got first place in our last competition for her age group! You CAN be strong and lean!  
www.powerinmotioninstitute.com 
  
FAQs 
  
Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? 
480-371-4297 
tiffanypowerinmotion@gmail.com 
  
Is my registration/ticket transferrable? 
Yes

description.text:
Looking for a way to turn Phoenix into a giant game board?   Urban Adventure Quest has created an interactive scavenger hunt that combines the fun of the Amazing Race with a three-hour sightseeing tour of Phoenix.  Guided from any smart phone, groups make their way among well-known and overlooked gems of the city, solving clues and completing challenges while learning local history.  The adventure begins near the Herberger Theater Center and takes you on a well-designed course among historic and cultural sights of the city.   
The tour will take you to the Arizona Center, Heritage Square, the County Courthouse and the Orpheum Theater and requires approximately 2 miles of walking.  Using a smart phone as “the guide” allows participants to start when they want and determine their own pace of play.  Stop to enjoy some of the outdoor art or grab a bite to eat along the way….why not, it’s your schedule?   
Available 365 days a year from Sunrise to Sunset.  Offered at a fixed price for a group vs. per person pricing, this city tour/game offers a great value to those on a budget.  www.UrbanAdventureQuest.com.
